story:
Background

My name is Obie Williams and I am an author. However, while writing is my greatest passion, it is also something I can only indulge in during limited free time. My first novel, The Crimes of Orphans, took nearly ten years to complete and self-publish, largely due to the fact that I could only work on it between work, college, and starting a family. Its sequel, The Undoing of Tomorrow, is currently at 65% first-draft completion, but still requires at least 200 hours of work to bring it close to a publish-ready state.

A Rare Opportunity

As many who know me personally are aware, I spent the latter part of 2019 and the early part of 2020 seeking a new full-time career path. Fortunately, great news came my way in the first week of February: I was offered (and have accepted) what could be a perfect new job for me! But there's a catch...the job doesn't start until April 1st (no foolin').

So, faced with the prospect of scrounging for piecemeal gig work while awaiting my new career to begin, I had a wonderful (and/or insane) idea. What if I could write full-time during that six-week waiting period? For the first time in my life, I could experience a brief taste of something I've always dreamed of doing: working on a novel 40 hours per week. However, this will require some funding, and that's...

Where You Come In

After crunching some budget numbers, I have figured out that I could squeak by writing full-time on an income of just $250 per week. This would supplement my family's income enough to keep our bills paid and food in our fridge while I embark on this daring journey. If I work 40 hours per week on the book, this comes to only $6.25/hour, but it is more than anything I have ever made in advance for writing before. What it is really buying is peace of mind. The knowledge that I can throw myself into my writing completely without having to worry about finding and engaging in side jobs while waiting for my new career to begin.

The Rewards

As you can see from the perks tiers, contribution is not without its benefits. The first few tiers are structured intentionally to act as pre-purchasing of the book at its intended sale prices, so you are effectively giving me an advance on what you would pay upon the book's release. The $5 tier earns you a copy of the ebook, whereas the $15 tier nabs you a paperback copy and the ebook, which saves you a bit of coin compared to buying the two separately after release.

From there, the rewards only get better, up to and including an opportunity to participate in early reading and reviews, a chance at having a character named after you or a loved one, and even a gift of limited-run hardcover editions of The Undoing of Tomorrow and/or The Crimes of Orphans!

My Promise

I would never dream of accepting your money for this endeavor without some guarantee that you will receive the perk(s) I am offering. To show that I take that matter seriously, I am setting myself a hard publication deadline of February 1st, 2021. My ultimate goal is to publish the book before the end of 2020, but I also recognize that life sometimes throws unexpected curveballs. Regardless, if for some unforeseeable reason I am unable to publish this novel by February 1st, 2021, all donors will be offered a full refund. I will do everything in my power to make sure this will not even come close to being a necessity, but I want the guarantee to be there nonetheless. It keeps me accountable and (hopefully) gives you greater confidence about investing in my work.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can contribute financially. Anything you can offer is greatly appreciated, but even if it's not monetary in nature, you can still be helpful by sharing this campaign with others. Exposure is a big deal, and quite helpful in its own right.

Thank you, every single one of you, for your love and support of my creative endeavors. Sharing my stories is my greatest dream, but it would be nothing without folks like you with whom to share them.

So once again, thank you.
Obie Williams
story_txt:
Background
My name is Obie Williams and I am an author. However, while writing is my greatest passion, it is also something I can only indulge in during limited free time. My first novel, The Crimes of Orphans, took nearly ten years to complete and self-publish, largely due to the fact that I could only work on it between work, college, and starting a family. Its sequel, The Undoing of Tomorrow, is currently at 65% first-draft completion, but still requires at least 200 hours of work to bring it close to a publish-ready state.
A Rare Opportunity
As many who know me personally are aware, I spent the latter part of 2019 and the early part of 2020 seeking a new full-time career path. Fortunately, great news came my way in the first week of February: I was offered (and have accepted) what could be a perfect new job for me! But there's a catch...the job doesn't start until April 1st (no foolin').
So, faced with the prospect of scrounging for piecemeal gig work while awaiting my new career to begin, I had a wonderful (and/or insane) idea. What if I could write full-time during that six-week waiting period? For the first time in my life, I could experience a brief taste of something I've always dreamed of doing: working on a novel 40 hours per week. However, this will require some funding, and that's...

Where You Come In
After crunching some budget numbers, I have figured out that I could squeak by writing full-time on an income of just $250 per week. This would supplement my family's income enough to keep our bills paid and food in our fridge while I embark on this daring journey. If I work 40 hours per week on the book, this comes to only $6.25/hour, but it is more than anything I have ever made in advance for writing before. What it is really buying is peace of mind. The knowledge that I can throw myself into my writing completely without having to worry about finding and engaging in side jobs while waiting for my new career to begin.
The Rewards
As you can see from the perks tiers, contribution is not without its benefits. The first few tiers are structured intentionally to act as pre-purchasing of the book at its intended sale prices, so you are effectively giving me an advance on what you would pay upon the book's release. The $5 tier earns you a copy of the ebook, whereas the $15 tier nabs you a paperback copy and the ebook, which saves you a bit of coin compared to buying the two separately after release.From there, the rewards only get better, up to and including an opportunity to participate in early reading and reviews, a chance at having a character named after you or a loved one, and even a gift of limited-run hardcover editions of The Undoing of Tomorrow and/or The Crimes of Orphans!

My ultimate goal is to publish the book before the end of 2020, but I also recognize that life sometimes throws unexpected curveballs. Regardless, if for some unforeseeable reason I am unable to publish this novel by February 1st, 2021, all donors will be offered a full refund. I will do everything in my power to make sure this will not even come close to being a necessity, but I want the guarantee to be there nonetheless. It keeps me accountable and (hopefully) gives you greater confidence about investing in my work.

story:
Tasked with developing mind control technology, a cybersecurity programmer turns rogue to save Mankind from a telepathic manipulative boy.

Reality today is quickly catching up to Science Fiction

ENTANGLEMENT is a story about mind control and freedom in the context of our choices. I need your help to publish it now as a graphic novel to reach the younger audience. I feel that we're running out of time – reality, it seems, is quickly catching up to the "dystopian future" setting of the script’s story. Microchip implants, mind control, the fight for our survival (you’ll find the synopsis at the bottom of the page) – all of this looms if we fail to see the bigger picture and to make some difficult choices in our lives.

The choices that we make – intentionally or automatically – and the impact they have on our lives are the reason why ENTANGLEMENT is so relevant today. I want to engage young people and to inspire them to make their choices consciously. To accomplish this, I feel that I need to make ENTANGLEMENT available as soon as possible, published as a graphic novel. With this campaign I’m raising funds to pay an artist/illustrator to create the visuals for this book (to give life to the script). I want you to help me positively influence the young generation, and to establish conscious storytelling as a movement, as a viable and effective way to inspire and empower people.

It takes one person to change the world. That person is You.

It will take approximately 9 months and $9 000 for the graphic artist to create roughly 450 illustrations that will complete this feature-length graphic novel. I’ve put together several contribution levels, which contain various ways to express my gratitude for your support. But perhaps the biggest perk you get for your contribution is knowing that you’re ushering in a better world by supporting the production of this freedom-affirming story.

With everything going on in the world right now, I feel that the stakes are too high to wait any longer. Even if I will not reach my goal of crowdsourcing $9 000, I will still do everything in my power to complete and publish ENTANGLEMENT. I really believe that this story can catalyze the next step in our evolution.

What if you cannot donate?

You can still help! If you resonate with my goal to inspire young people and to create a positive impact, please help me spread the word by sharing this campaign with your tribe. You will find various ways to share in the right sidebar of this page.

This is our time to make a difference. Please help me change the world.

ENTANGLEMENT synopsis (a couple spoilers)

In a docile and fearful Boston in 2051 cars and bikes fly – and continue to pollute the environment. S.G.O.A. [Security of Government Organizations Agency] – the one-world-government organization, which enforces mandatory ID microchip implants on the entire human population, allegedly to keep people safe – drenches the whole world in fear to maintain its control.

After not having seen each other for 4 years, Nick – a successful cybersecurity specialist – meets his college friend Kate at the funeral of their professor. Kate reveals to Nick that their professor, who invented a quantum processor, was murdered for refusing to cooperate with S.G.O.A. With the help of a stolen prototype, Kate shows Nick that this technology is already in use – everyone’s thoughts are being monitored via their ID microchip implants. When Nick and Kate delve into the code to see if they can put a stop to this, they discover programmatic attempts to technologically control people’s minds as well. S.G.O.A. detects Nick and Kate tinkering with their ID implants and show up at their doorstep, forcing the protagonists to flee from the agency, digitally covering their tracks.

Their further delve into government secrets yields an entire world of hidden and suppressed technology – ways to control gravity, and to extract energy from the fabric of spacetime itself. Nick and Kate discover that this technology can potentially clean up the environment and turn the skies blue again…

S.G.O.A. director Carnegie reveals that he is after the same thing as the protagonists – he, too, wants to save the Earth. His intentions, however, are very different: to achieve his goal he prepares to drastically depopulate the planet, and he needs Nick to write the mind control program to accomplish this.

But Carnegie is only a figure in someone else’s game of chess. The originator of the plan to kill 90% of the Earth’s population is Kyle – a 7-year-old telepathic boy with a vendetta against the world. Kyle and his twin sister Eve, who is also telepathic, were physically abused by their stepfather. When the twins went to school, their peers almost killed them for having psychic powers. Before they ran away from home, Kyle and Eve both swore to change the world: Kyle made the choice to take revenge on the world, while Eve swore to love and protect it.

In a race against time, Eve helps the protagonists to fight back against Kyle and his puppet S.G.O.A. It becomes up to Nick, Kate and Eiichiro to make the difficult, life-threatening decisions and fight against an entire army that’s out to destroy them.

story:
I was asked relatively early on in my path of providing translations for and writing books on Japanese swords to produce something on gendaitô. I then always promised to do so but kept postponing such a project, on the one hand because I was so occupied with providing information on older swords, i.e. kotô, shintô, and shinshintô, and on the other hand because I did not yet have an idea about how to tackle this topic in the first place. Several relevant books had been published that deal with the post-Meiji sword world and the most important smiths of that era so I didn’t want to ruminate and write the same thing just with other words. Listening to inquiries I get on a regular basis on gendaitô however, it emerged that what was mostly needed was information on these smiths and references of their work. Thus I decided that when I am tackling the topic gendaitô, it should be more a database with CV’s of swordsmiths etc. rather than a history book.

 

In this sense, I started to collect gendaitô-related data and announced on several platforms, e.g. my website and the Nihonto Message Board, that I was looking for relevant references. This was in summer of 2014. Planned was a book that introduces in an alphabetical order as many as possible gendaitô smiths but then throughout 2015 and up to early 2016, I had received so much data that I started to think of a two-pronged approach. In other words, there is no way to fit all these gigabytes into a single physical book and I also didn’t want to have important references rot on my HD. Thus a comprehensive online database suggested itself which is easy to extend and which also allows corrections and amendments whenever new data comes in.

Long story short, there will be a book (and an eBook) that lists all the gendaitô smiths I have in my records so far and what is known on each of them (as mentioned, as comprehensive as possible). There will be references in the form of oshigata and blade pictures and also portrait photos of some of the smiths will be provided. Parallel to that, I want to create the mentioned online database which should look something like seen in this link (https://gendaitoproject.wordpress.com/). For doing so, I need funds to cover the time necessary to feed the database over the coming months and to maintain it in the years to come. I thought that the database should be free and accessible for everyone who is looking for relevant information and that is why I decided to tackle this is a one-time crowdfunding instead of a pay to play or an individual subcription approach. And this is why I need your help to create the most comprehensive database on gendaitô smiths and to preserve information on them for future generations!

story:
My name is Ted Oswald, and I’m a lawyer, author, and new father to a little boy (yikes!). Back in 2012, I successfully crowdfunded the release of a ‘nonprofit novel’ called Because We Are, a moving mystery story set in Haiti with net profits donated to charity. Readers liked the book, enough that it was later acquired and re-published in a beautiful new edition by Amazon Publishing. 

Two years ago, I had the idea for a new and compelling story set in India. In 2015, I traveled to New Delhi to research it, and connected with remarkable nuns from Mother Teresa’s Missionaries of Charity and dedicated groups serving sex workers and their vulnerable children.

And so Little Flower, my most creative, engrossing story yet, was born.

Human trafficking and modern-day slavery are oppressive realities in India, but there are some shining lights working to right these wrongs. Just as I wanted Because We Are to leap beyond the page and impact lives, Little Flower will be a tool to inspire readers and help support the work of change-making organizations, Sari Bari, Kat Katha and International Justice Mission.

By contributing to this campaign at any level, you will:

·       Support me and my growing family in this crazy writing venture

·       Help share an important novel with the world about hope and transformation

·       Sustain important work fighting modern-day slavery

What’s not to love?

What's Little Flower about?

Little Flower chronicles the unique bond shared by two damaged souls: Sister Shanti, a mischievous, elderly nun from Mother Teresa’s Missionaries of Charity, and Meeta, a young prostitute with dreams of a life lived outside the brothel. Thrown together when a young man they love is murdered, they embark upon a darkly comic journey through New Delhi’s underbelly in a search to understand the curious crime that has stolen him. As they plunge ever deeper into mystery and peril, they are forced to confront a cast of colorful characters and the contradictions that run through the center of every human soul, all before arriving at an unforgettable final revelation that shocks as much as it inspires. 

Utterly endearing and completely moving, Little Flower stands as a testament to the wild and unwieldy power of love in its many forms.

What other books is Little Flower like?

The Life of Pi. A Thousand Splendid Suns. The Ministry of Utmost Happiness. The God of Small Things. The Vish Puri Mysteries. The White Tiger. A Walk Across the Sun.

 

Read a sample | Listen to a sample

 

 

In 2003, while a college student, I was first confronted with the realities of modern-day slavery. It’s a pernicious violation of victims' rights and a problem rooted in inequality and exploitation of vulnerable children, women, and men. India has the ignominious honor of hosting the largest number of modern-day slaves, an estimated 18 million people.

18 million people. Let that sink in a moment.

That’s why every contribution to this campaign, no matter the size, will have a portion donated to one of the following life-changing organizations:

Sari Bari – A 'freedom business,' creating opportunities for formerly-trafficked women, employing them to create beautiful things. Donations help their work grow and provide former slaves with alternative livelihoods.

Kat Katha - An Indian organization working to improve the lives of the 2,500 women and children in the brothels of G.B. Road, Delhi's red light district and the setting for Little Flower.

International Justice Mission – Rescuing modern-day slaves in India and around the world and supporting them with social services to reintegrate into society.

Your generosity will be rewarded! If you contribute, here’s what you can expect:

  • My undying gratitude, regardless of pledge level
  • Every pledge includes a charitable donation to the organization of your choice
  • For every pledge above $35, you get a physical copy of the book PLUS an ebook copy to keep or give away to a friend
  • You will get exclusive access to your copy of the book 1-2 months before it’s available anywhere else
  • All hardcover copies are part of a limited edition print run and will be hand numbered and signed by me. They are ONLY available through this campaign.

Here are the rewards and corresponding donation amounts:

How will my contribution be spent?

The goal is to raise $8,000 for the project. A portion of every contribution will be donated, and you get to choose which organization it benefits. Beyond this, I need funding to help cover or recoup book production costs, like cover design and editing, audiobook production, and a modest budget for marketing. Indiegogo takes a cut of every contribution, too. Based on my prior crowdfunding experience, I expect each dollar to be spent as follows:

Risks & Challenges

Worry not! I’ve got a great team of professionals on my publishing team and we’re carrying the book to the finish line. If the campaign doesn’t reach its goal, the manuscript is written and some economizing can help ensure your contributor awards arrive on schedule. All donations will be made in the amounts promised according to the pledges received.  

Here are some of the team members:

Mark Ecob – A gifted cover-designer and art director, Mark has tackled covers for the UK editions of The No. 1 Ladies Detective Agency, A Monster Calls, and The Life of Pi.

Dhiren Bhal – The director of Wordsway Copy Editing, based in the New Delhi-area, Dhiren is helping ensure proper punctuation and the authenticity of the story. 

Zehra Jane Naqvi – An accomplished actress and audiobook narrator, Zehra will bring Little Flower and its unique cast of characters to life.

Michael Benson –  A talented copy editor and proofreader, Mike has worked on every book project of mine since Because We Are.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t make a financial pledge? Help spread the word about this campaign (just use share tools up above) and start supporting the important work of Sari Bari, Kat Katha and International Justice Mission. You can always get your own copy of Little Flower once it’s in stores.

Let's make something beautiful together.

Back the book, get rewarded, and help me reach my goal.

 

In it together,

story:
My story

My name is Anca Fota, I am a dietitian, I love working with people and I also love to cook, to eat and to share with others the best recipes I make in my kitchen.

I live in Romania, a beautiful country in Eastern Europe, with wonderful people and a delicious traditional cuisine, with influences throughout history from many other countries.

I started my dietitian career almost 3 years ago, at age of 29 years old, when I finally realized that I am free to follow my passion, to do what I like and live a happy life. I graduated a nutrition course and I started helping people to feel good in their body and to eat what they like, but with some small changes so they can lose weight and after that to maintain.

I love working with people, encouraging them that they deserve a happy life, that they are great people, they should love themselves just the way they are and, if they want to change something in their weight, I am there to guide them, to listen to them and to make things possible.

However, I believe that I have a small part in there, they are the main actor, they must have the desire to change, and I am there only to support and to guide them.

In practice I could observe that people would like to eat healthier, but they believe that healthy food is not so tasty. This is how I got to work on finding a way of preparing different dishes in a healthier way, but also with a great taste. Now my work is a real success, people lose weight and maintain very easy because they have changed some small habits, they eat what they like and they are happier.

In my book, I want to share with you, some of the most refined and delicious recipes of pancakes from all over the world, but also adapted, from my dietitian perspective, to have as few calories as possible, but the same great taste as the original recipe.

I have prepared 52 recipes, one new recipe for every weekend of the year, so Saturday or Sunday, you can indulge your family or your life partner with a great recipe of pancakes cooked with love.

I will share with you, with all my love, one of the most exquisite recipe, Nalesniki, thin pancakes filled with fine cheese and garnished with fresh raspberries sauce and fresh fruits. The original recipe is from Eastern Europe countries and Russia, with small differences from country to country.

My adapted recipe looks like you could see in my presentation video, is very tasty and very easy to prepare. I dare you to try it as soon as you can!

All the ingredients are enough for 6 portions.

Ingredients for the batter:

  • 3 large eggs (at room temperature);
  • 20g (2 tablespoons) of organic stevia sweetener (instead of sugar);
  • Pinch of salt;
  • 60g of melted butter (but not too hot);
  • 240ml of milk (at room temperature);
  • 20g (2 tablespoons) of almond flour;
  • 100g of rice flour.

You can put all the ingredients in a blender and mix it all together, or, you can use a whisk and mix the ingredients in the exact order from the list. You leave the batter to rest for 30 minute, and after that you can start and cook the pancakes in a non-stick pan.

In the meantime, you can prepare the filling and the raspberries sauce.

Ingredients for the filling:

  • Mascarpone cheese 250g;
  • Ricotta cheese 250g;
  • 20g (2 tablespoons) of organic stevia sweetener (instead of sugar);
  • Pinch of salt;
  • Vanilla extract;
  • Lemon zest (from 1 fresh lemon);
  • 1 large egg.

You can put all the ingredients in a large bowl and mix it with a mixer, or you can mix it with a tablespoon for about 5 minutes. You keep the filling in the fridge until you finish cooking the pancakes.

Ingredients for the raspberries sauce:

  • 300g of fresh raspberries (or you can use frozen raspberries);
  • 50g (5 tablespoons) of organic stevia sweetener (instead of sugar);
  • 2 tablespoons of lemon juice;
  • 100ml of water.

You cook the raspberries in a small pot, not too long, just until the sweetener is dissolving and the raspberries break. After this, you have to use a strainer and remove the raspberries seeds, so you can have a fine sauce. You keep the sauce in the fridge until the pancakes are ready to serve.

After you cook all the batter, you should get 12 thin pancakes, you fill every pancake with the mixed cheese, you put them in a baking vessel and cook in the oven for 15 minutes.

When you are ready to serve, you put 2 filled pancakes in a deep plate, 3-4 tablespoons of raspberries sauce and some fresh fruits. I used fresh cranberries and raspberries.

Nutritional values for one portion:

Protein - 13g;

Fat – 34g;

Carbohydrates – 23g;

Fiber – 4.6g;

Calories – 450kcal.

This dish is good to be eaten at breakfast, as a brunch or a dessert.

Enjoy!

If you like this recipe and if you would love to be a supporter, I invite you to select your favorite perk and to join with me in this wonderful journey.

With all my love,

Anca

contact@ancafota.ro

What is this all about?

What do we do now? It's a question in the air. What I'm doing now is to go all in on a project with all my heart and all of my time. I have a story that urgently needs telling. First the story begat articles, and then a blog, and then talks and presentations, and then a book proposal. Now I’ve sold my book to a publisher. I’m turning to you to midwife this child.

The neglected story I have to tell touches on immigration, on questions of ethnicity and race, on the wages of industrialization and de-industrialization, and on religious strife in the USA. It reflects on questions of what it means to be an American, and on the timely subject of what it means to be white-identified and working class.

My book presents a criminally neglected segment of history: the cross-border emigration of French-Canadians and Acadians to the Northeast USA mostly from 1865 to 1930. But if this is a book that recounts an old, obscure episode about a localized population then I will have failed. I'm taking the story of the Franco-Americans to a general, English-speaking, North American audience because it speaks to unresolved conflicts of U.S. (and Canadian) history.

We who are the descendants of these immigrants often comment on how invisible our culture is to the world at large. Make a bid for visibility. It is time for all the stories to be told.

Why am I asking for help?

I need your help because I need to complete the research and writing of the book. I have written about 20% of the draft and have much working material in various stages of completion, as well as loads of research.

I need your help to finance three things.

  • Access to information: Since I am not affiliated with a university library I need to buy my way in to sources of information. Examples:  I could use access to JSTOR and other services that charge subscription fees. I need to buy books and articles. I need to pay fees to use libraries such as the New England Historic and Genealogical Society library in Boston. Information isn’t cheap.
     
  • Travel: I need to go to places where information lives. Examples: I plan to approach the Baker Library at Harvard which has manuscript records of New England’s textile mills from the 19th and 20th centuries. I need to go to Brunswick, Maine to complete my case study of that town's Cabot Mill. I may need to travel to Quebec to examine sources in the archives there. Travel is expensive.
     
  • Time: Excursions to far away libraries take time. I need time to sit in archives for hours and days, examining the primary sources that are the major components of my narrative. I need time to study what I’ve found away from the library, comparing this bit to that bit. I need time to write and re-write and then re-write some more. I am a free-lance writer by trade. When I’m not writing for a paid client I’m unemployed. I’m asking for your support to allow me to apply to my own writing project the same concentration that I would put into work for a client. Money buys time to work.

What’s my background?

For 20 years I have worked as a freelance writer, researcher, and editor for businesses, non-profit organizations, consulting firms, and authors. Before that, I worked for a management consulting start-up, as an analyst for an IP research firm, and was a researcher for a reference book published by Oxford University Press. I'm also a musician. 

My blog French North America has received tens of thousands of page reads. I am also an administrator of the Facebook group French Canadian Descendants, which has grown to a membership of over 5600.

I have spoken at Tufts University, Bowdoin College, Colby College, the University of Maine at Orono, The Open Center (New York, NY), the Pejepscot Historical Society (Brunswick, Maine), the Franco-American Center of Manchester, NH and other venues.

My work has been featured in Le Forum, the quarterly, bilingual publication of the Franco-American Center at the University of Maine. Bloggers published by two of Maine’s largest daily newspapers, the Portland Press Herald and the Bangor Daily News, have featured my work. I have also published on the blog Red Cedar, edited by Great Lakes French-Canadian writer James LaForest. I was an expert contributor to a short film about the Ku Klux Klan in New England and I was interviewed on camera for a film about Biddeford, Maine’s first Franco-American. In September 2016, I was on a panel at the University of Maine, Orono on the topic of the 14th Amendment and Franco-Americans.

Where can you learn more about my project?

I have made available my book synopsis. Please see my blog for samples of my writing and research on this topic. You can also listen to a podcast I recorded for the show A Million Friends. Or you can watch a video of one of my presentations. My professional website has more information on my writing and editing work.

What more can you do?

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends and on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.). Use the handy Indiegogo share tools!
  • Use text, email, phone, any means possible to talk up this campaign and this book.
  • Please tell a friend or friends, co-workers, relatives, etc. about this book.
  • Visit my blog. It’s R&D for my book.
  • Buy my book when it's published.
  • Mention to a friend that Franco-Americans exist. (They're not a brand of canned pasta!)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dr. Nathan Taylor, PhD. I am an Army veteran with PTSD. I have struggled with my illness for years. I now know that effective communication is the key to healing. Impaired communication may prevent veterans from receiving adequate care for other illnesses, and from facilitating meaningful relationships. Veterans are not alone with illness. Many people are impacted by PTSD, its not just a military illness.  By contributing to my campaign you will be giving me the opportunity to publish my book and market it to VA facilities across the USA and beyond. The book will also be available to the public to assist civilians with the illness.  I currently have a VA facility interested in purchasing a bulk order as soon as I am able to publish.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $7000.00 to get the book published. I have been able to secure enough for the cover art and to print the cover. The money will be used for publishing the book. The contributions will be going directly into an account specifically set up for the publishing. If I am not able to raise the full amount during the campaign, the funds will remain in the publishing account and I will continue to fund raise.

The Impact

Contributing to my campaign will allow me to be able to teach veterans and medical providers how to effectively communicate with each other, with other veterans and with the public. There are several proven methods of communication. My book describes these methods in detail. Not only how to use them, but what my happen when aggressive communication takes place instead of effective communication. By learning how to communicate it gives people with PTSD the ability to obtain an maintain a job, meaningful relationships, and deal with stressful situations in a constructive manner. I am not asking for the contributions to better myself, but to better my veteran brothers/sisters that I see struggling everyday. The foundation of my book is to help providers elicit critical information during an initial exam, This is where effective communication is crucial. Interpersonal skills on the part of the health provider can help shape a patient and their families outlook regarding care.   

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges I see ahead is getting people to just read the book and realize the importance of effective communication. I am qualified to overcome this obstacle by telling my own story. I have been homeless, worked with the VA to bring myself up, and obtain my PhD. I can use my own struggles with PTSD and how learning effective communication has empowered me o be in control of my illness instead of it controlling me.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate would you please spread the word and let everyone know about my campaign. The sooner I can publish my book, the sooner I can start teaching. Please use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Paula Hatfield. I am a reading specialist and have been a teacher of students of all ages for over twenty years. I know how important a favorite story can be in a child's development. Everyone has times of sadness. My daughter and I created this story as an antidote for our own sadness while driving home from visiting friends who had moved far away. Putting in the various people made us laugh and made us feel better because, while no real person is depicted, the characters reminded us of the great friends we were leaving and the great friends we were going back to in our neighborhood. I have long dreamed of writing children's books. This book is even more special because my darling daughter, Lauren, helped to write it. You could help me realize me dream. We enlisted the help of our artist friend Peggy Sanders to help. The illustrations are amazing!

This book has a wonderful message that struggles are mitigated by friendships and that friends can come in a glorious diversity.

In Sasha's House, Mama and Lauren are running errands after school. Something at school has made Lauren feel sad, but the prospect of going to dinner at her friend Sasha's house makes her feel better. While Mama takes care of business, Lauren talks to her friends from the community, all of whom are also having bad days. Lauren invites all of them to Sasha's house for dinner, too, without telling Mama or, of course, Sasha's mother. What happens when everyone shows up at Sasha's house uninvited? Not telling. You have to read the story. 

What I Need & What You Get

We are asking for money to print 200 copies. The estimated cost is $2,700.00, without shipping. We are estimating shipping costs to be $300.00.

Possible prizes are:

an online thank you;

Sasha's House computer wallpaper;

a Sasha's House notebook with a cover from an illustration;

a signed copy of an illustration;

signed copies of the book;

an original illustration signed by Peggy Sanders

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this fund, no worries. Please share this project to help spread the word.

story:
The Flash

In the blink of an eye, humanity has been reversed to a bestial level by “The Flash”, an energy pulse of unknown origin. All higher thought processes have been erased, removing every trace of civilization and culture, leaving these new creatures concerned with three things: fornicating, feeding, and fighting.

The survivors must first find one another amid the chaos and destruction. The Scramblers are merciless, swarming over everything and everyone in their path. If they are lucky, those who survived the Flash will pick up the pieces left behind.

The People

Abigail and her brother, Aaron, are celebrating her 12th birthday at a popular restaurant with their parents. Cameron is working another Friday night behind the grill. Duke, a prison guard, has been placed on leave due to inmate abuse. Recent reports from the media state that the sun has been behaving strangely; a stronger than normal solar storm is expected to hit the Earth over the next week.

The four of them – Abigail, Aaron, Cameron, and Duke – survive the Flash. When they wake up, they find everything they’ve known has changed. Cameron is now in charge of two youngsters he’s never met, and Duke... Duke is still Duke. Cunning and violent, his ambition is far greater than the small town he lives in.

As Cameron and the kids come to grips with the threats they face, Duke returns to the prison he was barred from, where he settles in preparing for the unknown. They all hope to find sanctuary; while they have survived, those who were Flashed are different. They can’t speak. They can’t reason. They are no longer human, but still in human form.

Their struggles start in their respective small towns, until they eventually face each other in Atlanta. But after a decade trying to survive in the city, it becomes obvious they need to move...

ELSEWHERE 

Atlanta is decaying as it slowly runs out of resources.  The survivors of the Flash dream of living Elsewhere... A place where they can run in the grass, grow crops in real dirt, and not have to live with the constant threat of both human and scrambler attacks. Elsewhere becomes a dream, a catchphrase, “anywhere but here; Elsewhere”

Abigail, Aaron, and the residents of 'Decktown', a re-purposed parking deck in downtown Atlanta, have found Elsewhere. While they work to flee the city, Duke is watching, coveting... and once they leave the concrete shelter of their home, they'll have a hundred miles of scramblers to contend with.

About the author: Blue Cole began writing as soon as he could grip a pencil, and has been writing professionally since 2008. A voracious reader, Blue’s work spans and twists multiple genres, inserting historical elements into magical realism, or mixing criminal thrillers with paranormal elements. He lives with his family in rural Georgia, a setting common to many of his works. Find out more about him at www.bluecole.com, or order his previous works at Amazon. 

About the artist: Ariel Burgess grew up in the Washington, D.C area. Best known for her work on The Wheel of Time, she has since branched out towards film, story-boarding and concept art, with art credits in various literary works. She now offers a Patreon to reward her fans with exclusive perks such as inside looks at her work, tutorials, monthly wallpapers, private portraits and more.  Become a Patron at www.patreon.com/arielburgess, or visit https://www.artistarielburgess.com.

story:
#FoodOrigins + Culture | For the Culture

We created Whetstone to explore where our food really comes from. We're a global team of creatives led by our principal #OriginForager, Stephen Satterfield. 

We're Paying Our Writers!

And photographers, and editors, and artists. For independent publications with no advertisements, this is significant. But it's not easy. 100% of the proceeds go towards the contributors ($10K), printing ($2,500) and shipping ($2,500). 

#OriginForaging, Around the Globe 

What are the origins of cacao? Cacao expert and host of the award-winning Slow Melt podcast Simran Sethi reports from Ecuador. Meanwhile, Heleene Tambet hunts for rare cacao in Quillabamba, Peru. We dig into Korea's food history near and far, with dishes from chef-Korean food scholar Ji-Hye Kim of Miss Kim's Restaurant in Ann Arbor. In Seoul, the Bburi Kitchen team teaches us about ancient techniques for fish preservation.

We revisit Mexico with love letters to the markets of the capital city, barbacoa in Texcoco, and the restorative properties of tlaltequeadas in Tepoztlán — the birthplace of hippies, shamans, and truth seekers. Plus, former sommelier and career oenophile Stephen Satterfield makes a second voyage to the Republic of Georgia to drink from the world's oldest grapevine. And that's not even half. Join us! 

Impact

Whetstone is a black-owned, independent publishing company, led by women and people of color. This diversity is not just noteworthy, but a significant part of what makes the project so essential. When the gatekeepers are diverse, so too are the stories, its tellers and their experiences. This diversity accelerates our knowledge and empathy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Sharing this campaign with friends and family can also help us reach our goal, so please share far and wide; we're deeply grateful for that consideration. Also, encourage your favorite restaurant to join us as a Whetstone Ambassador with a $100 contribution.
story_txt:
#FoodOrigins + Culture | For the Culture
We created Whetstone to explore where our food really comes from. We're a global team of creatives led by our principal #OriginForager, Stephen Satterfield. 

We're Paying Our Writers!
And photographers, and editors, and artists. For independent publications with no advertisements, this is significant. But it's not easy. 100% of the proceeds go towards the contributors ($10K), printing ($2,500) and shipping ($2,500). 
#OriginForaging, Around the Globe 
What are the origins of cacao? Cacao expert and host of the award-winning Slow Melt podcast Simran Sethi reports from Ecuador. Meanwhile, Heleene Tambet hunts for rare cacao in Quillabamba, Peru. We dig into Korea's food history near and far, with dishes from chef-Korean food scholar Ji-Hye Kim of Miss Kim's Restaurant in Ann Arbor. In Seoul, the Bburi Kitchen team teaches us about ancient techniques for fish preservation.
We revisit Mexico with love letters to the markets of the capital city, barbacoa in Texcoco, and the restorative properties of tlaltequeadas in Tepoztlán — the birthplace of hippies, shamans, and truth seekers. story:
Short Summary

I am an author of hopeful climate fiction as well as a sustainability consultant. Together with nine other authors, I am putting together an anthology to commemorate the work done by the UN where the Brundtland Commission published the report Our Common Future in 1987.

We believe it is important to take care of our planet - if we do that, we will also take care of ourselves and our children and grandchildren and... (you get the picture).

To make sure our work is the best it can be, we are now fundraising to be able to pay a professional editor. The anthology will be published beginning of December.

Read more about the anthology here

The work is lead by me: Tanja Rohini Bisgaard

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1,200 to be able to get a really good editor. If we raise more funds, we can get someone to help design a professional book cover. If we raise even more funds, each author can be paid for their story - and we will give a share to charity.

If we are not able to raise the full amount, we will use what we raise to pay an editor - and get as much help possible with the amount raised.

Everyone who supports us will get their name on a special thank you page in the book. And that starts from $1!

 

The Impact

Sometimes we can all get a little fed up or discouraged when we hear about pollution or global warming. There are so many numbers to relate to - or you feel you don't know what you can do. These stories are meant to create awareness in a different way - making you think about how YOU can take care of the Earth and the people you love on it.

We believe that good stories are needed to get people to change their behaviour. What will you do to take care of the planet after you read our short stories?

 

Risks & Challenges

I am a stubborn person - and once I have decided to do something, I do it.

Even if we do not raise enough funding for the project, the anthology will be published! So far I have not received any money for taking this on - and not getting any in the future will not stop me now.

I have been a project manager on a range of research/analysis projects for the last 15 years - so managing this is definitely something I can do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell others about our project - use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Talk to your family, friends and colleagues about it. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and the other social media platforms you use!

Or maybe you know a company or organisation that would like to give the book (printed version) as a Christmas present to their employees?

Thank you very much. With your help, this anthology will become even better!

story:
My name is Nina Leipold. I am a former dolphin trainer, NAUI open water SCUBA certified diver, free diver, and mermaid! Yes, that's right, I'm a mermaid. I have always had a passion for the ocean and as of recently our oceans are in a lot of trouble. I started a business to promote ocean conservation - a mermaid business. 

As I started paying attention to what people care about, I began brainstorming about what I can do to get people to not only care about the ocean but also make the changes needed to help protect it. I quickly learned that people have a fascination with mermaids. I learned also, that if people feel connected with something, they are more likely to change their behavior to save it. This brought on the very difficult task of starting up a mermaid business. I get them to care about me and my ocean friends, then educate them on how they can make small changes day to day that will make a huge difference for our oceans.

All of the children's books I write have a message of ocean conservation and help children understand what the issues are and what small changes they can make to help. For example, the Mermaid of Hilton Head book is about sea turtles being deterred from the beaches when they need to lay their eggs because of the lights on land. The solution? Simply turn your lights off, or close your blinds at night. We have had an overwhelming response to the books, which have been offered only in soft cover as of now. We have been asked by so many people to get the books hardcover, and have even lost sales because of this. I want to reach as many people as possible to get these important messages out there.

This is something I am very passionate about because these books are the best way to reach the generation who will be most effected by the ocean's current health and the ones who can really make the change. With your donation, I am planning to print all of the books hardcover, while keeping them at an affordable price to reach more people. The paper will also be a higher quality, giving the illustrations a more vibrant color. I am also planning to add new titles to the series, increasing the educational value.

story:
What is ZEAL?

 

ZEAL is a publishing cooperative featuring visual and literary artwork throughout the Black diaspora. We are launching an online platform and application that makes Black visual and literary art accessible. See below for our publications, programming, and user experience. Click here to for Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) to learn more on how ZEAL works. Any purchase of a perk will give you a free trial offer of our platform for 2018 with a free ZEAL Classic postcard booklet for our Summer or Fall editions.

Example of Artwork Featured in ZEAL Classic Postcard Booklets

story:
I’m Tobin Smith and for 14 years I was a paid on-air Fox News contributor. I also was shamefully a willing collaborator in the Fox News "fair and balanced" rigged-debate scam that has so damaged America, brought us Donald Trump and torn apart tens of thousands of American families.  

With your generous help, I'm publishing the very first Fox News insider whistleblower expose book that, along with our 5-Step Fight Back Against Fox News Action Plan, will literally blow-the-lid off the predatory Fox News programming culture that was expressly built to prey on America's most vulnerable seniors.

Already Fox News addiction and propaganda has:

1) Destroyed tens of thousands of American families by infecting parents/siblings with "Fox News Derangement Syndrome" while Fox earns $billions in profits every year

2) Brought us the UNTHINKABLE: A Reality TV host aka Donald Trump as President of the United States

3) Swayed Elections: A new study by Emory University political scientist Gregory Martin and Stanford economist Ali Yurukoglu the find that watching Fox News directly causes a substantial rightward shift in viewers’ attitudes, which translates into a significantly greater willingness to vote for Republican candidates.

Our 5-Step Fight Back Against Fox News Action Plan includes:

1) Publication/manufacturing/promotion of my book "Fear and UNBalanced: Confessions of a Fox News Hitman (softcover and audio) and worldwide PR/media campaign

2) Distribution of the acclaimed "Brainwashing of My Dad" documentary film that chronicles the very real tragic family repercussions of Fox News addiction in hundreds of thousands of American families

3) Creation of Fox News Addiction YouTube Channel (with video testimony from people whose families and friendship have become estranged due to a parent/sibling/relative/friends hyper-partisan radicalization aka Fox News Derangement Syndrome from their literal addiction to Fox News

4) Creation and distribution of a Fox News Addict Intervention Handbook integrated with our Fox News Addict Intervention videos

5) Supporting Media Matters Petition for Advertisers to Boycott the Sean Hannity Show (where ad revenue is down 15% since this boycott started).

Your support helps us Fight Back and END FOX NEWS as it exists today in 5 ways:

1)  Publishing my book  "Fear & UNBalanced: Confessions of a Fox News Hitman" will for the FIRST TIME a Fox News insider blows the doors off of Fox News' carefully orchestrated exploitation of their median average 68 year old viewers and ALL THE DETAILS of Fox News' fixed/rigged "fair and balanced" opinion program production scam in which I participated for 14 years

2) EXPOSE Fox News Derangement Syndrome: For the first time anywhere we reveal public health data that reveals high correlation between 60+ aged Fox News addiction/radicalization and 50% HIGHER risk of premature death for de-socialized seniors due to hyper-partisan/radicalized behavior. We will sponsor a research survey of  hyper-partisan de-socialized seniors 60+ with Fox News addiction

3) WE distribute the ground breaking 2015 documentary film "THE BRAINWASHING OF MY DAD" which explores the radical change of her once Democratic father to an angry right-wing fanatic after his immersion in talk radio and Fox News and how this powerful phenomenon that has divided families across the nation.

4) WE Solicit signatures for Media Matters "Advertiser BOYCOTT of the SEAN HANNITY Show" that has already dropped ad income 14% on the show in latest data.

5) WE Lobby for a 21st Century FCC "Fairness Doctrine" that forces politically partisan programming to be disclosed and clearly identified as "entertainment" programming and the disclaimer that Fox News opinion programming is NOT objective news/journalism.

America & American Families Need Your Help TODAY

The very heart of our Fight Back Against Fox News is the tragic epidemic and consequences of  losing parents, brother and sisters, relatives and friends to Fox News addiction. We call this situation "Fox News Derangement Syndrome" and its a VERY REAL condition in tens of thousands of families. 

Here is one of hundreds of letters I have read from people all over America with families broken up by Fox News Derangement syndrome; this is author Edwin Lyngar from his book “How I Lost My Father to Fox News:”

“How did I lose my Dad? He consumes a daily diet of nothing except Fox News. He has for a decade or more. He has no email account and doesn’t watch sports anymore.  He thinks higher education destroys people.

I don’t blame or condemn my father for his opinions. If you consumed a daily diet of right-wing fury, erroneously labeled “news,” you could very likely end up in the same place. Again, this is all by design. Let’s call it the Fox News effect. Take sweet, kindly senior citizens and feed them a steady stream of demagoguery and repetition, all wrapped in the laughable slogan of “fair and balanced.” Even watching the commercials on Fox, one is treated to sales pitches for gold and emergency food rations, the product cornerstones of the paranoid.”

I'm sure that you or a family member, friend or colleague know someone whose lost a parent, brother, sister or friends to Fox News radicalization and addiction. Our latest survey research shows 1-in-5 Americans >age 25 has or knows someone who has lost a parent or loved one radicalized by addiction to Fox News'/right wing brand of partisan hate porn. 

My book is the first to SHOW THE WORLD in great detail how this elderly viewer manipulation and addiction was planned and executed from the start of Fox News in 1996 by Roger Ailes and his right wing production team. 

In my book I name the names, I have the texts and emails and the evidence to expose the Fox News "fair & balanced" SCAM once and for all. 

I will prove in great detail what many non-Fox News addicts have suspected for years: When it comes to Fox's opinion/debate programming, Fox News is nothing more than a rigged-outcome performance art just like the fixed game show scandals of the 50's or World Wide Wrestling scandal in the 90's (when the FCC made WWE admit their "wrestling matches" were nothing more than rigged & choreographed story lines.) 

Like the late host of my weekly show Bulls & Bears told me years ago “Toby…conservatives NEVER lose the debate on Fox News…that’s what producers are for!”

With your help I will expose ALL the hidden secrets behind the Fox News opinion programming SCAM I practiced and observed and how the "fair and balanced" promise is just a rigged-debate hoax on the most vulnerable Americans. 

BUT EVEN MORE IMPORTANT:

I need your support to make sure America understands how addiction to Fox News’ rigged-debate programming has grown into a significant public health issue for American seniors and especially for retirement-aged men.

New research from UC San Francisco public health data shows that these radicalized de-socialized and isolated 60+ aged Fox News addicts have a 45-50% higher risk of premature death and 59% higher rate of deteriorating health in general vs. normally socialized non-radicalized 60+ aged seniors. 

Key Point: Fox News Derangement Syndrome and its Addiction & De-Socialization is LETHAL

I need your help to tell the REAL story and the truth behind this emerging civic and health epidemic to all America that I GUARANTEE Fox News does NOT want Americans to know.

What We Need & What YOU Get!

I've finished the research and first draft of the book. To cover the cost of book editing & manufacturing, audio recording and worldwide PR campaign we need to raise about $10,000.

We are also sponsoring video streams for our donors of the documentary movie that opened my eyes to the family and health risks of Fox News addiction. The movie is called "The Brainwashing of My Dad" and it was written/directed by Jen Senko, Executive Produced by Ryan Smith and Jodie Evans and it was produced by the acclaimed actor & activist Matthew Modine and Adam Rackoff. 

All additional funds raised from this 45-day crowdfunding campaign go to printing and delivering additional pre-sold books and video streams for our donors and our amazing list of PERKS!

From $5 to $5000, every dollar you contribute will go to fighting this epidemic of political tribal hatred, broken-up families, premature senior citizen death and health issues for 60+ aged Americans addicted to Fox News' fake "fair and balanced" opinion programming. 

Our $25 Best Deal Perk (a $50 value) includes:

  • First Edition Paperback Copy of "Fear & Unbalanced: Confessions of a Fox News Hitman
  • Full Video Stream of "The Brainwashing of My Dad" documentary
  • One Audio Version of the book
  • BOGO Buy-One/Get-One FREE Coupon for Additional Books or Video Streams
  • One Media Matter's Boycott Hannity Advertisers Petition

Our $100 Fox News Addict Intervention Perk is GREAT for Helping Get Your Addict Back!

We have created this "Intervention Package" to help your FNC addicted loved one break their habit:

  • We will take your personal video message and
  • edit-in a personal message from Tobin Smith & Jen Senko to your addict
  • We recommend you bring the DVD with you and
  •  2 books with you to leave with your addicted Dad/Mom/Brother/Sister or friend

Check out ALL our perks and choose the one best for you!

Risks & Challenges

Fox News is a multi-billion corporation that has covered up a corporate culture of abuse for more that a decade; they will fight back hard and dirty.

With this book I will share new public health data on a grim reality that Fox News does NOT want Americans to know: How Fox News’ radicalized version of partisan propaganda and our rigged-outcome “debate panels” (or what I’ve come to call “hyper-partisan hate porn”) is now a full-blown public health epidemic for 60+ aged seniors.

It's Time an Insider TOLD the TRUTH About the Fox News SCAM

With your support I will reveal EVERY last secret and crimes against America  that Fox News has perpetrated in  "Fear & Unbalanced: Confessions of a Fox News Hitman

Other Ways to Help

Make Some Noise! If you can't donate to our cause, donate some time to sharing this important campaign to your family, friends and associates on your E-Mail/Facebook page/Instagram/Twitter/Linked-In/Pinterest social media!

Check out ALL our perks and choose the one best for you!Risks & ChallengesFox News is a multi-billion corporation that has covered up a corporate culture of abuse for more that a decade; they will fight back hard and dirty.With this book I will share new public health data on a grim reality that Fox News does NOT want Americans to know: How Fox News’ radicalized version of partisan propaganda and our rigged-outcome “debate panels” (or what I’ve come to call “hyper-partisan hate porn”) is now a full-blown public health epidemic for 60+ aged seniors.It's Time an Insider TOLD the TRUTH About the Fox News SCAMWith your support I will reveal EVERY last secret and crimes against America  that Fox News has perpetrated in  "Fear & Unbalanced: Confessions of a Fox News HitmanOther Ways to HelpMake Some Noise! If you can't donate to our cause, donate some time to sharing this important campaign to your family, friends and associates on your E-Mail/Facebook page/Instagram/Twitter/Linked-In/Pinterest social media!

story:
Summary

PLACE...in the making   is a  print publication & online Makers' Market launching in the Fall of 2017.  It's a celebration of New England through the eyes of makers, photographers and architects.  Essays, stunning photos and reflections on the region, explore the characteristics that create a "Sense of Place."  Contributors share how they make connections to the region through their creative process.  Whether it's a photo of the landscape, a building in the landscape or a vessel made from the earth of the landscape,  all are ways of making connections to New England   explored in PLACE...in the making.  

 

 

We've been working on issue One of PLACE..in the making  for months, and it's nearly ready to be printed, shipped and in your hands  by early November.  In addition to the print publication, we have curated a Makers' Market comprised of uncommon goods from small batch makers featured in the magazine.  The Makers' Market  offers ethically made, thoughtfully crafted products  that bring the beauty of New England home.  

 

Draft of magazine cover and essays above.

PLACE...in the making  will have content about regional weavers  like Brahms Mount in Maine.  Below is a video of John, the Master Weaver at Brahms Mount, creating a sample throw for Sweetgum on an antique shuttle loom. 

 

 

 

  • This campaign is important to us because we are passionate about the Makers' Movement happening here in New England.  We are makers ourselves and believe that well made, thoughtful design is worth seeking out and celebrating.

 

Who We Are

PLACE...in the making   was founded by Boston area architects  Sandra Venus and Jon Richardson. Sandra is also a textile designer with a Fine Arts degree from RISD & is the founder of Sweetgum textiles.    She is the publisher and art director for the magazine.

Through Sweetgum textiles Sandra collaborates with regional historic printing & weaving mills. The deep, rich history of crafting textiles in New England and an appreciation of the architecture of the  textile industries became the inspiration for creating a magazine that celebrates making  as related to a specific region.

Jon is the editor and a contributor for PLACE...in the making.  As a practicing  architect with a degree in archeology, Jon brings a deep love of history and architecture of the region to this publication.   He is fascinated with  the questions of why a particular location is selected for the production of certain goods: textiles, boats, salt, etc... and how places evolve to express the culture of the people living there.  

  • Key contributors to   PLACE...in the making  include well known photographers from the region:  Cynthia August  &  Melissa DiPalma.    


Cynthia is a Boston based commercial portrait photographer. Her photography subjects represent some of the most creative and innovative business owners, influencers, artists and craftsmen in New England. She specializes in environmental portraits, editorial, and advertising photography. Her studio is located on Boston’s North Shore in Ipswich but her clients reach from New York to New Hampshire, Maine, and beyond. Cynthia's photography blends classical art composition with the energy of the decisive moment. A life-long romance with the human story translates to empathy behind the camera and a celebratory eye for the final product.  cynthiaaugust.com 

 

 

Melissa DiPalma is a product, still life and food photographer specializing in working with makers, farmers, artisans and specialty food producers to tell the story of their work and products through lifestyle images. Clients and collaborations include Boston Public Market, Island Creek Oysters, Burdick's Chocolates, Port Living Company, Harvard Common Press, Yankee Magazine, Hingeline Seafood, Place (in the Making) and other handmade producers and publishers throughout New England. Starting this fall, she will be launching a boutique stock image agency focusing on natural, botanical and food related still life subjects. You can see more of her work at www.melissadipalma.com and a collection of visual stories about everyday objects for her side project LOOT at www.lootstories.com. 

 

We have many talented  contributors to this first issue of PLACE...in the making   including: Jennifer Bakos,  Rachel Conly, Naomi Cottrell, Justin Demetri, Jill Feron, Jay Johnson,  Rick Jones & others

Makers participating in the 2017  Makers' Market:

Amanda Ann Palmer, Callidora Design, Carland Cartography, Cocoruto, Digs, Enna Chocolate, Hey Blue Handmade, Karen Murphy, Marie Schultz, Romney Ridge Yarns & Wool, Spire Woodshop & Wild Lather and a few more that we are adding in the coming weeks.

Why an Indiegogo campaign

Our goal with Indiegogo is to find readers for this first issue and to help jump start the first year of PLACE...in the making  with a fundraising goal of $7,500.  We have invested our own funds into designing the first issue  because we believe this is a subject that resonates with people.  Our contributors to this first issue have worked with us at below market rates because they too believe in the idea.   The portion of the goal needed to cover printing costs for issue One of Place..in the making  is $7,500.  Funds collected beyond that amount will help with covering the design costs and contributor fees for issue two Spring/Summer 2018.  

Our perks were selected to included a variety of objects that capture the character of New England.  The perks are made by contributors to the magazine.  All the perks are either already made or set to go into production within the coming weeks.  You will receive perks in time for the gift giving season.  We hope you like the selection.  There are some beautifully crafted items included in the list featuring techniques of making that are growing more and more difficult to find: hand screen printed yardage and weaving with antique shuttle looms-  these items tell the story of New England.  Please consider a contribution so we are able to reach more readers and grow the publication in the coming year.  Thank you!

The Impact

By publishing PLACE...in the making we are creating a platform for regional makers and creatives to share how they work and craft.   We strive to  help these makers to build their businesses in a way that is sustainable and thoughtful.  We all have a desire to bring objects into our world that reflect our values.    The makers we collaborate with in the publication are dedicated to making and crafting things in ethical, environmentally sensitive ways the we can all feel good about bringing into our homes.

Amanda Ann Palmer working in her pottery studio in Vermont.

 

Risks & Challenges

The magazine content and contributors for issue One of PLACE...in the making   Fall/Winter 2017 has been finalized and the design/art work is almost complete.   If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we risk the ability to design and  print the second issue of PLACE...in the making for Spring/Summer 2018.  

  • We need to spread the word, reach readers and build awareness to succeed
  • We need to attract contributors who are passionate about New England & Craft to build the next and following issues

A successful campaign will help us to find readers and build connections with future contributors to insure that publishing  PLACE...in the making   becomes a sustainable publication .

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking the time to hear about PLACE...in the making and considering a donation.  If you are unable to contribute, we would greatly appreciate it if you can share the campaign with friends and family both here in New England and in other regions.  Indiegogo offers easy-to-share tools for you.

Thank you!

Sandra, Jon & the contributors to PLACE...in the making

story:
Be a part of an Epic Journey!

Hello. My name is Rory D Nelson, author of "The Brotherhood of Merlin", a dark, gritty fantasy epic chronicling a group of knights five hundred years after the death of King Arthur.  

Like most indie authors, I moonlight. By day, I'm running my own small window cleaning in the Sacramento area and at night, I'm working on my life's greatest passion- my epic saga- "The Brotherhood of Merlin". For five years, I have toiled on this saga, putting my heart and soul into each page.  If you have a penchant for dark and mysterious fantasy epics without the plodding pace of a "Game of Thrones", an infusion of "Kill Bill", "Lord of the Rings" and "300" then this may be right up your alley.

In May of 2016, I self-published the first installment. The book garnered several favorable reviews from readers and reviewers alike. The book has a 4.84 average rating on Goodreads as well as a 4.6 on Amazon. It received a 5 Star rating on Reader's Favorite and won an Honorable Mention in the category of Action Adventures on Reader's Favorite. If you'd like to check out the book on Amazon, here's the link  http://amzn.to/2j1Ehp1 

Though my first book in the series was well received, the audience was very limited and it took a toll on me financially. Were I to continue at the pace I did last year, I would certainly go broke.

In order to break through to a much larger audience, I'm trying to raise $50,000, which is not a trifle amount. $7000.00 of that amount will be used for the editing portion alone. I could spend much less but in order to have the same caliber of editing that writers at traditionally  published houses receive, I need three rounds of editing. And that doesn't come cheap.

    $1100 - for artwork,

    $4800 for SEO services

    $2000 for cinematic book trailer and distribution

    $10-$15,000 for a book publicist, which would require at least 100 -150 hours of work

    $15,000 for a three month advertising package on Goodreads, which would raise awareness and drive purchase intent

     $4-$5000 Book printing costs for giveaways on Goodreads and to fulfill perks for contributors

For a contribution of $25, you will receive a signed copy of Book One and the Ebook version of Book 2 while $50 gets you autographed copies of books 1 and 2 as well as a heartfelt email from the author.

As you can imagine, the perks get much more interesting from there! $100 gets you all the above as well as posters and Tshirts from Book One and Two and coffee with the author (transportation not included).

And for the truly generous, there are some truly unique perks you won't find anywhere else. $500 gets you all of the above perks as well as a dinner date with the author and Janell at Mikuni, Sacramento's premier sushi destination. Note that transportation is not included.

For the most generous out there, $1000 gets you all of the above, but in lieu of the dinner date at Mikuni, you and your significant other (or insignificant other) will receive a day of wine tasting in the very picturesque and famous Napa Valley. One of the wineries will be at a castle-like setting, accentuating the theme of the perk. Please note that transportation to Napa Valley is not included. All tasting fees will be covered for the wineries but additional bottles are not.

The goal of raising such a large amount will not be easy but it is certainly possible. This is truly an amazing epic with incredible market potential. For me, it's not a question of if it will take off but simply when. Coming up short on my goal is a very real possibility and one that I am prepared for. I can scale back on any number of things except for two - the artwork and the editing; so the absolute minimum I have to raise is $8,640. I won't sacrifice on the quality of the writing and the imagery that reflects it. Basically, I can't have a crappy book with a crappy cover. Eventually, my big book launch will happen - if not for this book then it will be the next one. I won't sacrifice on the quality of writing.

Be a part of this incredible journey and the rise of the next Billion dollar franchise (yes, I said billion)! If you've been scouring the crowdfunding platforms for the perfect writing campaign to back, one that will truly be awe-inspiring and successful, I think you've found it.

Of course, I realize that everyone may not be able to contribute, even at a $9 contribution and that's ok. Even if you can't give anything, share this campaign with your network. Download my book for the ridiculously low price of $0.99 and contribute that way. If you'd like to learn more about me, check out my website at rorydnelson.com and signup for my blog. Without purchasing anything from me or contributing to my campaign, you can still have access to my free novella on my blog, titled, "Dawn of the Merlin" as well as Merlin's backstories. 

And thank you once again for taking the time to consider backing my campaign.

story:
My First Thriller Novel Project
 

People always call me by my "middle name" which is Nasrul. I come from a middle class family of five. I'm currently studying at a college about 350 km from my house and yes, I'm always homesick. I love writing. Writing is just my life. I can't live without writing. Since my parents are teachers, I was always seen as the smart one in class although let's be honest here, I'm not. However, I can say, my teacher always praises me for my writing. Which makes me happy :P

I'm currently finishing my first ever novel's manuscript. It will be self-pusblished on amazon (kindle publishing). It is not my first self-publishing "book". A few months ago, I self-publshed a short story (around 3000 words long) to get an overview of how kindle publishing works. I advertised my short story on some advertising platform and I find out its too expensive for a poor college student like me to afford. So, I need your help to advertise my first ever novel. It is very important to me because I spent years developing the idea for the novel. The novel is about a girl who lost her dad after a terrible incident. Her life then revolved around her mother, kid and few other person. By donating in this campaign you can help me to advertise my book to help me reach out to the whole world. 

For my project to be possible, I need at least $500 dollars.  I will use the advertising features in kindle publishing and the rest will go to other affordable advertising platforms. If there is any remainder, I will use it for the part of the book. If it is possible, I would also hire one of my friends design a better cover for my book. 

Here is what you will get if you donate:

1) For any amount, I will place your name in the book plus, I will write an appreciation page with your name written in it, thanking you for your contribution

2) For $5, I will send you a thank you card signed with my name ( it will be sent electronically however because I need to safe money sorry :( ).

3) For $10, I will send you a thank you card (by mail, as in real card) signed with my name.

4) For $20, all of the above and I will send you a copy of the book for free and signed with my name.

5) For $50 and above, I will send you a copy for the book for free, plus a free bookmark plus all al the perks stated above.

If I don't reach my goal, the funds will still be used but for a more affordable advertising service

Why you should donate:

I tried to make my novel as original as possible. You won't be disappointed once you bought the book. This novel is very special for me because I really wanted to be a successful writer since I was a kid.

My Risks and Challenges

Writing this book isn't easy. I had to change my plot many times after I reread it again and again because some parts bore even me. I wouldn't say this project is risky but I definitely would be lying if I said so. After self-publishing a short story few months ago, I know that it is not each to convince people to buy your book but I can tell you one thing. Even if I don't get many people to buy my book, I won't ever give up. I will never think that I wasted any time writing my book. To be honest, I'm someone with zero confidence level and yes, I'm a pessimist. I'm not even sure if you are still reading but I would like to thank you if you do. Even if you don't donate or cannot afford to donate, you can still help me out. Simply share the link to my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc. OR you can simply tell people about my book which would be very cool. Lastly, thanks for reading.
