I wouldn't say this project is risky but I definitely would be lying if I said so. After self-publishing a short story few months ago, I know that it is not each to convince people to buy your book but I can tell you one thing. Even if I don't get many people to buy my book, I won't ever give up. I will never think that I wasted any time writing my book. To be honest, I'm someone with zero confidence level and yes, I'm a pessimist. I'm not even sure if you are still reading but I would like to thank you if you do. Even if you don't donate or cannot afford to donate, you can still help me out. Simply share the link to my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc. OR you can simply tell people about my book which would be very cool. Lastly, thanks for reading.

story:
Short Summary

The rewards found here are the perfect gifts just in time for Mother's Day!

About the book

Mommy's Mini-Me is an inspiring children's book about a young girl who becomes empowered by her mother's wisdom. It is a storybook about perseverance with admirable illustrations by the talented, St. Lucian born, Ted M. Sandiford, father of 6 children. The 32-page, fully illustrated, hardcover children's picture book is written for ages: newborn to 5 years old. The story also details the importance of a mother's love in  their children's lives. A must have for all mothers to read to their young daughters. This book will be cherished for years to come. Click here to follow Arnold Henry on Instagram!

What We Need & What You Get

Everything we make through this campaign will be used to fund, specifically in these areas:

  • First print run of 2000 hardcover books
  • Shipping and packaging of all rewards
  • Book cover and interior designer
  • All the illustrations by Ted M. Sandiford
  • 12-Piece Puzzle by createjigsawpuzzles.com 
  • Daddy's Mini-Me T-shirts by All Things Pretty
  • Coloring pages, bookmarks and postcards
  • Ebook conversion and design
  • Copyrights
  • Editing fees by Tracy Blaine
  • Layout & Design to be hired
  • Website designer and hosting fees
  • Indiegogo fees
  • Other unforeseen fees to be determined

The History of Daddy's Mini-Me

On February 21, 2018, I received a response from a children's book agent. The letter stated, "...in today's market, stories on African American "fathers" is such a tough sell." Ever since, I've proven that idea to be 100% inaccurate. Click here to read the full story. 


 

 

Risks & Challenges

The cost to expedite 2000 books in time for mother's day is quite costly. Hopefully, we get all the backers their rewards in a timely manner. We have found a great printer that we plan to work with after comparing costs, experience and quality. The only thing left to do now is turn Daddy's Mini-Me into a reality for millions of mothers and their children!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know a parent who is looking for books like these, please let them know about this campaign! If you have a contact in the media - we'd love to hear from them! If you have words of encouragement or believe in my mission - we'd love to hear from you! Just email us at info@arnoldhenry.com! Even when the campaign ends, you can still keep updated on Mommy's Mini-Me.

story:
Help Build the Ultimate Tribute to Hip-Hop Producers!

 

There has never been a book like this. Written and illustrated by noted hip-hop journalist Riley Wallace, From Boom Bap to Trap: Hip-Hop's Greatest Producers is a groundbreaking compendium that not only digs deep into the stories and catalogs of icons like Pete Rock, RZA, Dr. Dre, and DJ Premier, but also features highly influential beatmakers who have been slept on—sometimes criminally (Easy Mo Bee, Daz, Paul C, and Johnny “J," for example.)

Until now hip-hop heads have been forced to navigate a sea of wiki entries, incomplete bios, and confusing credits (or none at all), which has caused some mind-melting tracks to be underappreciated or completely undiscovered. No more.

This book contains superb bios, brilliant lists of critical beats, punchy liner notes, and stunning artwork that finally do justice to the artists who have given hip-hop its backbone from the early ’90s to the present day.

Ultimately, From Boom Bap to Trap is a nostalgia bomb, a conversation piece, a must-own work of art for real heads made by a real head. Lovingly curated, it’s an essential resource that will satisfy the hunger of both new fans and hard-core hip-hop junkies for years to come.

There will be a Bonus Chapter by the legendary Easy Mo Bee!

 

 

 

Riley Wallace, Author & Illustrator

Hailing from Toronto, Canada, Riley Wallace started his career as a musical artist—emerging from the rubble of MySpace with a big enough fan base to earn early viral success and a major-label deal. He later left the industry, which was (sonically) in a precarious state at the time, in search of a new outlet for self-expression, namely writing professionally. Beginning at the end of the infamous blog era, he built a thriving platform—Above Average Hip Hop—and then parlayed his success into a contributing role with XXL magazine, and later HipHopDX and Exclaim! (Canada’s oldest print-based music publication).

From Boom Bap to Trap is one of two hip-hop books Riley is writing for Hamilcar.

Learn More About Riley:

rileywallacewrites.com, Twitter: @specialdesigns , Instagram: @rileywallace

 

 

 

PERKS

There are three versions of the book to choose from: Paperback, Special Edition, and the Collector's Edition.

Paperback

Bring this project to life!

  • Bios, Essential Beats, Liner Notes, 8 x 10 in., 312 pp.
  • Original full-color illustrations by author and hip-hop artist Riley Wallace printed on high-quality matte coated paper stock.
  • Cover features matte lamination plus spot-gloss on script title type.
  • Collage of hip-hop’s greatest producers on inside front and back covers.
  • Comes with eBook, download of beats by producer (and protégé of DJ Premier) J57, digital poster of Hip-Hop's Greatest Producers, and a digital poster of DMX & His Producers.
     

 

 Special Hardcover Edition

  • Bios, Essential Beats, Liner Notes, 8 x10 in., 312 pp.
  • Original full-color illustrations by Riley Wallace printed on high-quality matte coated paper stock.
  • Hardcover
  • Full-color dust jacket with poster collage of hip-hop’s greatest producers, 24 x 10 in., printed on the reverse side. 
  • Matte lamination plus spot-gloss on embossed script title type on front dust jacket.
  • Printed DAT cassette hardcover case with foil-stamping on title type.
  • Comes with eBook, download of beats by producer (and protégé of DJ Premier) J57, digital poster of Hip-Hop's Greatest Producers, and a digital poster of DMX & His Producers.

 

 Collector's Edition

  • Limited edition of 500 copies. 
  • Bios, Essential Beats, Liner Notes, 8 x 10 in., 312 pp.
  • Original full-color illustrations by Riley Wallace printed on high-quality matte coated paper stock.
  • Hardcover
  • Slipcase printed with original artwork plus gold foil-stamping on script title type.
  • Hardcover case printed with iconic Technics 1200 turntable, plus foil-stamped vinyl record with tipped-on uncoated record label with metallic silver type.
  • Poster collage of hip-hop’s greatest producers, 24 x 10 in., printed on high-quality stock suitable for framing. 
  • Each Limited Edition copy has a custom bookplate signed and numbered by Riley Wallace (stickered to endpaper on inside front case.)
  • Comes with eBook, download of beats by producer (and protégé of DJ Premier) J57, digital poster of Hip-Hop's Greatest Producers, and a digital poster of DMX & His Producers.

 

ADDITIONAL PERKS

Gift Pack of Official From Boom Bap to Trap Playing Cards

  • A stacked deck of beatmaking legends!
  • 3 decks of cards for $36! (single decks will be $20)
  • High-quality playing card deck featuring 52 of hip-hop’s greatest producers, ranked from Ace to 2.
  • Illustrations from the book by author, illustrator, and hip-hop artist Riley Wallace.
  • Original card back design printed in metallic gold.
  • Four-color printed box features cover art from the book
  • Card size: 2.5 x 3.5 in.

 

 

Hamilcar Publications is an independent publisher based in Boston. We launched the company in November 2017. Since then we’ve published thirteen titles, with four more to be released in 2021, and several others in the pipeline.

We started out publishing books about professional boxing. We know boxing, and knew we could become the category leader in that niche—then we would expand into hip-hop, which of course dovetails perfectly with the fight game.

Hip-hop is woven into two of our boxing titles, first in our book about Muhammad Ali’s hype man Drew Bundini Brown, Bundini: Don't Believe The Hype, and even more so in the forthcoming and groundbreaking, Beatboxing: How Hip-Hop Changed the Fight Game.

Hamilcar is based on two founding principles: we know the subjects we publish about backward and forward, and we know how to make exceptionally beautiful books. We believe you’ll find both on display if you choose to back From Boom Bap to Trap.

 

Our goal is to ship all editions by June 2022.

Riley is hard at work interviewing, researching, writing, and illustrating.

All of our books go through a rigorous production process, including copyediting, typesetting, and proofreading.

After we send the book to the printer, we need to approve proofs. A work of art like this requires an exacting proofing process.

The eBook, music, digital print-ready posters, and playing cards will all be available before the books ship. We will deliver each goody as they are ready.

We will be sending you updates along the way—about the progress we are making and about extra goodies, including interviews with producers featured in the book.

The estimated shipping weights of the various versions are as follows:

  • Paperback 1.95 lbs
  • Special Edition 2.5 lbs
  • Collectors Edition 4 lbs

We will be able to ship orders within the United States via USPS Media Mail at a reasonable rate. However, some of you will undoubtedly notice that international shipping fees are substantial. We want to assure our backers that the domestic and international rates are our actual estimated costs, and we have not included any fluff for “handling”. 

We base these rates on two primary factors:

  • We ship the majority of our international orders via FedEx International and/or United Parcel Service (UPS), which are express shipping services that offer a higher standard of care than traditional national postal services. These shipping providers provide our international backers with accurate tracking information.
  • The dimensions and weight of the different versions of the book do not permit us to simply toss them in a padded envelope. We package our books with great care so that they can arrive to you in excellent condition. Proper packaging of the book increases the dimensions, and together with the significant weight of the book, combine for an unavoidably high shipping fee.

With any crowdfunding campaign, estimating and charging shipping costs is difficult. We know that you are contributing a substantial amount for each reward. It would just be hard for us lose money every time we ship a reward, which would of course defeat the point of crowdfunding. We appreciate your support and understanding!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Primary Risks & Challenges:

  • Manuscript-completion timing.
  • Production delays.
  • Printing delays.

Hamilcar Publications has been publishing books for three years. As of this project’s launch, we have successfully published thirteen titles, all with international distribution. Four more titles will be released in 2021, two of which are at the printer.

Riley is an experienced author and journalist. He has already completed 30 percent of the manuscript and 20 percent of the illustrations.

Hamilcar's Publisher, Kyle Sarofeen, has more than twenty years of publishing experience, sixteen of which were spent in production and manufacturing roles for companies like Elsevier, Quarto, and Houghton Mifflin Harcourt. At Elsevier, he managed over a hundred book projects from manuscript to bound book, at Quarto he was in charge of print production for two imprints, and at Houghton Mifflin Harcourt he was the lead print buyer for the Curious George series.

Our book designer, Brad Norr, has completed all design work. We work with the best book manufacturers and component suppliers in the industry. The printing and manufacturing slots for all editions will be locked in months ahead of time to avoid delays.

story:
Earlier this year we put together enough fans of the awesome science fiction story to get the first half printed. But Message is a massive story, over half a million words in total. The time has finally come for its second half to be published. If you'd just like to read the story, you can do so for free here. But if you'd like a copy of your own, or you missed the printing of the first book, now's your chance to be part of something cool!

I've learned a ton since the printing of the first book, and made useful connections in the printing and distribution chain that will allow for significantly lower costs on international orders. I'd like as many people as possible to be able to afford the book.

The Details

With this project, we're setting out to get a deluxe hardcover print run of the science fiction story Message in a Bottle. Thanks to the prohibitive length of the source material (over five hundred thousand words!) the story has been split into two books. This project will seek to finally print part 2 of the story, and will also allow anyone interested in getting a copy of part one to get that book in their hands.

The funds raised from this campaign will cover a few things:

  • Production of "proof" books to verify the quality of the print.
  • Original front and rear cover.
  • Printing and distribution of the book.

The book will contain minor corrections to the text made since the original publication, as well as an original short story taking place after the end of Part 2, but before the Epilogue, never to be published anywhere else.

Those who want to support the author a little could spring for an autographed copy, or support at the higher "custom chapter" tier. If there's something you thought should've seen more attention in the original story, this is how you could get a little more love for your idea. So long as your suggestion fits with the spirit and canon of the universe, it will make it into the book for all to appreciate. Otherwise, I'll post it on Fimfiction.

Risks & Challenges

The largest risk in publishing a story like Message is its enormous length. Part 2 of Message in a Bottle is about 240,000 words long, which approaches the limits of most self-publishing methods. This means a softcover cannot be produced, given the limits of small print-run bindings.

Because of the volume-oriented nature of book publishing, this project cannot proceed if it is not fully funded. We have thus selected the fixed funding goal, so that interested people can pledge with no risk that you won't get your book. If we don't meet our goal, everyone will be refunded.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's fine! Obviously I'm not printing this story for the money--it's all about getting something awesome out in print. I don't expect anyone who isn't interested in hardcover books to order. If you'd rather just read the story, great! You can do it for free right now. If you'd like to help but you don't want the book, feel free to share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested. Like anything in publication, this project gets easier the larger the volume of books we're printing.

story:
THE BASICS:

  • I am a 45-year-old woman writer recovering from a brain injury sustained when I was hit by a car.
  • My plan is to write a nonfiction book called Crossing the Street, about my recovery journey, to foster awareness and support for those dealing with the invisible effects of brain injuries.
  • Rereading Walden and Thoreau's thoughts on Life, simplicity, and what really matters resonates with me now, post-injury, in a way it never did before.
  • I am compelled to go to Walden Pond and Thoreau's birthplace to begin writing the book. 
  • Besides being an inspirational pilgrimage, travelling solo to a place I've never been before will help heal the fractured trust I have in myself as a result of the injury.
  • This pilgrimage will not only be of benefit to me personally, but the thousands of people who struggle each day with lingering effects of brain injuries, wondering if they are alone and feeling that no one understands.

*   *   *


The Moment That Changed Me

In February 2012, I was crossing a crosswalk at a busy intersection when I was hit by a car and knocked into a truck.  As well as physical injuries to my knee, neck, and wrist, I sustained a complex concussion which has taken longer than usual to heal.  Most MTBIs (mild traumatic brain injuries -- brain injuries which do not result in a coma) resolve themselves within six months or so.  Mine has been remarkably stubborn.  But the biggest challenge has been getting used to being what I call "Karen 2.0."

In short, my personality has changed.  I am not the same woman who stepped off the sidewalk that day.  The person I am now is unrecognizable to who I was before, and my relationship with myself -- my sense of who I am, being able to trust myself -- has been tricky to rebuild.

The Pilgrimage

The most significant change is that I crave simplicity and purpose, a paring-down of my life, taking out the unnecessary.  I cannot process too much at once: too many colours, too many sounds, too many questions, too much stuff, too much stress... It's all physically painful.  As it is healing, my brain is rewiring itself to be more mindful, more present.  It doesn't have time or room to process too much at once.

I read Walden more than twenty years ago, and I found myself remembering Thoreau's words -- "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life ..." Suddenly those words resonated within me in a way that they never had before.  I began rereading Walden a couple of months ago, and the more I read, the more a voice deep inside insisted, "You must go to Walden Pond."

I am a published author -- I won a couple of national short fiction awards when I was in university -- and I have been planning to write a nonfiction book, called Crossing the Street, about my experiences since the accident.  It has been a learning experience, a series of highs and lows, but I have not begun the book because I don't know the ending.  I have a sense that I'm not there yet.

In the last month there has been a growing certainty that the final chapter of the book is waiting for me at Walden.

Not only will this trip be a pilgrimage to Walden Pond, but it will help me get back in touch with myself, give me a sense of accomplishment in having made this trip by myself, and allow me to write a book that will reach out to other survivors of brain injuries and those who love them.

I must go to Walden.  Of this I am certain. 

What I Need Your Help to Do

The plan is to take a twelve-day road trip to Concord, Massachusetts in October 2015.  Because my brain tires easily, I will require a great deal of rest, so the trip needs to be spread out over almost two weeks, including travel time.

This is what I plan to do there:

  • Visit Walden Pond and the site of Thoreau's cabin, spending as much quality time there as possible
  • Visit other literary history sites in Concord, including the home of Ralph Waldo Emerson, Thoreau's mentor and another Transcendentalist whose work also inspires and resonates within me.
  • Book a total of four days at a writing retreat in the room where Thoreau was born at Thoreau Farm.  There I will begin laying out and writing Crossing the Street.
  • Take a day trip via commuter rail to Salem, Massachusetts.  The Salem Witch Trials is one of my pet history topics, and I will need a "break day" -- a shift of my brain's gears -- in the middle of my writing retreat.

Why I Need Your Help

To do this trip the way I need to do it (with ample rest) will cost about $3500.  The biggest expenses are accommodations and food, and I have also factored in gas, getting my passport, the fees for the retreat, admission fees at historic sites, travel insurance, et cetera.

Because of the brain injury, I have spent the last couple of years having difficulty in working full-time or even being trained for a new job.  Without your help, there is no way I can possibly go to Walden.  I do have a casual job in the tourism sector for the next six weeks (I had been a tour guide for twenty years, and thankfully all the information is still in my head!), but all earnings from that job must go towards my day-to-day "real life" living expenses.  (The one exception: any tips I receive in American funds are going into a jar marked 'Walden or Bust!")

In case you're wondering ...

If I am not able to raise enough funds by my planned departure date, I will put the funds in a bank account and save it for my next opportunity (likely in the spring).

Should I raise more money than needed for the trip, I will use it to help pay for needs that are related to my injuries (rehabilitative therapy, for example), and look after other day-to-day expenses during the writing of Crossing the Street.

    My Trip is Your Trip!

    I'm a born storyteller; I want to share the experience with you as much as I can.  As a result, I will be blogging daily so you can see how I'm doing and feel as if you are travelling with me, and I will be creating a memory book as well.  I have deliberately chosen my perks so that you can participate with me as much as possible.  I may even leave a stone for some of you at the site of Thoreau's cabin!

    Risks & Challenges

    I have been dealing with being "neurologically compromised" long enough now that I know how to work around it.  Although I have managed a couple of solo trips in the past couple of years, there is always a possibility that I may need more rest than anticipated.  I have factored in a "buffer zone" in the financial goal.  Stress is one of the biggest factors in brain fatigue, so the added peace of mind will be beneficial as well. 

    I have also been researching the route via Google Maps and Streetview, and will be travelling at non-peak hours for traffic.  I decided on commuter rail for the trip to Salem so I don't have to drive that day.

    This trip will not be easy but I have every confidence that I will be fine, and the sense of achievement of having done it is something that will go a long way towards healing the less-tangible wounds from the accident.


    Please Help Spread the Word

    Even if you can't contribute, it would mean a great deal to me if you could share my campaign and let people know my story. 

    As an "invisible condition," brain injuries are common and yet still not well-understood by society in general.  By sharing my campaign, you are not only assisting me in achieving my goal, but you are also raising crucial awareness and understanding about Mild Traumatic Brain Injuries (MTBIs).

    Thank you for your time.  Be well.  :)
story_txt:
THE BASICS:

I am a 45-year-old woman writer recovering from a brain injury sustained when I was hit by a car.
My plan is to write a nonfiction book called Crossing the Street, about my recovery journey, to foster awareness and support for those dealing with the invisible effects of brain injuries.
Rereading Walden and Thoreau's thoughts on Life, simplicity, and what really matters resonates with me now, post-injury, in a way it never did before.
I am compelled to go to Walden Pond and Thoreau's birthplace to begin writing the book.  

Besides being an inspirational pilgrimage, travelling solo to a place I've never been before will help heal the fractured trust I have in myself as a result of the injury.
This pilgrimage will not only be of benefit to me personally, but the thousands of people who struggle each day with lingering effects of brain injuries, wondering if they are alone and feeling that no one understands.


*   *   *


The Moment That Changed Me
 In February 2012, I was crossing a crosswalk at a busy intersection when I was hit by a car and knocked into a truck.  As well as physical injuries to my knee, neck, and wrist, I sustained a complex concussion which has taken longer than usual to heal.  Most MTBIs (mild traumatic brain injuries -- brain injuries which do not result in a coma) resolve themselves within six months or so.  Mine has been remarkably stubborn.  But the biggest challenge has been getting used to being what I call "Karen 2.0." 
In short, my personality has changed.  I am not the same woman who stepped off the sidewalk that day.  The person I am now is unrecognizable to who I was before, and my relationship with myself -- my sense of who I am, being able to trust myself -- has been tricky to rebuild.

The PilgrimageThe most significant change is that I crave simplicity and purpose, a paring-down of my life, taking out the unnecessary.  I cannot process too much at once: too many colours, too many sounds, too many questions, too much stuff, too much stress... It's all physically painful.  As it is healing, my brain is rewiring itself to be more mindful, more present.  It doesn't have time or room to process too much at once.I read Walden more than twenty years ago, and I found myself remembering Thoreau's words -- "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately,
to front only the essential facts of life ..." Suddenly those words resonated within me in a way that they never had before.  I began rereading Walden a couple of months ago, and the more I read, the more a voice deep inside insisted, "You must go to Walden Pond."

Why I Need Your HelpTo do this trip the way I need to do it (with ample rest) will cost about $3500.  The biggest expenses are accommodations and food, and I have also factored in gas, getting my passport, the fees for the retreat, admission fees at historic sites, travel insurance, et cetera.Because of the brain injury, I have spent the last couple of years having difficulty in working full-time or even being trained for a new job.  Without your help, there is no way I can possibly go to Walden.  I do have a casual job in the tourism sector for the next six weeks (I had been a tour guide for twenty years, and thankfully all the information is still in my head!), but all earnings from that job must go towards my day-to-day "real life" living expenses.  (The one exception: any tips I receive in American funds are going into a jar marked 'Walden or Bust!")In case you're wondering ...

story:
Hi,

I’m Cody L. Hayes. I’m a family law attorney in Scottsdale, Arizona. My law firm, Hayes Esquire PLLC, is dedicated to helping people become unmarried without ruining the rest of their lives.

In a dysfunctional marriage, nobody wins. So when divorce becomes the best option, it’s important to have the right emotional, financial and legal tools at your disposal to move you toward your brightest future possible.

Divorce is the end of a marriage, but it can also be the beginning of a fulfilling life for everyone involved.

While I practice law in Arizona, the principles of my approach to divorce can be applied from coast to coast. That’s why I’m writing a book that will help people become unmarried without ruining the rest of their lives — and help couples with children transition from husband and wife to partners in parenting.

With your help, I’ll raise the $22,000 I need to turn my manuscript into a published book within the next six months. The money I raise through this campaign will cover the costs of manuscript development, design, editing, production, printing, and shipment to you!

In exchange for your support, you’ll be among the first to receive this life-changing book. In fact, as soon as you contribute, you’ll receive an excerpt from the book — and continuous updates throughout the process.

Thank you so much for contributing and/or sharing this campaign with people you think could benefit from a divorce that keeps conflict and confrontation to an absolute minimum. Your support could change someone’s life dramatically…Maybe even your own!

story:
Cancer centers and chemotherapy lounges are depressing!  Help send a copy of my book THE FUNNY THING ABOUT CANCER to someone who needs it.  A 150 page, hilarious, raw and uncut view from a comedian fighting cancer.  

I'm 28 years old, too young to only have 5 % chance of living to 2018 right?  But that's life I guess.  While I do have time left on this earth, I am going to make it count!  I have always been a writer - now, with your help, I get to be a writer with a deep purpose.  TO HELP CANCER PATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES LAUGH IN THEIR DARKEST TIMES.

After my web series 'The Funny Thing About Cancer' reached almost 100,000 people from all over the world IN JUST 48 HOURS - I knew I was on to something. After joking about it in a video, 1000's of emails poured in telling me I should write a book to help newly diagnosed cancer patients, I fell in love with the idea. The funding will be used to self publish my book and distribute to cancer centers across North America.

Any funds earned above the publishing and shipping costs will be evenly distributed. Half going to help me fund the insanely high cost of prescription drugs and cannabis oil and the other half to cancer charities/groups of my choosing.

My book is titled The Funny Thing About Cancer.

Please consider pre-buying my book for a friend or love one.  The book is practically complete and gets better every day.


A little about me.  I am 28 years old.  A comedian and comedy club owner.  I have Stage 3 esophageal cancer.  I have been given a 2-5% chance of making it through this more than 3 years.  I was a smoker since I was 16 because I guess I'M A IDIOT.  Life is really different now that I am dying, but I am getting by.  I figured I could combine my witty writing and raw and real approach to make a hell of a book for cancer survivors, loved ones of cancer patients and the newly diagnosed.

Average costs involved in self-publishing, according to a Forbes article from earlier this year:

ISBN: $240

Developmental Editor: $1500-$2500

Copy Editor: $2000-$3000

Cover Design: $1200-$1500

Printing: $7000-$9000 per 1000.

Shipping: $4-5 each. ($5000)

Total: $21,240

Thank you everyone for checking this out.  I appreciate all the support and kind words.

story:
Csodaidők fordítás / Translation of my book Csodaidők

2006-ban jelent meg a Csodaidők első kötete magyarul, 2010-ben az utolsó, és bár azóta jó pár év eltelt, a sorozat piacon maradt, és lassan emelkedik az éves fogyása.

The first part of the Csodaidők series came out in 2006, the fourth, last part in 2010. Though a couple of years passed since then, it kept its place in the book market sales, even stepped forward a bit.

Ezekben az években időről időre megpróbáltam lefordítani az első kötetet angolra, mert tudtam, hogy úgy sokkal nagyobb közösséget érhetnék el, de nem sikerült. Végül megkértem valakit a fordításra. Aztán néhányan a moly.hu-n azt mondták, indítsak közösségi kampányt.

Hát íme.

In these years, I tried to translate it to English over and over again, because I knew I could reach a wider audience, but I couldn't. Then, I asked a translator. Meanwhile, some of my readers on moly.hu (the Hungarian Goodreads) told me to start a campaign.

So here we go.

Amit a támogatóimnak ígérek: bár nem sok, de szívesen adok ingyen e-könyvet bármelyik sorozatból (Csodaidők/Időcsodák), sőt, ezt dedikálni is tudom. :-)

És ha megjelenik angolul is, abból is szívesen adok mindenkinek, aki csak igényt tart rá.

The only thing I can offer to my supporters now are free, customized e-books (of the complete Csodaidők or the yet incomplete Időcsodák series) in Hungarian. Perhaps later I can send English ebooks as well, but that depends on my future rights to it (whether I will publish it or somebody else).


Megéri-e támogatni? / Is this project worth supporting?

Ha szeretnéd tudni, megéri-e ezt a projektet támogatni, látogass el a csodaidok.hu oldalra. Itt nemcsak általános ismertetőt vagy kritikákat olvashatsz róla, de az első kötetet (aminek a fordítását tervezem) ingyen le is töltheted, hogy dönteni tudj (tetszőleges ekönyv formátumban). A moly.hu-n pedig akár az egész sorozatról olvashatsz értékeléseket. A Moly SF listáján a Csodaidők több kötete benne van a legjobb tízben (2. 3. és 6. helyezések).

If you want to know whether this project is worth supporting, please visit my webpage csodaidok.hu. Here you can read some reviews and the first half of the book in English, or even download the first book in Hungarian for free. Those can help you to decide. On the SF list of Moly.hu three books of the complete series can be found in the top ten (2nd, 3rd and 6th respectively).

Ha elkészül... / If it's finished...

A kész könyvet először egy kiadónak küldöm be, akik korábban már érdeklődtek vele kapcsolatban. Ha ők nem adják ki, ekönyvként saját kiadómon keresztül az Amazonon szeretném megjelentetni.

Onnantól pedig... majd meglátjuk. Lehet, hogy nem lesz belőle semmi. De egy esélyt megér, nem?

The complete translation first will be sent to a publishing company that has already asked me to send it to them. If they refuse to publish it, I will publish it on Amazon.com in ebook format. And from there on... who knows. Perhaps it will go unnoticed, and nothing comes out of it. But it deserves a chance, doesn't it?


Hogyan tudsz segíteni? / How can you help?

Talán anyagilag nem tudsz segíteni: hadd kérjelek akkor arra, hogy beszélj erről a kampányról másoknak, oszd meg, vagy szólj olyannak, aki talán tud segíteni. A legkisebb támogatás is sokat számít.

Perhaps you cannot contribute. But then, I'd like to ask you to talk about the campaign to others, share it, or call people's attention who can be interested in it. Even the smallest support means a lot to me.


Mi van, ha több jön össze, mint a tervezett? / What if I raise more than I planned?

Ebben a valószínűtlen esetben a pénzt magánkiadás esetén a szöveg további gondozására fogom fordítani. Ha nem lesz szükség magánkiadásra, a következő kötet lefordítását fogom belőle finanszírozni.

In this very unlikely scenario I will spend the money on the further editing of the text – in case of self-publication. If that will not be needed, I will spend it on the translation of the second part of the series.

story:
Your contributions will help me self-publish my book before my birthday on April 18! I really need your support! I'm counting on you.

Your contributions will help me pay for these services:

  • Book Distribution Features
  • Online & Wholesale Book Distribution
  • PDF eBook Distribution
  • Amazon Kindle Distribution
  • Nook Distribution (Barnes & Noble)
  • Google/Android Books Distribution
  • Editor's Manuscript Evaluation
  • Custom Layout (inside, front and back covers)
  • Paperback Edition
  • Hardcover Edition
My book mission:

Through this book I hope to become a voice of hope in despair, to give you reasons not to look at yourself as a victim but as a testimony. I found my purpose and I am now an advocate for women who suffer from low self esteem. had been bullied, suffer from an identity crisis, felt unwanted and hiding behind a heavy baggage of rejection and hurt.

My prayer is that you surrender to God and let all of your burdens go, give space for Jesus to wash away your past and give you a brand new start! YOU CAN  DO THIS ... I know you can! God  gave me a new life and allowed me to paint a new future for myself and my family.

I care about you and that’s why I decided to share my story…

(1 John 1:8-10 KJ21 Bible verse) If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness. If we say that we have not sinned, we make Him a liar, and His Word is not in us.

story:
A Quick Q&A

1.  Who/What is Inked Paws? Inked Paws is an independent (aka indie) publishing house that four writing friends have started/are starting. Said friends are A. E. Moseley, Sarah Swanson, Samantha Liggio and R. A. Odum.

Our goal is to combine the best of self-publishing (author control of what they write, covers and release dates), with the best of traditional publishing (marketing, large readership, publicity help) while creating inventive collections and books that inspire and challenge readers.

2. Why the name Inked Paws? The name Inked Paws comes from our logo of a puppy with a quill and inky paws. Yes we're fun loving and creative, similar to a bouncy puppy (or any young animal for that matter), but we're dedicated and passionate about what we do.

3.  What’s so great about traditional publishing? Traditional publishing reaches a greater audience, because books are more easily placed in libraries, schools, and physical bookstores. That allows a wider variety of people, and those who can't afford e-readers, access to your books. Traditional publishing also provides help with publicity, and we plan to provide blog tours, book signings, web-chats, Youtube videos, and even more as we increase our reach. Publishing houses also garner more respect from readerships because they know they are getting professionally vetted quality.

4.  What’s so great about self-publishing? Authors get to pick everything. Covers, release date, what they write, total control over their publicity, and more. These choices mean that the book is truly what the author envisioned. The cover reflects the book as does the description. Readers don’t have to second guess if what they see on the cover is what they are really going to get. When the author chooses their release date they are not being pressured to meet a short deadline that a company has created for them, therefore they are able to truly take their time and perfect their book before releasing.

5.  If I choose to donate where will my money go? When you choose to donate you can either send the money directly via Paypal or through credit card. Both methods are secure. Until a bank account is established for Inked Paws (which requires a LLC), the money will be held by one of our members then transferred to the Inked Paws account. This is what you will see when you donate, a name, not the business name Inked Paws Publishing. Not only is this something that we want to do to keep trust, but it is also legally stated in the Indie Go Go terms of service that we must use the money as stated in our campaign. When you donate rest assured that your money is going to a good cause and that it will be used the way it's supposed to be used. You're protected and so is your money!

With all that being said, there is a lot that is going into Inked Paws so here is the list of our needs. We have decided to round up to the nearest 100 so that we will not fall short of our needs and be left dry before starting (unless there is a set price for the need). All prices are in US dollars.

  • LLC licensure ($125): Limited Liability Company licensure allows Inked Paws to legally earn money and to pay our writers. This makes us legitimate and also gives us the ability to look into grants for extra funding. This is a one-time cost.
  • Inked Paws Website ($1,000): This includes the domain name, special email addresses for the company, and a customized layout that reflects us. The layout, which makes the majority of the price, is a one-time cost.
  • Year 1 book ($2,000): To publish one book costs about $2,000. This covers the publishing and formating of the print book, the e-books (multiple platforms including Kindle, Nook and iBooks), cover, distribution and basic press release.
  • Publicity for Year 1 book ($1,000): As we grow our reach we will be able to put more money towards each book’s publicity. For now each book gets $1,000. This includes book signings/readings, blog tours, swag packs.
  • Extra money: Any extra money will go towards the publication and publicity of Year 2 (2016) books, as well as extra publicity for Year 1 (2015) books.

6.  What do I get from Inked Paws as a reader? As a donator? As a reader you get to have access to high quality books that are in the speculative fiction genre. Speculative fiction is anything that couldn’t 100% be accurate/done according to science (think Hunger Games, Harry Potter, Redwall). Inked Paws provides books that inspire and make reader think. Our books break away from what many readers and writers alike call the “cookie cutter” formula that is in most Young Adult and Adult literature. We’re readers too and we know how hard it is to find a book with the right balance of elements. There’s diversity in the world and we want our books to reflect that. As readers you get to share in that!

As a donator you get the perks listed to the right according to how much you donate. But also as a donator you get to take pride in the fact that you’re helping change the way small publishers are viewed and what kinds of books make it to the reader. That is pretty empowering.

7.  I’ve got a book/collection/etc. in the works. Will you publish me? For the next few years (three or four) we are not looking for any new writers to join our family. We are so humbled and honored by all the interest that Inked Paws has gathered from the start but right now we want our focus on making Inked Paws the very best it can be before we add any new writers Rest assured when we are ready for more writers, we’ll make an announcement! We would love to be in touch so please feel free to contact us at inkedpawpub[at]gmail[dot]com

story:
The Short Version

The Plan

Our goal is to publish a book called A Peace of My Mind: American Stories, a collection of portraits and personal stories gathered from across the country and built around the simple question, “What does peace mean to you?”

The Past

In a world that asks us to focus on the things that can separate us, A Peace of My Mind is a multimedia arts project that encourages us to consider the common humanity that connects us.

Founded in 2009 by photographer and author John Noltner (me), we published our first award-winning book with 50 stories gathered in Minnesota. This collection was also produced as two exhibits that travel the country and serve as a catalyst for dialog about conflict resolution, civic responsibility, and social change.

The Pitch

Now we have a brand new collection of stories, gathered from across the country. We need your help to share these inspiring stories in our second book called A Peace of My Mind: American Stories. The simplest way to help is to pre-order this new book, and encourage your friends to do the same. Our goal is to release our new book on September 21, the International Day of Peace. Books will ship in the fall, making it a great gift for yourself, or the person you know who could use a little more peace in their life. Of course, you can also support this effort at a higher level to help us reach our goal more quickly. We have exciting perks to say thank you at all levels. You'll find the details listed on the right side of this page. 

“ John Noltner takes us on a unique journey filled with revelations of courage and commitment, resilience and hope. It is a beautiful journey that speaks to our innermost being. It touches us in a way that allows us to see the world from a different perspective. Perhaps it will inspire us to become peacemakers.” - ELA GHANDI , SOUTH AFRICAN PEACE ACTIVIST AND GRANDDAUGHTER OF MAHATMA GANDHI

The Longer Version

Over the past three years, I have driven 40,000 miles across the United States asking people the simple question, "What does peace mean to you?" 

I've worked for 20 years as a freelance photographer, producing images for national magazines, Fortune 500 companies, and non-profit organizations. I've always appreciated the rich diversity of the people I've encountered, but over the years I have become increasingly concerned with the divisive nature of our national dialog...the way we are asked to focus on the things that can separate us.

In a world that had become increasingly polarized, I set out to use my photography and storytelling to rediscover what we have in common...to look for the humanity that we all share....and to celebrate what is good.

It's been a calling...a journey of discovery...a leap of faith. And I've met amazing people everywhere I've gone. I've interviewed survivors of violence, refugees, civil rights activists, artists, ranchers, veterans, ex-prisoners, and many others. These fascinating people from all walks of life have revealed extraordinary insights and honest stories that explore ways we can work toward common good and create a world that is more just for all. 

The interviews are complete, the photos are taken, and the text is edited. Now I need your help to share these stories of hope in a new book that celebrates our common experience and builds a deep sense of community.

"The words and the faces in John Noltner’s book invite us in, and encourage us to slow down and to reflect on what matters most.” - JOHN BIEWEN, AUDIO PROGRAM DIRECTOR, CENTER FOR DOCUMENTARY STUDIES, DUKE UNIVERSITY

The Book

We have planned a 160-page, full color, soft-cover book. 8-1/4"x 11" in size. Each person will be featured on a 2-page spread, with a large, full-color portrait, a brief biography, and a 300-600 word excerpt from their interview. Each story will be accompanied by an illustrated map indicating what part of the country the person is from, and some stories will feature a short pull-quote from the person as well.


In the back, we will list a short collection of discussion questions that you can use with your family or book club to explore some of the themes and issues raised in the stories.

If you donate at the $100 level or higher, your name will be listed in the back of the book as a supporter.

Our planned release date is the International Day of Peace, September 21, 2016. I can't imagine a more appropriate day to bring these stories into the world.

“ Honest humanity comes shining through on every page, with every word and photo. I have no doubt whatsoever that this book will serve as a wonderful trailhead for those seeking to find and walk the path of Peace.” - GARY BERGSTROM, FROM THE EXHIBIT GUEST BOOK

The Perks

We need help to do this the right way. Our budget will go toward professional editing and design, high quality printing, and a marketing campaign to share these stories of hope in a challenging world.

Our perks are built around pre-orders for the book.  We welcome your help at any level and have developed an exciting collection of rewards as our way of saying thank you for your support. 

  • The easiest way to help is to order a book for yourself at $25 (And then tell your friends to do the same!)
  • You can have your name listed on the book's sponsor page for $100 or more.
  • Make plans for your book club or social group and get 12 books for $250.
  • Want to throw in a Skype conversation with the author? You can do it starting at $500.
  • If you're feeling especially generous, you can even host a multi-media keynote presentation or one of our nationally-touring traveling exhibits in your community.

A Peace of My Mind has a proven track record of engaging communities in conversations about conflict resolution, civic responsibility, and social change. The project has been presented at the Nobel Peace Prize Forum, the Gandhi - King Conference, and the Sojourners Summit for Change, as well as colleges and community centers across the country. 

"This project is a work of art and a great source of hope. It is a beautiful and inspiring prompt for conversation about how to make the world a more peaceful place." - RABBI AMY EILBERG, UNITED THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY

Founded in 2009, our first 50 stories were produced in Minnesota. I've been able to gather all the stories on my own...self-funding travel and subsidizing the project with my assignment photography...but I've had help along the way with capital campaigns, allowing us to grow the project and move it toward being self-sustaining...and that's why we're doing this current campaign.

  • In 2010, I received funding from the Minnesota State Arts Board to produce our first traveling exhibit from the series.
  • In 2011, I used crowd-funding to create our first book. Gandhi's granddaughter, South African peace activist Ela Gandhi, wrote the foreword for the book, which won a Gold medal in the Midwest Book Awards, and a Silver IPPY.
  • In 2013, a collection of sponsors helped us produce a second copy of our traveling exhibit. 
  • Right now, we have a book that's ready to come into a world that desperately needs a positive message of unity and hope. I thought I could do it all on my own, but I can't...I need your help to get there. Keep reading and you'll understand why.
What People Are Saying

“ John Noltner has created rich and meaningful art that can make a real difference. His poignant photography reveals the common humanity in people of all backgrounds and walks of life. The many perspectives and meanings of peace revealed by his interviews show that on a deep level, we all seek and need peace in one form or another. I would recommend his work to anyone who wants to experience the diversity of human beings and the universality of the human condition. “  - JIM WALLIS, NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLING AUTHOR OF THE UNCOMMON GOOD, PRESIDENT OF SOJOURNERS, & EDITOR-IN-CHIEF OF SOJOURNERS MAGAZINE


"Seeing these faces and reading these powerful words give me hope and strengthen my conviction that we can move into a more peaceful and just world." - FROM THE EXHIBIT GUESTBOOK

"A Peace of My Mind is a piece of Heaven  on Earth. In the midst of a broken, and too often bloodied world, Noltner has curated a wondrous collection of real life stories of transformation and hope that reminds us of who we really are - blessings to each other." - ROGER WOLSEY, DIRECTOR, WELSLEY FOUNDATION AT THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO - BOULDER

"John Noltner is one of those people moving the mission of Howard Zinn and Studds Terkel into the future." - HARVEY WINJE, EDITOR, THE ALLEY

"In a time when so much of what we see and read concerns war and violence, photographer John Noltner reminds us through his beautiful portraiture and powerful text that sometimes even the smallest gestures can have a great impact on ourselves and the people around us." - TERESA SCALZO, DIRECTOR OF PUBLICATIONS, CARLETON COLLEGE


“In an era when divisive rhetoric drives people to huddle in like-minded groups, it's refreshing and enlightening to find a place where differences not only are explored, but also celebrated. A Peace of My Mind introduces us to people we likely would never meet on our own, and as we get to know these people, we come to realize that our differences are minuscule in light of the most-important trait: that we all want peace.” - JEFF STRICKLER, FAITH & VALUES REPORTER, MINNEAPOLIS STAR TRIBUNE

The Challenge
For the past year I have pursued the traditional publishing route...with an agent and a publisher...and I continue to hear the same response. "This is an amazing project, with beautiful photos, and insightful text...but we don't think we are going to make enough money off it...so good luck."

No more waiting...now is the time.

I am either stubborn or foolish (sometimes it's hard to know the difference) but I believe the world needs this message now more than ever. Everywhere I share these stories, people are touched. They are inspired. There is work to do, and these stories can encourage people to pursue their own paths toward making the world a better place.

If you believe we can do better, please help us reach our goal. If you believe that you could use a little encouragement of your own, donate today...and plan to hold this book in your hands before the year is done.

If we meet our goal, we will print 3,000 copies of our book. If we pass our goal, we have a few exciting options:

  • We can produce a larger print run of the book.
  • We can create a traveling exhibit...as we've done with the first book...and make these stories available to audiences across the country.
  • We can hit the road and bring these stories from coast-to-coast, building community and encouraging others along the way.

Other ways you can help

If you are unable to contribute, but still want to help, here are a few easy things you can do:

  • Share this message with your friends in person and on your social media.
  • Follow A Peace of My Mind and feed yourself a steady diet of stories about people who are doing good.
  • Keep an eye on the campaign for exciting updates and information about when the project will be in your area.
  • Indiegogo has great tools for sharing...use them to help us build more interest in this campaign and reach our goals.

"A Peace of My Mind is a piece of Heaven  on Earth. In the midst of a broken, and too often bloodied world, Noltner has curated a wondrous collection of real life stories of transformation and hope that reminds us of who we really are - blessings to each other." - ROGER WOLSEY, DIRECTOR, WELSLEY FOUNDATION AT THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO - BOULDER

"John Noltner is one of those people moving the mission of Howard Zinn and Studds Terkel into the future." - HARVEY WINJE, EDITOR, THE ALLEY

"In a time when so much of what we see and read concerns war and violence, photographer John Noltner reminds us through his beautiful portraiture and powerful text that sometimes even the smallest gestures can have a great impact on ourselves and the people around us." - TERESA SCALZO, DIRECTOR OF PUBLICATIONS, CARLETON COLLEGE


“In an era when divisive rhetoric drives people to
huddle in like-minded groups, it's refreshing and enlightening to find a place
where differences not only are explored, but also celebrated. A Peace of My Mind introduces us to
people we likely would never meet on our own, and as we get to know these people,
we come to realize that our differences are minuscule in light of the
most-important trait: that we all want peace.” - JEFF STRICKLER, FAITH & VALUES REPORTER, MINNEAPOLIS STAR TRIBUNE

The Challenge

For the past year I have pursued the traditional publishing route...with an agent and a publisher...and I continue to hear the same response. "This is an amazing project, with beautiful photos, and insightful text...but we don't think we are going to make enough money off it...so good luck."

No more waiting...now is the time.

I am either stubborn or foolish (sometimes it's hard to know the difference) but I believe the world needs this message now more than ever. Everywhere I share these stories, people are touched. They are inspired. There is work to do, and these stories can encourage people to pursue their own paths toward making the world a better place.

If you believe we can do better, please help us reach our goal. If you believe that you could use a little encouragement of your own, donate today...and plan to hold this book in your hands before the year is done.

If we meet our goal, we will print 3,000 copies of our book. If we pass our goal, we have a few exciting options:


We can produce a larger print run of the book.
We can create a traveling exhibit...as we've done with the first book...and make these stories available to audiences across the country.
We can hit the road and bring these stories from coast-to-coast, building community and encouraging others along the way.





 Other ways you can help
If you are unable to contribute, but still want to help, here are a few easy things you can do:  Share this message with your friends in person and on your social media.
Follow A Peace of My Mind and feed yourself a steady diet of stories about people who are doing good.
Keep an eye on the campaign for exciting updates and information about when the project will be in your area. Indiegogo has great tools for sharing...use them to help us build more interest in this campaign and reach our goals.

story:
Napkin Diaries: Poetry Petite

 This campaign has ended but you can still be a contributor by contacting us directly at napkindiary@gmail.com

Napkin Diaries is a collection of ideas that began as observations, poems, sketches and lyrical ideas scrawled in haste on Cocktail Napkins; the most readily available medium for a gigging Jazz Musician as he ran from stage to bar, before the notion was lost forever in the haze of the next moment, the next improvisation, the next song. Somehow these napkins were stashed away and survived five moves, two expeditions, a divorce, two earthquakes and a resuscitation.

Then, during one of the excavations of a storage unit, a few of the old napkins flew out and an idea started to grow. David dug through old boxes and suitcases filled with unexplored inventions, song ideas, movie ideas, comedy ideas and angry rants. He pored over them and began to rework these thoughts, honing them down to the purest essence of thought. Eventually deciding to use an old manual typewriter to put them back on his medium of choice: The Cocktail Napkin.

Napkin Diaries began appearing on instagram and facebook in April of 2015 under the anonymous username dbwii. it can now be found at www.instagram.com/napkindiary

In February of 2016 the first volume of Napkin Diaries was published; but, there's more than just the stories to this story.

I need funding to publish the first 1000 books in soft-cover and create an accompanying CD of spoken-word and Jazz to go along with the book and I'm seeking your help to do it.

Napkin Diaries isn't just for reading, it's for listening too. 

I'm seeking $10,000 in funding to produce the first 1000 copies of books and CDs of the spoken work. Unlike other projects, this material is already created, you can review it online and decide if you want to be a part of the final project.

  • To print the first 1000 books I will need approximately $6000. The book has already been created and is being sold online at blurb.com but funders will receive special copies as well as some other unique items.
  • To record, mix, master, design and press the first 1000 CDs I will need approximately $4000.
  • Funders will be given an exclusive invite to attend the taping of the spoken word project as soon as the project is funded.
  • Funders will recieve a special, signed and certified copy of the book and of the CD.
  • For each $100 investment, funders will also receive two tickets to a private concert and reading by David Patrone and his Jazz band.
  • Funders who donate $500 or more will recieve an original Napkin Diaries Artwork of their choice, as in, the ACTUAL napkin that was photographed and used in this book or others that have been featured on our social media accounts. Obviously this is a first-come, first-served option although funders may also select two Original Reproductions of the napkins which are created in exactly the same way as the original and all come with a signed and embossed Certificate of Authenticity.
  • There are lots of other perks available including singing telegrams and voicemail recordings and even a private concert anywhere in the US.

The Impact

Many of you know me personally and have spent some time at my shows. You know the quality of work I produce. Napkin Diaries is the creation I am most of proud of in my life. When I first published Napkin Diaries, I didn't realize how excessive the cost would be for fans to buy the work from the printing company. I had no money to print copies in bulk so I'm offering lots of added value to get a large run published. This campaign is a way to get a bunch of copies printed so that I can distribute the rest of the copies to publishers in an effort to get published by a major publishing house. It also makes the work more financially accessible to people at our shows and readings and will be something tangible I can give to people at speaking engagements on creativity, PTSD and recovery:

  • This campaign is not making me a bunch of money. It's primary purpose is to have copies to get to publishers and to sell copies at shows at a reasonable price.
  • I believe Napkin Diaries is a significant artistic work which will stand the test of time.
  • This is the first of at least ten volumes which are estimated to be published.
  • Napkin Diaries addresses several serious issues I have faced in my life including recovery, PTSD and the creative process.  It has already created an impact in the lives of many, from people in addiction recovery to my fellow veterans, high school audiences and spiritual seekers,

Risks & Challenges

Five years ago I would have been able to just throw down the money and publish this all without asking for help from you folks but the fact of the matter is that things have been tough in the last few years. I'm grateful for the challenges because they are the reason I was able to write these works. I'm not accustomed to asking for help from people and that's something I've had to accept lately too. Your support makes it possible for me to continue creating interesting projects.  Without your support I probably would have split town for the next life a long time ago.

  • The things I share in this book are intensely personal and I have been warned that they would hurt my career; but, I came to a decision that it was more important to be honest than to be safe.
  • I promise you that this is just the beginning of a long literary relationship.
  • These poems and excerpts are honest and revealing glimpses into my heart and soul. I don't pull punches when it comes to my writing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate or invest I can certainly appreciate that. In the last several years I have been homeless, without a vehicle, lived on a boat, rode my bike and even took public transportation to shows. There were days when I had to decide whether a can of soda was worth the bus fare and as a result I have a whole new appreciation for the impact of five bucks. There are still some things you can do to help:

  • Make a contribution of any amount, even 5 bucks can go a long way.
  • Post this campaign on your social media.
  • Use the convenient indiegogo tools to share our instagram and facebook or other SM pages.
  • Introduce your friends to my work.
  • Hire us for a gig! Hire me to do a singing telegram!
  • Come to my shows and shake my hand. Let me know you dig it.

If you've gotten this far, I want to thank you for taking the time to read my campaign. I really appreciate all of our fans, without you I would have never been able to create things like Napkin Diaries.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

It costs £81 to print each issue and we're not seeking any profit on that, we want to create a physical record of warehouse life for us to share on a monthly basis.

Issue 1 was riso printed at workers co-op, Footprint:

http://www.footprinters.co.uk/

Other Ways You Can Help

We NEED your contributions, anything and everything is welcome.  Let us know about any news or events in the area. Share your stories, poems, illustrations, thoughts etc with us. We know you've got a lot. 

If you run a business from the warehouses also get in touch, we'd love to help spread the word about the fantastic work you're doing.

story:
Le projet « cataracte » de Time To Help

L’organisation mondiale de la santé prévient que d’ici 2020, on atteindra les 76 millions de malvoyants si de réelles mesures de prévention ne sont pas prises. Selon les résultats d’une enquête réalisée on constate que 75% des troubles visuels sont traitables.

90% des personnes atteintes sont issues des pays en voie de développement. La cataracte étant la première cause de la cécité (51%). On estime qu’il y a 20 millions de patients dans le monde concernés par cette maladie.

Qu’est-ce que la cataracte?

La cataracte est l’opacification partielle ou totale du cristallin de l’œil. Cette opacification est responsable d’une baisse progressive de la vue qui peut entrainer la perte totale de ce sens. Son traitement est simple et efficace. Ce phénomène – causé par des rayonnements directs et indirects du soleil, la malnutrition ou des tempêtes de sable – est très répandu en Afrique.

Malgré que son traitement soit simple, rien qu’au Darfour, plus de 2 millions de patients atteints de la cataracte, y compris des nouveau-nés, sont privés de la lumière par manque de moyen.

Éclairez leur monde avec vos dons !

Afin d’atteindre le plus grand nombre de patients, nous coopérons avec les hôpitaux, les polycliniques, les organisations d’aide humanitaire et les associations locales.

Faites un don de 80€ (prix d’une opération chirurgicale) dès aujourd’hui et sauvez la vue/vie d’une personne atteinte.

Eclairez leur monde avec vos dons !

Vos dons seront leurs espoirs de vue et de vie.

story:
Hello, my name is Thomas Robelot.  I am a college senior at the University of South Carolina and have one semester left before I graduate in December 2015. I am a Mass Communications major and have a number of skills. I can film and edit video. I have also written a few articles for an independent magazine and the school’s “Garnet&Black” magazine. Two of my articles can be found on my blog at "https://plus.google.com/+TommyRobelot/about"                        1)http://aletheiaampelos.blogspot.com/                         2)http://humanitylost2vice.blogspot.com/

I grew up overseas in Belgium and France, and have visited most of Europe so I have an international, multicultural background. I am bilingual in French and English and speak a little Spanish. I am not fluent in Russian or Ukrainian but I am willing to learn.

The plan is to raise enough money to intern at the Kyiv Post. The Kyiv Post is Ukraine's first English-speaking newspaper. It was founded in 1995 and started from practically nothing. Their modo is "independence, community and trust," and they've covered everything from the Euromaiden Revolution to the Russian occupation of Crimea. I was hoping to meet the media crew this summer and return post-graduation to work more extensively. Having a multicultural background has allowed me to become strong and confident. I am not afraid to write the tough stories nor am I intimidated by scary situations. I really want to expand my knowledge and challenge my comfort zone. I am not looking for an easy job. I want to do the hard work in order to gain perspective and pursue a career in journalism to achieve the experience necessary to succeed.     

Being able to make this trip to Ukraine will allow me to pursue my career goals and follow my dreams. It would mean the world to me! I need at least 3,000 dollars to cover the airplane ticket, food, housing and transportation. The cost of the ticket alone is anywhere from $1,600 to $2,000. I need to reach this goal at least by July 1st but I would prefer to leave by mid-June.

The stories I am assigned will enlighten my experience. I would love to connect with people who are interested in reading my articles and discovering other projects involved. 

If I do not reach my entire goal this summer, the funds will be saved for post graduation, in December, where I will attempt a second trip to Ukraine with the intention of staying for a few years in a paid position.

Ukraine is in a fragile state. The conflict between the Russians and Ukrainians is a real threat to their democracy and freedom. While many are fighting for a sovereign nation, the internal struggle with government corruption, corporate greed and fascism continues. I want to be able to make an impact now and in the future. This trip is very important for establishing familiarity, rapport and making the right connections. 

Depending on where they place me and what I will be reporting, I could be covering dangerous stories --the war, government corruption, the Russian occupation etc. It will be a risky challenge but an incredible opportunity. Ultimately, I am not in a comfortable financial situation. I will be renting out my room for the summer to focus on this objective. I need support and people who believe in pursuing their dreams. Thank you so much in advance.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.


Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
