story:
Attending the event?  Buy a ticket on the right (Entry Fee) or sign up to spell (Bee Participant).

Feeling generous? Select another perk for bonuses like free drinks and t-shirts!

Can’t make it?  You can still support our cause by selecting any perk or customize your donation using the Contribute Now button.

"If you don't know, now you know..."

We're two guys with a passion for bringing people together and giving back to our community. The idea for We B-E-E Spelling started like so many great ideas do: over a few drinks at a party. "How do you do something meaningful outside of your day job? Why is giving back so damn inconvenient? And do fundraisers always have to be such a bore?" We reached two (obvious) conclusions: 1.) doing good shouldn't be a hassle and 2.) it shouldn't be a drag, either.

Problem, meet silly-ution.

How do you make philanthropy fun and easy? Disguise it as a ridiculous event full of laughter, upbeat music, and spirited competition and transform "good time" money spent into "good cause" served.

We B-E-E Spelling is an intoxicating spelling bee and fundraising event. We take the nostalgia of a spelling bee, add the excitement of a live show, make it financially accessible and give the proceeds to an organization creating positive change. Brave contestants take turns attempting to spell words on stage, earning a free drink for each successful attempt. Audience members are active participants in the contest; attendees can donate to receive “skip a word” and “sabotage” cards to help or challenge the participants. The spelling bee champ walks away with awesome prizes and everyone involved enjoys the benefits of donating their money (and egos) to a great cause.

R-E-S-U-L-T-S

IT WORKED. In just over a year, we showed that doing good can be fun and easy (spelling 'onomatopoeia' ... not so much). We have raised OVER $25,000  to date and given every penny of the funds raised to amazing nonprofit organizations. 

C-h-a, c-h-i-n-g-!

Help Us Help More

We are ready to scale our model, but we need your support. We have put our hearts, souls, and dollars into making We B-E-E Spelling a success. We're proud to tell you that every cent of your support thus far has gone directly to benefiting the great causes of our nonprofit partners. We want to keep it that way, but business cliches and growing expenses tell us that's a challenging undertaking. We have big, exciting opportunities on the horizon and we're asking for your investment in us to support our fundraising efforts moving forward. 

The proceeds of this "We B-E-E Spelling: For We B-E-E Spelling" event will go toward:

  • Future event production and management expenses such venue rental fees, food & bev., promotion, and guest entertainers, to name a few.
  • Day-to-day operating costs: meetings and marketing and websites, oh my!
  • Eliminating any and all costs to our nonprofit beneficiaries when partnering for an event. We get them involved to make money, not spend it.
  • Developing business partnerships and new revenue streams that promote growth and maximize our impact.
  • We're going to send 30% all funds raised to our friends at Blue Engine, a certified education 501(c)3.
Long story short: we need capital to continue doing what we do so well and grow into our next phase. We didn't graduate Harvard Biz School, but we know that a business needs to make a little money to stay in, uh, business. We've got huge plans and opportunities ahead of us. Even if you can't make it to the event, every bit of support is helpful and greatly appreciated. Your contributions will help us help more.

This time around, we're asking you to support our great cause.
 
Much Love,

Alex and Andrew



                                      

                         Our totally AWESOME We B-E-E Spelling premium t-shirt
story_txt:
Attending the event?  Buy a ticket on the right (Entry Fee) or sign up to spell (Bee Participant).
Feeling generous? Select another perk for bonuses like free drinks and t-shirts!
Can’t make it?  You can still support our cause by selecting any perk or customize your donation using the Contribute Now button.
"If you don't know, now you know..."
We're two guys with a passion for bringing people together and giving back to our community. The idea for We B-E-E Spelling started like so many great ideas do: over a few drinks at a party. "How do you do something meaningful outside of your day job? Why is giving back so damn inconvenient? And do fundraisers always have to be such a bore?" We reached two (obvious) conclusions: 1.) doing good shouldn't be a hassle and 2.) it shouldn't be a drag, either.
Problem, meet silly-ution.
How do you make philanthropy fun and easy? Disguise it as a ridiculous event full of laughter, upbeat music, and spirited competition and transform "good time" money spent into "good cause" served. 

We B-E-E Spelling is an intoxicating spelling bee and fundraising event. We take the nostalgia of a spelling bee, add the excitement of a live show, make it financially accessible and give the proceeds to an organization creating positive change. Brave contestants take turns attempting to spell words on stage, earning
a free drink for each successful attempt. Audience members are active
participants in the contest; attendees can donate to receive “skip a word” and “sabotage” cards to help or challenge the participants. The spelling bee champ walks away with awesome prizes and everyone involved
enjoys the benefits of donating their money (and egos) to a great cause.
  R-E-S-U-L-T-S
IT WORKED. In just over a year, we showed that doing good can be fun and easy (spelling 'onomatopoeia' ... not so much). We have raised OVER $25,000  to date and given every penny of the funds raised to amazing nonprofit organizations.  
C-h-a, c-h-i-n-g-!
Help Us Help More

We are ready to scale our model, but we need your support. We have put our hearts, souls, and dollars into making We B-E-E Spelling a success. We're proud to tell you that every cent of your support thus far has gone directly to benefiting the great causes of our nonprofit partners. We want to keep it that way, but business cliches and growing expenses tell us that's a challenging undertaking. We have big, exciting opportunities on the horizon and we're asking for your investment in us to support our fundraising efforts moving forward. 
The proceeds of this "We B-E-E Spelling: For We B-E-E Spelling" event will go toward:

Future event production and management expenses such venue rental fees, food & bev., promotion, and guest entertainers, to name a few.

Day-to-day operating costs: meetings and marketing and websites, oh my!

Eliminating any and all costs to our nonprofit beneficiaries when partnering for an event. We get them involved to make money, not spend it.
Developing business partnerships and new revenue streams that promote growth and maximize our impact.


We're going to send 30% all funds raised to our friends at Blue Engine, a certified education 501(c)3. 


 Long story short: we need capital to continue doing what we do so well and grow into our next phase. We didn't graduate Harvard Biz School, but we know that a business needs to make a little money to stay in, uh, business. We've got huge plans and opportunities ahead of us. Even if you can't make it to the event, every bit of support is helpful and greatly appreciated. Your contributions will help us help more.This time around, we're asking you to support our great cause. 
Much Love,Alex and Andrew                                                                Our totally AWESOME We B-E-E Spelling premium t-shirt

story:
Welcome to Lucia 

Hi, I'm Laura Lowery, founder and editor of Lucia. 

Thank you for finding your way here. I’m excited to share this project with you.

Lucia is a new kind of magazine. Independent and ad-free. Our mission is to inspire and enlighten the world by giving voice to the heart and celebrating true beauty. 

Why Start Lucia?

This journal was born from my heart’s longing…to be moved, feel inspired, and connect with what is real. 

I often feel inundated with imagery and content in women's magazines that competes to capture my attention in order to sell me stuff. Most are filled with unrealistic advertisements telling me I am not enough. Fashion models without flaws flaunt clothing and makeup I can not fathom wearing. Headlines shout from newsstands telling me "five ways” I can lose weight, tame my frizz, tone my abs and have a cleaner house. 

Meanwhile, I yearn to feel connected to what is real, what is true. Maybe you feel it too? 

  • Lucia is different. You won’t find advertising or airbrushed models in our pages. Instead you will find incredible personal writing and essays, beauty, magnificence and truth – loads of it.
  • Lucia is beautifully designed. Full color, 108 pages, 7.5 x 9.5 inches, and filled with heartfelt essays, photography and art from inspiring women and men. Gorgeous typefaces combined with handwritten script in beautiful inks on thicker, softer, responsibly-milled paper makes reading and turning each page feel so good.
  • Lucia is authentic, heartfelt, and curated to spark creativity. This is a magazine unlike any I’ve ever seen before. 

Why We Need Your Help 

Making an ad-free magazine is expensive. It can be self-sustaining, but not until we reach a certain circulation. Based on the interest and excitement for Lucia (we are already on the shelves at Whole Foods, and soon Barnes & Noble) we feel confident Lucia will grow.

We can't get there without your help. Our Kickstarter campaign this past May had a goal of $60K, an amount that would have enabled us to fund the creation and printing the first three issues of Lucia. We raised more than $20K, but we couldn't accept any of it because we did not meet our goal. This platform (Indiegogo) will enable us to keep whatever is contributed, even if we do not meet the goal we've set. 

Issue Two is written, designed, and ready to print. It is gorgeous. I am hopeful we can raise the funds to print the second issue, and keep Lucia moving forward! In addition to Whole Foods and Barnes & Noble, we are ready to keep growing our subscription base and new subscribers are finding Lucia every day.

  • Lucia represents something the world needs. Some nights I can not go to sleep because I am so busy thinking about all of the women and men out there who might connect with and be inspired by Lucia. How many creative fires might a journal like this encourage and spark? Could even one change the whole world for the better? Gives me goose bumps. 
  • Lucia has a solid business and marketing plan. My background of nearly 20 years in communications and PR, including more than 10 years running my own creative business, has helped immensely with this project. I’ve developed cash flow projections for what it will take to make Lucia profitable and sustainable as quarterly publication. It is a big lift, and will take some time to get there. 
  • Creating and printing a high-quality full-color periodical with no advertisements is expensive. In order to fund the printing of Issue Two we hope to raise at least $20,000. Anything beyond this goal will help us be able to compensate Lucia’s incredible writers, contributors, design and editorial advisors, and contribute to printing costs for Issue Three.


Lucia: On Giving Back

Lucia is not your ordinary magazine. 

We are passionate about community. In fact, we think community is the antidote to the negative effects of all those ads in magazines selling unattainable ideas of perfection—our communities are where we get real; where we feel appreciated for giving voice to our hearts; where we find true beauty; where we support and inspire each other. 

From the very beginning I've envisioned Lucia as a business that gives back. While the rules prohibit us from donating any proceeds of this campaign to charity, the rules do not prohibit us from deciding that we intend to donate a portion of Lucia's FUTURE profits (after funds have been used to successfully create Issue Two). As a hopeful and heart-centered entrepreneur, it is my intention to do so. 

What does that mean? 

As Lucia grows beyond Issue Two, we plan to return 5% percent of our profits to the community each year by donating to inspiring nonprofit organizations that directly support women. 

We are serious about this commitment and though we’ve not yet made a dime of revenue, we are hopeful and have already spoken with New Beginnings, a nonprofit that empowers survivors and mobilizes community awareness and action to end domestic violence. They love our idea, and we are planning to give 5% of our first profitable year's profits to them.

Gifts for Lucia’s Sponsors 

We are excited to share perks with you! As one of Lucia's founding patrons, you will be join a community that is all about making meaningful connection, giving voice to the heart, and celebrating true beauty.

Whether you can afford to contribute $15, $100, $1,000, or more, you’ll receive heartfelt thanks and great perks. 

Check out the photographs & details of our rewards packages below, Lucia has something for everyone. If you don't see a gift you would like at the level you are willing to contribute, please let us know. We are creative and it's likely we can come up with something awesome to reward your generosity and include you in our journey.

I already feel so much gratitude for you, Lucia’s patron, and can not wait to share this magazine with you.

Please Share, Help Us Spread the Word

If Lucia is something you believe in too and you’d like it to become a reality, I’m asking you to tell your friends and family about this campaign. Share the link with your friends. 

Tell them why it’s important, invite them to join you in supporting Lucia’s mission: To inspire and enlighten the world by giving voice to the heart, and celebrating true beauty. 

I hope you will become part of Lucia. I’m excited to connect with you! 

From my heart, thank you. 
xo,
Laura 



$15 : gratitude. You will receive an exclusive digital version of Lucia, Issue Two, and our heartfelt gratitude.



$25 : lucia issue two. You will receive everything in the $15 perk, plus a print copy of Lucia : Issue Two.


$35 : lucia issue one (limited edition). You will receive everything in the $15 perk, plus a limited edition print copy of Lucia's maiden issue (Issue One : Inspiration).

$60 : lucia issues one & two. You will receive everything in the $15 perk, plus one print copy of Lucia Issue One, plus one print copy of Lucia Issue Two.


$100 : handwritten letter from laura. You will receive everything in the $25 and $15 perks, plus a handwritten letter from Laura with heartfelt thanks and inspiration.


$200 : lucia patron. You will receive everything in the $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus your name will appear on Lucia's patron page in Issue Three, both in print and online.

$300 : celebration party @ laura's. You will receive everything in the $200, $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus an invitation to the Issue Two celebration at Lucia's home office in Seattle. We will do our best to schedule this for a date that works for everyone.

$400 : watercolor painting. You will receive everything in the $300, $200, $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus a watercolor handpainted by Laura, and unique to you. Painted from the heart, your watercolor will be between 6x8inches and 7.5x9.5inches on beautiful cotton paper and ready to be framed or tucked into your favorite box of treasures and inspiration.

$500 : skype with karly. You will receive everything in the $400, $300, $200, $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus a Skype video (or telephone) call with Karly Siroky, Lucia's Design Advisor. Karly is a veritable creative branding genius. She has guided multiple small and medium-sized businesses through the creation of a meaningful and impact-making brand. Just check out her website karlysiroky.com for a list of her recent clients, and a look at the magic she creates. Karly will contact you in October to set up a date.


$500 : skype with laura. You will receive everything in the $400, $300, $200, $100, $25, and $15 perks, plus a one-hour video Skype (or telephone) call with Laura Lowery, the editor of Lucia. Great opportunity for aspiring magazine creators, new graduates, writers, photographers or anyone who'd like to glean straight-up insight and advice from Laura about what she's learned. This session can also be given as one-of-a-kind gift. Laura will contact you in Oct 2015 to set up a date to connect!

$750 : coffee with lucia's editor. You will receive everything in the $400, $300, $200, $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus coffee with the editor of Lucia (in Seattle). Nothing beats a face-to-face connection. You will have Laura's full attention for an hour. Ask her anything. Walk away inspired, and with a new personal connection in the creative publishing world.This would also make a unique gift for a graduate or young professional interested in pursuing a career in communications. Does not include travel expenses or lodging.

$1,000 : lucia creative meeting. You will receive everything in the $400, $300, $200, $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus an invitation to attend a two-hour catered creative editorial brainstorm with Lucia's staff in Seattle, the place where it all started. Join Lucia's editor and advisors for a creative conversation over delicious (organic and ethically grown) food and drink, Play a direct in-person role in the development of content and design ideas for a future issue! Does not include travel expenses or lodging.

$2,000 : portrait photography session. You will receive everything in the $1,000, $400, $300, $200, $100, $25 and $15 perks, plus a portrait photography session with Lucia's founder, editor and head photographer - Laura Lowery. Your portrait session will include a pre-shoot phone call to discuss your portrait, setting, mood, location and wardrobe particulars. The session can take place anywhere within 30 mins of downtown Seattle, and includes 30+ high res, edited images. Does not include travel or lodging.

story:
Je passe de nombreux dimanches avec les SDF sur Paris depuis maintenant quelques années, pour leur donner un truc à manger, pour parler un peu avec eux, pour créer un pont entre eux et nous. C'est aussi un moyen pour moi de renvoyer l'ascenseur après un long moment de galère...

Le temps passant, j'ai rencontré Jean Claude et Bébert, deux chics types qui sont malheureusement dehors. Ils sont maintenant des amis et je dîne avec eux toutes les semaines depuis plus de deux ans (si vous êtes ici et que le sujet vous plait, venez dîner avec nous, à Port Royal, à Paris). Ils passent aussi chez moi tous les jours pour déposer leurs affaires, pour éviter de les porter toute la journée et pour se changer - je dois avoir la cave la plus animée de Paris. 

Mon plan est de sortir Jean Claude et Bébert de la rue.  Bébert a déjà un plan pour septembre - octobre, il compte acheter une voiture et dormir dedans le soir ; dans la journée, il espère donner un coup de main pour des déménagements et aller où le travail sera... ça semble bien parti et après plein d'économies sur le RSA, le projet est en très bonne voie :) Jean Claude est encore en forme, pas trop usé par la rue et a envie de sortir de là où il est, de retrouver un travail et reprendre une vie normale. J'ai trouvé une petite pièce dans le 10ème  faubourg St Denis que je compte acheter pour lui.  

Je ne fais pas appel à vous pour me faire un patrimoine immobilier ou une voiture : ce sera celui de Jean-Claude et celle de Bébert !!!

J'ai cassé ma tirelire et sollicité ma banque qui n'est pas très réceptive... Heureusement, les amis sont venus à mon aide et grâce à Alexandra, Lionel, Marie Christine, Nicolas, Laetitia le projet est bien parti. Ce que vous pourriez faire : rejoindre cette belle équipe et aider deux braves types.

Ce que l'on pourra vous offrir : des picnics dans la rue ( nous tous), à dîner dans le 12ème (chez moi) ou dans le 10ème (Jean Claude), des cours de tennis (toujours lui), une balade en moto (moi), un coup de main pour Ikéa (Bébert) et plein d'autres chose

Le budget global est de 40000€ et j'en ai déjà une partie ; je compte sur vous tous pour le reste ;  si je ne devais pas atteindre cet objectif, je tenterai le prêt à la consommation pour atteindre ces 40 000€... Et si ça ne passe pas cette année, je remets ça l'an prochain, je serai très têtu !!!!

Si vous ne pouvez pas participer mais que le plan vous plaît, n'hésitez pas à en parler !!!  J'espère qu'on pourra se retrouver chez Jean Claude pour dîner un soir prochain ou voir Bébert dans sa belle voiture :) 

Merci à tous, Pierre

IMPORTANT : si vous êtes fâchés avec PayPal mais que vous avez envie que ça marche, passez les / nous voir ; c'est sur le côté gauche du grand bâtiment (gymnase + CROUS) qui fait face au jardin du Luxembourg quand on sort du métro à Port Royal.

IMPORTANT 2 : quand vous passez leur rendre visite, présenter vous, dites que vous êtes un ami d'un ami de Pierre ou un truc comme ça, ils ne savent pas qui vous êtes ; vous pourriez être de la BAC ou avoir de mauvaises intentions... Chez vous, vous vous attendez à ce que l'on frappe à la porte, et bien, eux, c'est pareil, ce dehors, c'est leur maison.

Et si ça ne passe pas cette année, je remets ça l'an prochain, je serai très têtu !!!!
Si vous ne pouvez pas participer mais que le plan vous plaît, n'hésitez pas à en parler !!!  J'espère qu'on pourra se retrouver chez Jean Claude pour dîner un soir prochain ou voir Bébert dans sa belle voiture :) 
Merci à tous, PierreIMPORTANT : si vous êtes fâchés avec PayPal mais que vous avez envie que ça marche, passez les / nous voir ; c'est sur le côté gauche du grand bâtiment (gymnase + CROUS) qui fait face au jardin du Luxembourg quand on sort du métro à Port Royal.IMPORTANT 2 : quand vous passez leur rendre visite, présenter vous, dites que vous êtes un ami d'un ami de Pierre ou un truc comme ça, ils ne savent pas qui vous êtes ; vous pourriez être de la BAC ou avoir de mauvaises intentions... Chez vous, vous vous attendez à ce que l'on frappe à la porte, et bien, eux, c'est pareil, ce dehors, c'est leur maison.

story:
Overview

Orison Books is a 501-(c)(3) non-profit literary press focused on the life of the spirit from a broad and inclusive range of perspectives. Orison [“or-ə-sən”] is an archaic word that means “prayer.” We at Orison Books believe that the best spiritual art and literature call us to meditate and contemplate, rather than asking us to adopt any ideology or set of propositions. We seek to publish non-fiction, fiction, and poetry that probe the nature and experience of being, that reach toward the subtler dimensions of perception, that engage the possibility of the divine, or that yearn with words toward the unsayable.

Orison Books will serve as a home for writers and readers of all backgrounds, religious or non-religious. In addition to publishing exceptional spiritually-engaged poetry, fiction, and non-fiction books, we will publish The Orison Anthology—an annual collection of the best spiritual writing in all genres published in periodicals the preceding year. Additionally, Orison Books aims to contribute to the cultural conversations around spirituality and literature by hosting classes, symposia, and other public events. We seek to be broad, inclusive, and open to perspectives spanning the spectrum of spiritual and religious thought, ethnicity, gender identity, and sexual orientation.

We cannot succeed without the contributions of those who support our mission of publishing exceptional literature that engages the life of the spirit, and of fostering cultural conversation around spirituality and literature. Please see below for details about how you can contribute.


What We've Achieved So Far

We released our inaugural title, I Scrape the Window of Nothingness: New & Selected Poems by the Romanian-American poet Stella Vinitchi Radulescu, in March of this year. Radulescu's book has received much praise from readers and critics alike. In its newsletter, Image Journal described Radulescu's words as "so spare and polished they shine"; poet David Dodd Lee calls her work "a triumph of being, a war against banality."

This November, we will release Requiem for Used Ignition Cap by J. Scott Brownlee, selected by C. Dale Young as the winner of the inaugural Orison Poetry Prize. Yusef Komunyakaa says about Brownlee's book, "Requiem for Used Ignition Cap pulses with imagery that grounds and levitates mind and body. [...] Brownlee juxtaposes mind and spirit, and there’s nowhere these poems don’t dare to go.”


We have several exciting titles lined up for the new year, including:

  • The Divine Magnet: Herman Melville's Letters to Nathaniel Hawthorne, edited by scholar Mark Niemeyer, with a foreword by Pulitzer Prize-winning novelist Paul Harding.
  • Constellarium, the debut poetry collection by Jordan Rice, which chronicles the author’s gender transition and engages the ontological quandaries that arise from this experience, reckoning with family history and religious heritage along the way.
  • The Orison Anthology, a new annual collection of the finest spiritually-engaged writing that appeared in periodicals during the previous year.

How You Can Help

Publishing books is a vital, but expensive, endeavor! And Orison Books has a unique and underrepresented focus on work of both exceptional literary quality and exceptional engagement with the transcendent, without representing any particular ideology or spiritual or religious tradition, but rather being open to and interested in a wide array of perspectives and experiences. 

We are volunteer run, and none of our editorial staff is paid. We are entirely a labor of love! 

There are many ways to support us, including purchasing our books through our website, helping spread the word about this fundraising campaign, and of course making a donation here through Indiegogo! Please consult the "Perks" listed on this page for various giving levels, along with various thank-you offerings for your generosity.

As we are a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, all or part of your donation may be be tax deductible. For donations for which the donor receives a perk, we will send you a receipt that indicates the tax deductible portion; for donations for which the donor receives no perk, the entire portion is tax deductible, and we will send you a receipt to this effect.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Luke Hankins, Editor, through the contact form here.

story:
Help Jollity Magazine move from a half-baked idea to a fully baked craft culture magazine

Are you a craft beer enthusiast? Do you have a passion for small batch liquor? Then take a gander at our website and sign up to receive a copy of our premier issue! 
This magazine is small batch, hopped up, and brewed to perfection. Jollity Magazine caters to the whims and fancies of the craft consumer (and that's more than just featuring the best damn craft beer on the planet).
Intelligent and informed, sarcastic and witty, funny and opinionated - no we aren't just talking about your glowing personality. That's Jollity Magazine and we want to share it with you.
Just pick a perk that fits your fancy, and you can get Jollity too! We will even give you a shout out on our social pages!

Support Jollity Magazine today!

story:
Dear Freedom Supporter,

There is a growing attempt to undermine Christian support for Israel. 

This campaign is spear-headed by the far-left Christian "progressive" groups that also promote Israel Apartheid Week.

Their hatred for Israel is so intense that they turn a blind eye to the plight of their fellow Christians who are being mercilessly massacred by crazed Islamists.

This movement is known as “Replacement Theology.”  It preaches that the Jewish people are a cursed nation and that Replacement Theology churches represent the “new Israel.” They proclaim that Jesus was a Palestinian and not a Jew.

JDL Canada plans to counterprotest and expose an upcoming Replacement Theology event in Vancouver, April 23-25, 2015.

To do this, we will fly 12 members of JDL Canada from Toronto to Vancouver. As well, many good people in Vancouver are already committed to joining us there.

We have an obligation to confront our opponents face to face, wherever they may be.

But we need your help to spread the truth.  Specifically, we need your help to cover the cost of flights, hotel rooms, rental cars and meals.

Even the smallest donation will help us represent all of you, who can't be there yourselves.

PS: With every contribution over $50, you'll receive a JDL t-shirt as a token of our gratitude.

Thank you in advance for helping us take our message where it is needed most!

Meir Weinstein 
National Chairman
Jewish Defence League of Canada

story:
Who I am

My name is Taylor Wilkins, and I recently started The Tailored Quill, a privately owned creative startup in Denver, CO, that helps people with any kind of writing, editing, and public speaking. 

The fear of public speaking is still number one in the world, ranked even higher than death, and studies continue to show that where students in all grades demonstrate the most insufficient skill is in writing and grammar.  To address this fear and deficiency, I've built ten categories of services designed to accommodate a wide range of possible projects for clients of all ages, all of which are customizable based on the client's specific creative needs. 

This campaign serves as the first big step toward getting the word out and making the following services available to the public. Services for content creation, outlining, editing, as well as composition and oral practice (when applicable) are available in the following categories:

1. Professional materials: resumes, cover letters, and letters of intent.

2. Business development: website editing, press releases, LinkedIn profiles.

3. Wedding toasts: Best Man, Maid of Honor, Father of the Bride, etc. 

4. Longer speeches: keynote addresses, corporate lectures, school presentations.

5. Academic material: homework papers, thesis projects, magazine articles.

6. Full length pieces: novels, children's books, articles, etc.

7. Composition:  freelance blogging and ghostwriting.

8. Public Speaking: business, personal, etc.

9. Specialized: corporate marketing materials, book tours, speaking engagements.

10. Community: writing and public speaking workshops, small group activities.

I have written fiction since I was eight years old, have helped people all around the world with editing and rehearsing their own writing for the past decade, and have been seeing clients through The Tailored Quill since the start of this year while also working two other jobs.   

Your contribution will help me build The Tailored Quill, about which I am super excited and confident, into a business on which I can focus full time. Whether for yourself or as a gift for a friend, please contribute at the level with which you feel comfortable. Even simply "sharing" the campaign page over social media and spreading the word to someone you know who might be in a wedding this year or has to make a presentation at work will be extremely helpful.

(Featured here is the exclusive, handmade notebook offered in The Supporter Pack perk. Logo featured in gold on front cover)


What I Need

To build this into a full time business, I hope to raise $15,000, which will be used primarily for:

1. Logistical support, such as an actual office space for the company (at the moment, my office is a backpack...),
2. Technological support, such that I can smoothly address all clients' needs remotely as well as connect and consult with clients all over the world,
3. and Business development, which would include marketing materials, advertisement opportunities, and ongoing website development and maintenance.
I've created a detailed list of perks that are offered in a progression that logically follows my service categories but with some fun twists. Spoiler alert: there's something for everyone and each purchased perk can still be tailored to your needs. Any contribution will help because it means I can begin supporting and spreading my passion to more and more people and take the first step towards creating a community around writing and public speaking. 
My Mission

Writing and public speaking are the cornerstones of storytelling, history, and education, but so many people don't know where to put a comma. Nearly 240,000,000 Americans experience anxiety about public speaking (statisticbrain.com), and that doesn't even include writing. Furthermore, businesses lose over 3 billion dollars annually to remedial writing programs for employees (The New York Times).  These are the people who I want to reach, but even if I can't get to every person in the world in need of a service, I hope to at least impart the value of writing and words to as large of a community as possible.

Since the Tailored Quill's inception at the beginning of this year, I have helped people on everything from editing a resume all the way to ghostwriting a portion of a full-length novel.   Following five years of experience in mental health, I am able to recognize the many ways in which people deal with frustration and anxiety, especially when feeling stuck wanting to express something.  I provide peace of mind, perspective, and a well-tailored product so that clients can free themselves from fear or reluctance.

I know how to help, I want to help, and the secret lies in the power of a word, so please spread it to everyone you know and we can start building this community together.  Thank you so much, and I'm excited to work with you!

Testimonials 

"My name is Keri Kosloski and Taylor helped me thoroughly edit and proofread a letter of intent and my resume for my graduate school application.  Taylor’s dedication to supporting me through the process was impressive and greatly appreciated. I couldn’t have produced such a quality product without Taylor’s knowledge, patience, and expertise. He went through everything WITH me rather than doing it on his own, which gave me the opportunity to understand and learn why certain changes were made and why they mattered."


"My name is Wes Patterson and I sought Taylor out to help me make a memorable Best Man toast for my brother’s wedding.  I didn’t know where to start and was putting a lot of pressure on myself to come up with something. I met with Taylor and had a brief but natural conversation about my relationship with my brother, from which Taylor helped choose a theme, which led to an outline for a funny yet heartfelt toast. He helped me practice it numerous times, and the toast was a great success (a lot of laughter and tears).  It would not have been as successful had I not had Taylor with me through the process.  I would recommend his service to all." 


Thank you

Thank you so much in advance for all of your support.  It has been a lot of fun and quite the exciting process developing this business and making my creative passion a reality.  I cannot do this without you, and I'm so grateful that you are willing to join me on the path to building a global creative community. 

Sincerely,

Taylor Wilkins 


Please share this campaign on Email, Facebook, and Twitter. Thank you again!

Thank you so much in advance for all of your support.  It has been a lot of fun and quite the exciting process developing this business and making my creative passion a reality.  I cannot do this without you, and I'm so grateful that you are willing to join me on the path to building a global creative community. 
Sincerely,
Taylor Wilkins 


Please share this campaign on Email, Facebook, and Twitter. Thank you again!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Rachel Miller, author of Winter's Prey, the first book in the Barren Fields, Fruitful Gardens series.

I don't know about you, but one of my favorite childhood memories is of story times when a parent or teacher picked up a book and began reading, bringing a whole new world to life. This same beauty is found in the world of audiobooks.

Winter's Prey is an amazing story of the struggles and conflicts of life in the Montana Territory and one family's journey of faith and survival. While the story is fiction, many readers of this book and its sequel have written, expressing the healing, hope, and encouragement found in its pages. Thus, the purpose of this project is to bring this story and its message to life.

Converting Winter's Prey to audio is a longtime dream. Now, due to the generosity of one man who has offered his experience and knowledge as guides through the process, it is becoming a reality.

I believe converting this book to audio will impact and even change lives. This campaign gives us the opportunity to work together to be a part of making that change possible.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 to properly carry out this project. The funds from this campaign will make it possible to hire a professional voice actor to narrate the book as well as covering additional fees, taxes, and expenses associated with the process. The narrator will be hired through Audible's ACX platform, which will then allow for distribution of the audiobook through Audible, Amazon, and iTunes.

We've come up with some great perks for those who back this project, including copies of the audiobook, the paperback version and its sequel, even lavender from my own garden. We're also creating a special event  for anyone who not only backs the project, but who gets someone to match their pledge. This event will be an invitation only, pre-launch, book preview event for the upcoming Book #3! At this event, you'll be among the first to see the book trailer, receive early electronic files, and we may even have a short reading!

If we don't reach our goal, (which we really hope doesn't happen) the funds will still go toward making this project a reality...it will just take us longer to get there.

If we surpass our goal, the additional funds will go into marketing the audiobook, and potentially even toward converting the second book Field of Ashes to audio as well! (Wouldn't that be awesome!!)

The Impact

Winter's Prey is a fiction story that intersects with real life on many levels. I have received multiple emails from readers saying, "Rachel, this story is exactly where I am." They then go on to share how the book has encouraged them to walk in contentment, take a better approach in a certain relationship, or offered comfort in the face of grief or struggles. One reader said that the BFFG books are full of hope-giving truth.

Imagine the impact this would have on a whole new group of listeners, who might never have the time, opportunity, or ability to sit down and read it!

Risks & Challenges

The hardest part—the writing and publishing—is already done. In the past, one of the biggest challenges I faced when considering converting the book to audio was knowing who to hire for the narration and how to go about it. Audible's ACX platform eliminates much of the struggle in this area. I am confident we will find the right match for the story.

Now, the biggest foreseeable challenge is the one for which this campaign was designed—covering the production cost. We estimate the book to be between 10-12 hours once completed. Including associated fees, taxes, and expenses, the total cost will be around $3,000. This is our second attempt. Our first attempt went really well, we just ran out of time before we reached the goal. I believe since we already have a few people on board, we'll get off to a great start and an even better finish!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you aren't able to back the project financially at this time, that's okay! You can still help! One of the biggest challenges is getting the word out. Trying to do it all by myself would be almost impossible. Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools. I will be posting regularly to Facebook as well, and you are more than welcome to share any of those posts.

Another great idea is to share the trailer for the book or even the video for this project and tell why you're sharing it and why this project is important to you. When people know you're interested in it for a reason, they're more likely to check it out. (Always include a link back to this page.) Here is a link to the project video: https://youtu.be/4bYqCtONyvM and here is a link to the book trailer: https://youtu.be/kHoIw8CSAt0 Thank you so much for your help!

Winter's Prey is a fiction story that intersects with real life on many levels. I have received multiple emails from readers saying, "Rachel, this story is exactly where I am." They then go on to share how the book has encouraged them to walk in contentment, take a better approach in a certain relationship, or offered comfort in the face of grief or struggles. One reader said that the BFFG books are full of hope-giving truth.
Imagine the impact this would have on a whole new group of listeners, who might never have the time, opportunity, or ability to sit down and read it!

Risks & Challenges
The hardest part—the writing and publishing—is already done. In the past, one of the biggest challenges I faced when considering converting the book to audio was knowing who to hire for the narration and how to go about it. Audible's ACX platform eliminates much of the struggle in this area. I am confident we will find the right match for the story.
Now, the biggest foreseeable challenge is the one for which this campaign was designed—covering the production cost. We estimate the book to be between 10-12 hours once completed. Including associated fees, taxes, and expenses, the total cost will be around $3,000. This is our second attempt. Our first attempt went really well, we just ran out of time before we reached the goal. I believe since we already have a few people on board, we'll get off to a great start and an even better finish!

Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you aren't able to back the project financially at this time, that's okay! You can still help! One of the biggest challenges is getting the word out. Trying to do it all by myself would be almost impossible. Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools. I will be posting regularly to Facebook as well, and you are more than welcome to share any of those posts.
Another great idea is to share the trailer for the book or even the video for this project and tell why you're sharing it and why this project is important to you. When people know you're interested in it for a reason, they're more likely to check it out. (Always include a link back to this page.) Here is a link to the project video: https://youtu.be/4bYqCtONyvM and here is a link to the book trailer: https://youtu.be/kHoIw8CSAt0 Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Will you LEAD the change?

Unleashing the potential of all people – regardless of their gender, background or skin colour – offers huge benefits for the economy, for our health and wellbeing, and for wider society.

We know that you recognise this. We know that you are already making great strides to create a diverse and equal workforce. We know that you have got a great story to tell. 

Diversity is an issue whose time has come.

Many organisations recognise the immense value that diversity offers and are taking significant steps in the right direction. But others are lagging behind. 

LEAD: Leadership for Equality and Diversity will provide leaders with the insight, information and resources they need to create workforces that are truly representative and that allow everyone to shine. 

Investing in LEAD today will enable you to accelerate progress further and faster, and will enable us to secure the future of the magazine and the website for many months to come. 

What We Need & What You Get

LEAD: Leadership for Equality and Diversity comprises:

* A quarterly LEAD magazine with in-depth features, analysis, interviews and success stories

* A website that is updated daily with news, views and special online-only content

* E-bulletins, special reports and research

* Networking events, including roundtables, receptions and workshops

We have already secured £14,000 and have a further £10,000 in the pipeline - and that is before we have even launched!

But we want to provide an enhanced website, create a superb programme of learning and networking events, and commission some unique research to share with the world. To do this, we need a further £25,000. It is this gap we would like you to help us fill. 

Your Impact

By investing in LEAD magazine, you will help organisations of all shapes and sizes access the tools, insight and inspiration they need to create diverse and inclusive workforces. In turn, this will mean more women and people from under-represented groups have the opportunity to achieve their potential.

The economy will benefit. Society will benefit. You will benefit. 

Risks & Challenges

Achieving our goal will be no mean feat. But we think we are up for the job.

Sheenagh Baxter Martin is a successful publisher who has launched magazines, websites and events in three countries. She has organised events in Buckingham Palace and Parliament, launched and relaunched publications and provided senior leaders across politics, the public sector and business with up-to-date information to support their activities. 

Becky Slack is an experienced editor and journalist with expertise in business, charity, diversity and leadership. She has written and edited for the Guardian, New Statesman, Independent, Evening Standard and several trade magazines. She is a published author (Effective Media Relations for Charities) and the founding director of a successful PR and comms agency, Slack Communications. 

We have both experienced and witnessed our own fair share of discrimination in the workplace. We understand the impact of missed opportunity and lack of awareness. We are passionate about using our combined 50 years' experience in publishing and journalism to bring about the change we want to see. 

Together, we are confident that we have the skills and expertise to make LEAD magazine a success. We are fully committed to this project and have already invested more than 500 hours of own time - without pay. 

But to make it a real success, we need your help! 

Ways You Can Help

  • Invest in our project
  • Tell all your friends, your boss, your parents…
  • Share our information across your social networks

Thank you for taking the time to read our story, and thank you for any support you can offer. It is very much appreciated. 

With love, Sheenagh and Becky

story:
Halsey News Network

The term “fake news” is bandied about all the time, but what, exactly, is fake news? Fake news happens when any entity or individual's opinion decides to inject itself into the facts of a story. And on every network, on every radio station, on nearly every website, this is all we see. Undeclared bias masked as objective reporting. Anonymous sources that are not checked so long as they fit a narrative. Easily put: Fake news.

The solution to Fake news is a return to a media which truly is independent, able to accomplish ethical investigation and declaring any biases up front for the reader to judge. Commentary derived from news labeled as such, so that the battle of ideas is not fought between real and fake but right and wrong.

Halsey Media has been growing rapidly since its inception in early 2017. From a premiere news site, which started its first month with 13,000 unique visitors, Halsey Media now has 3 launched sites, 3 YouTube channels, 4 podcasts, 4 additional sites and broadcasts slated for summer 2017, and a fully functioning internet radio station with multiple shows. We also have 7 affiliated sites which we share content with, but do not exert any type of creative control. All told, sites in the Halsey News Network are visited by more than 2 million people a month and we are experiencing exponential growth. The only question is, what we can do with this growth?

We currently have 7 sites owned by Halsey Media, some of them already launched, some launching soon.

They are: 

Halsey News (halseynews.com): Our flagship site, which features hard hitting commentary from an array of political perspectives. Halsey News breaks the barrier in terms of uncensored, fact based investigative journalism. You will find topics such as elections, international affairs, culture, media and government along with many others. The site is currently live and is visited by more than 300,000 people monthly. The site is backed up with a YouTube station and podcast by Halsey Media President, Halsey English, called Halsey Live. 

Right Millennial (rightmillennial.com): The home of Halsey Media co-owner Stefanie MacWilliams. After experiencing the devastating effects of Fake News first hand, Stefanie did the opposite of what most would do, she took to the airwaves. Blamed by the Washington Post and Toronto Star for creating the vast Pizzagate Conspiracy, Stefanie received death threats and almost left the business. Instead she fought back, and is one of the most highly read and trafficked site for Right Leaning Millennials on the planet. Monthly traffic of over 150,000 visitors a month and backed up by her own YouTube channel and show called Right Millennial. 

Counter Campus (CounterCampus.com): Spearheaded for launch in August of 2017, Counter Campus aims to report on the socialist takeover of our educational system and what can be done about it. Headed by celebrated author, Tiana Dalichov, Counter Campus will go where no one dares go to question education and its effects on the country. Podcast and YouTube station to follow shortly after launch. 

D.I.R.E. Online (direonline.com): Headed by Halsey News contributor Brian Hendrix, D.I.R.E. stands for Documenting Islamic Radicalism Everywhere. The site will be launching in late July 2017, and will feature not only commentary about the rise of radical Islam throughout the world, but will feature a safe repository for users to upload video, audio and testimony about Islam without fear of governmental censorship, as exists in other countries. D.I.R.E. will make sure the videos and audio of Islamic radicalism do not get lost and are readily available for those who wish to use them to educate others about the danger of open borders and Islamic Radicalism. 

Troll The U.N. (trolltheUN.com): The United Nations is the centerpiece of international law in the world, but very few know about its inner workings. Iran and Saudi Arabia being elected to women's rights bodies, the massive focus on Israel’s perceived evils, and the whitewashing of Islamic Radicalism are just a few topics to be addressed on this hard hitting site, commanded by Halsey News Investigative Manager, Justin Farrell. Troll The U.N. is set for launch in August 2017. 

Media Indictment (mediaindictment.com): Headed by F1 engineer and African American activist Marc Comvalius, Media Indictment is a hub for stories about Fake News and its effects on our society. Set for launch in late July, 2017, Media Indictment will serve as a true fifth column and will allow for honest reporting about the media and what they are doing to shape the narrative in the world. 

True Stories (truestoriesonline.com): The brain child of Halsey News contributor, Jamie LaGrow, True Stores will launch in August, 2017 to cover the medical field from a scientific and natural point of view. Nutrition and other topics will also be discussed by our experts. 

Philosophically, Halsey News Network is based on the principle that empowering independent writers and broadcasters to become career journalists requires a vast array of knowledge and experts on-staff to guide those, both new and old, from hobby to career. Halsey News Network employs 18 professional writers, 6 broadcasters, 4 programmers, 2 SEO experts and 3 website designers. Additionally we have audio/video consultants on retainer. This is the point of our fundraiser and our vision.

We need you to contribute to our growth

We are wholly independent, funded solely by owner contributions. We have been offered investment capital by multiple sources, but it was inevitably offered with strings attached. Ceding of editorial control, adding sections for sports and Hollywood gossip, or just plain censoring our most popular writers, were not pills we could swallow. Instead, we are asking the public to join us in our quest to raise $500,000 to grow our own network while offering various ways for others to get involved.

We are here to make waves, to shift paradigms, and to challenge narratives - not just to make money. We are a group of free-thinking individuals with one thing in common: every one of us has put our blood, sweat and tears into independent media. We are passionate. We believe, wholeheartedly, in what we are doing.

When you support our cause, you are providing the resources we need to take our passion to the next level and to empower others.

We don't work for corporations and big-money investors.

We don't work for special interests.

We don't work for a political party.

We work for you.

We want to do a whole lot more.

It is time to empower us to grow even further. We have already amassed an unprecedented reach and audience, and we have so much more to do. We have built studios, purchased equipment, designed sites, brought on partners and have grown well beyond our hopes. Now we wish to bring this to the next level with your help.

Your contribution to this campaign will be put to use in several ways by the Halsey News Network:

Content. First and foremost, these financial resources will allow us to always be able to put as much focus as possible on our bread and butter. We have been honored with thousands of loyal readers, watchers, and listeners. Our number one priority is delivering as much high-quality content as possible. We want to keep hiring more contributors to write, broadcast and edit so that we can launch them into new ventures where their expertise can be utilized. We foster growth in all of our contributors, and we plan on using a decent portion of the funds raised to meet those goals.

Equipment. While we have what we need in terms of equipment for our established entities, our new sites and affiliates need more equipment. Whenever we launch a new initiative, microphones, cameras, computers, editing software and other equipment needs to be bought.

Upkeep. Web hosting, web design, tech support, and graphic design are just a few of our ongoing costs – costs that will only continue to grow as we expand our network to include more sites, shows, and radio programs. Professional, high-quality site design and branding is something we have prioritized from the beginning, and we never want to have to settle for an inferior--or worse, non-functional--design to cut costs.

Staffing. We all, to a man, consider independent media to be a passion. We couldn’t quit even if we wanted to – our hearts are in it! While we have worked with minimal resources since our launch, the proverbial “labor of love” approach is not a sustainable business model. Eventually, we and our staff need to make enough money not only to be able to reinvest into our company, but to also take care of our own financial needs. For a few of us, that means taking a 6 month salary so that we can focus all of our working energy on Halsey Media. For others, that means writers and broadcasters getting paid a fair amount for their services.

Time. The crux of our challenge is this: for us reach the level where we can truly classify ourselves as an alternative to mainstream media outlets, we need time to build. We have seen so much success since we began – we can only imagine the level of growth we will be able to achieve with more time and more resources. No company can “survive” forever. We need the time to become independently profitable, at the level we need to thrive as a business. That’s where this campaign comes in.

These same needs are shared, in different ways, by our affiliates.

How our affiliates work and what makes this campaign different

About half of our sites are Halsey Media-owned: Troll The UN, DIRE Online, Media Indictment, Counter Campus, Right Millennial, True Story, and of course our flagship site, Halsey News. These sites are owned and operated by us. Some are fully launched as of this campaign, some are still being designed, and a few are awaiting a bit more content before they are released to the public.

The other half is comprised of our affiliate-owned sites: Deplorable Radio, New Media Central, The Resistance Podcast, Preuss Media, Remso Republic, and Gold Goats N Guns.

Though the owners of these sites are friends with us and often work closely with us (some even write for Halsey News), these sites are not owned by us, nor are they operated by us at Halsey Media.

This is important

Whatever we raise in the course of this campaign will be split 50/50. Half will go to Halsey Media, and the other half will be split among our six affiliates.

We did not charge anyone a penny to join us in this campaign and, more importantly, we did not ask for a single bit of equity or any decision-making stake in any of our affiliate companies.

Even if this campaign raised ten million dollars, half would go to our affiliates. Period.

We did this for one reason.

We do not simply want to grow Halsey Media. We want to give the public more choices, more opinions, and more access to truly independent media outlets.

We have no interest in becoming a mass corporate media outlet ourselves, or a place where we rule the content of our own publications with an iron fist. We want to fund media freedom, and that starts with our talented affiliate partners.

The only control we have over our affiliates is quality control – we picked people who were committed, talented, and hardworking. People and companies that we deeply believe in and proudly read, watch, and listen to ourselves. We had everyone submit a budget with the understanding that no one was to spend more than 10% of their funding take on their own salary.

This is a movement

This campaign is about more than Halsey Media.

This campaign is about more than our affiliates.

This campaign is about sending a message to the gatekeepers of the mainstream media: We are not afraid of you. We don’t want you. And we definitely don’t need you.

Yes - every contribution to this campaign, from one dollar to a thousand dollars, will go toward funding the Halsey News Network as a group. Even more than that, though, every contribution will show the mainstream media, the alternative media, and the general public just how much power that We The People can have when they band together for something in which they believe.

Again: we need you

Passion has gotten us this far – and perhaps a touch of faith, too.

Our readers, watchers, and listeners have put in us their faith. They have taken the time out of their lives to engage with us and our content. We consider that to be a great gift, and to give them content that is worthy of their attention is, for us, a big responsibility. Whether you are a long-time follower of our content or of our affiliates' content, or even if this is your first time here, thank you for reading this far and thank you for giving us your precious time.

Writing a pitch is never easy. You have given us so much. And yet, we must ask you for one more thing. Money.

We are asking for your hard-earned dollars, dollars that could go toward a dozen other things at any given moment. It’s not a small thing in principle – we know this. However, there is a beauty to crowdfunding.

How much you give is not the biggest factor.

Our goal is $500,000 dollars.

A lot of money.

500 people could give us 1,000 dollars.

5,000 people could give us 100 dollars.

50,000 people could give us 10 dollars.

And, of course, 500,000 people could give us 1 dollar.

Truth is, it will be a mixture of these numbers, and numbers in between. Whether you can afford to top the list, or you fall closer to the bottom in what you can give, we appreciate every last one of you.

If you’re here, we like to hope that you believe in the importance of alternative media.

Now is your time to be part of something bigger.

Take action.

Media belongs to all of us. It’s time to take it all back.

We don’t want you. And we definitely don’t need you.Yes - every contribution to this campaign, from one dollar to a thousand dollars, will go toward funding the Halsey News Network as a group. Even more than that, though, every contribution will show the mainstream media, the alternative media, and the general public just how much power that We The People can have when they band together for something in which they believe.Again: we need youPassion has gotten us this far – and perhaps a touch of faith, too.Our readers, watchers, and listeners have put in us their faith. They have taken the time out of their lives to engage with us and our content. We consider that to be a great gift, and to give them content that is worthy of their attention is, for us, a big responsibility. Whether you are a long-time follower of our content or of our affiliates' content, or even if this is your first time here, thank you for reading this far and thank you for giving us your precious time.Writing a pitch is never easy. You have given us so much. And yet, we must ask you for one more thing. Money.We are asking for your hard-earned dollars, dollars that could go toward a dozen other things at any given moment. It’s not a small thing in principle – we know this. However, there is a beauty to crowdfunding.How much you give is not the biggest factor.Our goal is $500,000 dollars.A lot of money.500 people could give us 1,000 dollars.5,000 people could give us 100 dollars.50,000 people could give us 10 dollars.And, of course, 500,000 people could give us 1 dollar.Truth is, it will be a mixture of these numbers, and numbers in between. Whether you can afford to top the list, or you fall closer to the bottom in what you can give, we appreciate every last one of you.If you’re here, we like to hope that you believe in the importance of alternative media.Now is your time to be part of something bigger.Take action.Media belongs to all of us. It’s time to take it all back.

story:
Hola, mi nombre es Miguel Angel Pulido y soy un amante de las pruebas deportivas de resistencia. En la actualidad estoy disfrutando mucho de un deporte que descubri hace seis años, EL TRIATLÓN,disfruto de él, en muchas de sus variantes, como pueden ser por ejemplo, el duatlón de carretera, el duatlón cross, el triatlón de carretera y como no, el TRIATLÓN CROSS, que es en particular la modalidad a la que pertenece el XTERRA.

 El motivo por el cual abro esta campaña es porque me dan la opción de ir al Cto del mundo de esta modalidad, que se celebrara el 1de noviembre en MAUI (HAWAII),para mi sería increible poder asistir a ese campeonato, ya que creo que me encuentro en un buen estado de forma y  podría obtener un resultado muy razonable...este año ya fuí subcampeon de Europa de mi grupo de edad en la modalidad de duatlon en distancia corta (10km correr/40km bici /5km correr).(ITU)

 Para poder afrontar este campeonato necesitaría unos 3500euros que corresponderían a los siguientes gastos: 500eur inscripción,1500 vuelos,1000euros hotel,500 euros seguros, alimentación,desplazamientos...

Sería increible poder completar una vida deportiva con esta participación ya que mis participaciones internacionales se reducen a una maratón de Nueva York en el año 2009 siendo el 81º  de unos 42000 participantes(2h33) y este año el Campeonato de Europa de Duatlón que se celebró en Madrid.

 otros datos y marcas deportivas:

  Maratón 2h21 San Sebastian, media maraton 1h07, 5000ml 14'40", 3000ml 8'36" ...

Para cualquier aclaración no dudes en contactarme a través de miguelangel.pulido@uclm.es

muchas gracias por tu ayuda y recuerda  que gracias a tu aportación lo conseguiremos, ¡¡¡un abrazo!!!

...............................................................................................................................................

 

Hi, my name is Miguel Angel Pulido and I'm passionate about endurance sports competitions. Nowadays I enjoy practicing a sport which I found out about 6 years ago, TRIATHLON, I enjoy it in many of its different versions, such as: road and off-road duathlon, road triathlon and most certainly, OFF-ROAD TRIATHLON, which is particularly the version XTERRA belongs to.
 The reason why I launch this campaign is because I've been given the option to take part in the off-road World Championship, which will be celebrated on the 1st of November in MAUI (HAWAII).
  Attending this championship will be incredible for me as I believe I'm in a good condition and I could get a very reasonable result...so far this year I've come 2nd in my age group in the European short distance duathlon Championship (10k running/40k cycling/5k running).(ITU)
 To be able to face this championship I'd need around 3500 which will correspond to the next expenses: 500€ for the inscription, 1500€ for the flights, 1000 € for the hotel, 500€ for insurance, food, travels... It would be amazing to complete my sport career with this participation since the international events I've taken part in are limited to a New York marathon in 2009 finishing 81st out of 42000 competitors (2h33) and the European Duathlon Championship in Madrid this year.

Other facts: San Sebastián Marathon: 2h21 Half marathon: 1h07' 5k: 14'40" 3k: 8'36" Thank you very much for your help and remember that we'll make it thanks to your support! Kind regards and a hug!!!!

story:
The Age Bible

 

                My name is Lucas Luna, but everyone calls me Acero (The spanish translation for Steel). With my friend Ignacio Citta (AKA Riverplation) we we came up with the idea of writing the most complete book about the most wonderful RTS, the best of history in my opinion, the Age of Empires 2, and their respective expansions.

            We made this to get the necessary founds to edit the book in physical format, wich is,in my way to see the world, the best way to enjoy a book. We plan on editting the Bible in Spanish, English, portuguese for now. German/ French may be an option for the future.

                Some time after publishing the book (the paper format of course), we will put the digital format at the hand of the whole comunity. So everyone can access to the "Bible" and it's information. To improve their playing skills and enjoy a great book.

       We need your help & will have your proper reward

  • We need 2.200 U$D (something like 34.000 AR$, my country, and the place where the printing will take place). this money will be used to afford the cost of edition. printing and if  possible, the distribution of the final product. (Remember that Shipping is not included on donations)

  • As said before, the book will be edited in Spanish, English, Portuguese for sure. German and French may happen if enough interest is shown as well.

  • If we do not reach the sum of $ 2,200, we will opt for a humbler edition, but the content of the book will not be inferior.

  • Each level of contribution will have its due reward, the idea is that no one feels that he is throwing his money, but is investing in a quality product.

 

      The Reach of your help

  • If you have tried to play Age online you will have noticed that it is not at all complicated to leave the level of the beginners, the so-called "Ultranoobs". The problem comes when you try to take the next step.

  • The main objective of our project is that whoever has read the book is a better player (however slight the improvement may be) than before reading it.

  • Competition is not everything in life, but that does not mean that we have to play as rookies forever, knowledge does not take place and be sure that this book will be full of it.

  • In case you are among the most complete players and having the book does not mean a major change in your game, remember that you are helping many other players to improve. Be in solidarity with them! Also, we guarantee that you will have fun reading and surely will learn a thing or two.

       I'm short on money, how can I help?

  • We know that this game crosses all social classes, so we also know that the economic situation of some does not allow them to access even the minimum donation of 2 U$D.

  • This does not have to leave you out of the project, spread our mission, tell your friends or people who enjoy the game.

  • So we can all have our book, either in PDF, or in physical format.

 

REMEMBER!

This will be a book made BY AND FOR Age players.

We do not seek to become rich

On the contrary, we want to enrich the community of Age of Empires 2, which almost 20 years after its official release is still alive, AND LONGER THAN EVER.

 

GREETINGS AND THANKS FOR COLLABORATING

 

 

La Biblia del Age

                Mi nombre es Lucas Luna, pero todos me dicen Acero o, como mi círculo íntimo, Sagaz. Junto con mi amigo Ignacio Citta (AKA River) nos propusimos escribir el libro más completo sobre el juego RTS mas famoso, y en nuestra opinión, el mejor de la historia, el Age of Empires 2 y sus respectivas expansiones.

                Hacemos este proyecto para conseguir los fondos necesarios para poder editar el libro en formato físico el cual es, a mi entender, la mejor forma de disfrutar un libro.

                Un tiempo después de editado el libro en formato físico se pondrá el libro en formato digital al acceso de toda la comunidad, de manera tal que todos puedan acceder a la “Biblia”  y a la información que habrá dentro de ella, con el fin de mejorar su juego y disfrutar de un buen libro.

 

Necesitamos tu ayuda y te la recompensaremos

  • Necesitamos 2.200 Dólares (unos 34.000 pesos argentinos, lugar donde se editara el libro). Este dinero se utilizara para afrontar los costos de edición, impresión y de ser posible distribución del producto final.
  • El libro será editado en idioma español, inglés, portugués y tal vez en alemán (Si es que conseguimos un traductor)
  • Si no llegamos a juntar los 2.200 dólares optaremos por una edición más humilde aunque no por eso el contenido del libro será de inferior calidad.
  • Cada nivel de contribución tendrá su debida recompensa, la idea que tenemos es que nadie sienta que esta tirando su dinero, sino que lo está invirtiendo en un producto de calidad.

 

El alcance de tu ayuda

  • Si has intentado jugar al Age online habrás notado que no es nada complicado salir del nivel de los principiantes, los llamados “Ultranoobs” en el lunfardo del Age. El problema viene cuando intentas dar el siguiente paso.
  • El principal objetivo de nuestro proyecto es que quien haya leído el libro sea mejor jugador (por mas leve que resulte la mejora), que antes de haberlo leído.
  • La competencia no lo es todo en la vida, pero eso no significa que tengamos que jugar como novatos para siempre, el conocimiento no ocupa lugar y ten por seguro que este libro estará lleno de él.
  • En caso que te encuentres entre los jugadores mas completos y tener el libro no te signifique un cambio importante en tu juego, recuerda que estas contribuyendo a que muchos otros jugadores mejoren. ¡Se solidario con ellos!

Estoy corto de dinero, como puedo ayudar?

  • Sabemos que este juego atraviesa a todas las clases sociales, por lo que también sabemos que la situación económica de algunos no les permite acceder ni a la donación mínima de 2 U$D.
  • Esto no tiene que dejarte fuera del proyecto, difunde nuestra misión, cuentale a tus amigos o a las personas que disfruten el juego.
  • Así entre todos podremos tener nuestro libro, ya sea en PDF, o en formato físico.

 

¡RECUERDA!

 

Este será un libro hecho POR Y PARA los jugadores de Age.

No buscamos hacernos ricos

Por el contrario, queremos enriquecer a la comunidad de Age of Empires 2, la cual casi 20 años después de su lanzamiento oficial sigue viva, Y MAS VIVA QUE NUNCA.

SALUDOS Y GRACIAS POR COLABORAR

story:
Born in a communist Romania, I witnessed the fall of communism and a subsequent era of powerful changes. However, despite my hopes and ideals, I ended up by choosing to leave the country behind, at a certain age when I thought I could no longer bear to live in a what we used to call ~the corrupt system~, in a troubled democracy.

The Romanian protests in January-February 2017 taught me a lesson I was not aware of: those who remained ~home~ are powerful protesters. The anti-graft peaceful demonstrators rallied in dozens of Romanians cities and towns, and, at the date I am writing this down, they are still there, in the cold, determined.

Known for good humor, especially in hard times, Romanians "armed" themselves with thousands of self-made protest signs, each one more clever than the other.

A collective creation, sharp and coherent, which could be a model for other protests around the world, especially nowadays, with such a surprisingly degrading political scene, both in the western democracies as well as in the countries under authoritarian regimes.

 

Enjoying reading these protest signs for myself, I found that many protests nowadays are more and more inclined to use creative signs and slogans, using language and notions in a typically humorous manner, aiming to sharply point a proper understanding of the facts affecting our lives.

Translating these protest signs and slogans, the writings on the walls and the likes, making them available in a multilingual book to a wider audience and other cultures, is, for me, challenging and motivating in itself.

Spreading their meaning to other cultures makes a reader also more culturally sensitive.

Last but not least, these protest signs show us the power of collective action and makes us feel better, encouraging us to act for change or to #resist.

 

A multilingual anthology of the signs, worldwide

I strongly believe that an anthology book showing the most interesting protest signs worldwide and their meaning, made available for more languages and cultures helps us to #resist against corrupt and authoritarian regimes, where ever we are in the larger world. 

 

Dissemination of the book

All the additional books published with the campaign earnings will be distributed for sale and also offered as individual gifts, to the:

- Independent bookstores, worldwide,

- Photographer and Authors of the protest signs, whereby identified

- Those who supported the protests and the protesters, in all protest countries covered in the book, whereby identified

- The protesters themselves, whereby identified

 

Multilingual edition

Multilingual edition: Romanian, English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Bulgarian, Polish, Russian, Arabic, Hindi, among many others, with annotations offering a comment, an explanation, or a summary attached to the protest text.

 

Project backers will have the opportunity to enjoy the book and/or other related perks, shipped to any country of the world.      

*I am trying to keep the shipping prices as low as possible.

I am sure each present and future protester would be inspired by this book. 

 

Where the money goes?

Any revenue from the campaign would be invested in the production of the campaign rewards and more and more additional books for their distribution in countries of covered protests, worldwide. The costs involved cover:

- Editing costs

- Translation costs

- Authors fees (e.g. )

- Publishing costs

- Shipping costs

 

 

Many thanks for support, shares and likes! If you think you cannot contribute financially, I would be happy if you could spread the word.

#resist

 

Donate with Paypal.

 

 

About me

I am passionate about language, a writer, poet and translator. Starting 2017, I am operating my own Publishing House: "Mal débarquement”, Berlin, focused on language learning, poetry and art. I am investigative and curious. I think about myself as being progressive, and definitely against authoritarian and abusive politics.

Always questioning life and its meaning, to make space for a wider understanding. For me, writing and learning are a life-changing experience.

 

 

 

Campaign collaborators (artists)

Choose the biggest perk and one of the artists below, you would like to create your artwork. The list is growing... check for later updates.

 

Alex Bodea, drawing reportage

www.alexbodea.work ; https://www.instagram.com/alex_bodea_urban_eye/  

Perk offered: a visual note.
