story:
Short Summary

Mental illness affects people of all backgrounds yet many people of color go untreated. According to the Office of Minority Health, African Americans are 20% more likely to report having serious psychological distress than Non-Hispanic Whites. High school aged Hispanic girls are 70% more likely to attempt suicide than White girls of the same age. According to the American Psychological Association,"Barriers such as language, culture and little access to care keep many Asian Americans from receiving help for mental illness".

The Color of Hope: People of Color Mental Health Narratives is a project that sheds light on mental illness in communities of color by compiling and publishing a book of stories from those affected by mental illness.  By publishing these stories, we open up discussion around the topic and break through stigma and shame.

We have received over 20 interviews, narratives, and poems from children, adults, parents, men, women, artists, activists, students, politicians, and prisoners...all of whom are of African, Asian, and Latino descent. All of our contributors live with or have been affected by a loved one with major depression, borderline personality disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder, bipolar disorder, and/or schizophrenia.

Meet the Curators:

Iresha Picot, M.Ed, BSL is a Licensed Behavior Specialist, and has a Master’s Degree in Urban Education Policy and Post-Graduate work in Women Studies from Temple University. In addition to a Master’s Degree, she has Post-Graduate certifications in Applied Behavior Analysis and Autism. Currently, Iresha works in the Behavior and Mental Health fields as a Licensed Behavior Specialist and Therapist and is currently a Lead Clinician in a School Therapeutic Treatment program. Iresha is also a Birth Doula and a Prison Abolitionist.

Vanessa Hazzard, LMT is an internationally trained Licensed Massage Therapist, writer, and healing arts educator from Philadelphia, PA. She has had her poetry and narratives featured in Elephant Journal, For Harriet, Recovering Yogi, and Apiary Magazine’s The Hive. She is currently earning her Bachelors in Applied Science from Siena Heights University and is a certified yoga instructor. Vanessa has combined her background in yoga, massage, and herbalism with social justice movements to raise funds to build an orphanage in Jacmel, Haiti as well as to aid victim/survivors of human trafficking . Living with bipolar disorder, Vanessa aims to educate wellness professionals on the connections between chronic pain and mental illness by developing online continuing education courses in depression and PTSD. 

By funding this project, you give a voice to those enduring the struggles of living with mental illness.Help bring our vision to life!

What We Need & What You Get

To be able to share this book with larger audience,our fundraising goal is $5000. This money will go towards printing, editing, formatting, copyrighting, graphic design, website maintenance and social media management, postage, promotions (including a book release engagement TBD), distribution, and other costs associated with the project. 

Proceeds from the book sales will go towards mental health advocacy projects, programs, and/or organizations and will rotate on a quarterly basis. Iresha and Vanessa are also developing a program for trauma survivors which includes teaching a variety of coping skills (i.e. meditation, yoga, bodywork, and writing) in small group settings. A portion of the funds from this book will be used to offer scholarships for this program to help people with low or no income. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel passionate about this project but do not have the funds to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Share this campaign with friends and family. Use the Indiegogo share tools to connect people to our campaign via social media!

story:
Help Publish the First Thrifty Traveller's Guide! 



We are Amanda Wild and Jaybo Russell, cultural explorers, adventurers, storytellers, and thrifty travellers. When not studying Cultural Anthropology, Amanda spends her summers in the Drumheller Valley's bustling cultural tourism industry. Jaybo, a published writer and historian, has spent a decade exploring every trail, campsite, attraction, historic site, coulee, and hoodoo in the famous Drumheller Valley - the heart of the Canadian Badlands. 



Amanda: One day, in the spring of 2014, Jaybo and I talked about the rise of Indie Travel Guides. We both enjoy them for their cool factor and encouragement to get off the beaten path. 

Jaybo: When we realised there is no travel guide for Drumheller, we got excited by the prospect of writing one ourselves. After all, we know Drumheller really well. 

Amanda: After some serious planning, we spent nearly all our spare time in the summers of 2014 & 2015 driving about in Jaybo's VW bus exploring, researching and interviewing to learn as much as possible on what see and do in the Drumheller Valley. 



In our Thrifty Traveller's series, we answer questions such as: 

"Where do the locals go hiking?" 

"What are the best local eateries?" 

"Which are the coolest attractions and activities for a thrifty traveller?" 

We then compiled this information along with our own personal experiences to form the Thrifty Traveler’s Guide to the Drumheller Valley. We've also added our own Insider Tips, Traveller Picks, and Extra Dirt categories.

We like authenticity, therefore, want our travel guide to be free of countless pages of slick advertisements and any articles that may read like an infomercial. 

Keeping in mind that we ourselves prefer genuine yet cost effective experiences, we've assembled what we believe is an enjoyable guide overflowing with useful information.


By supporting our project, you are supporting a number of milestones. 

1) This is the first guide in a series dedicated to Thrifty Travellers - cultural explorers who want authentic experiences told by writers who know the area intimately. You can help launch an era of independent, down-home, genuine travel guides for people just like you. 

2) This is Drumheller Valley's first international travel guide. Drumheller is Alberta's third largest tourist destination and is now ready to invite the world. You can help put Drumheller on the international travel map. You already know Drumheller is amazing with world class museums and rugged landscapes. You can help spread the word.

The book: The Thrifty Traveller's Guide to Drumheller Valley is approximately 75 pages, softcover, 6x9 book. Small enough to fit in a backpack or the glove box.


What do we need?

We are asking for $5000 CDN. 

$3500 is required to print the Thrifty Traveller's guide locally in Drumheller, AB. This will publish 700 hard copies.

$1000 is required to distribute hard copies to Canadian Destination Travel Information Centres and select stores. Electronic copies will be made available on Kindle Direct and Amazon sites.

$500 is required to help promote the Thrifty Traveller's Guide to Social Media, Amazon, and sites on-line where prospective travellers frequent.


Thank You!

Jaybo: Amanda & I wholeheartedly thank you for considering this project. We are excited to see your interest in helping publish a book that tells the world about the amazing things to see and do in the Drumheller Valley.

Amanda: If we do not reach our goal, we are still moving forward with the Thrifty Traveller's series. We'll examine our resources, and reassess the scale of the project. We may reduce the number of hard copies printed, or increase the selling price of the book in order to offset printing costs. If we raise more than expected, we would, in turn, increase the number of hard copies printed, and expand our distribution. 

In the meantime, here are some quick and quirky Tips for Living In the Badlands


How Your Support Helps

We know Drumheller Valley is an amazing place to explore, and we want to tell the world! With your assistance, the Thrifty Traveller's Guide will reach prospective travellers across the globe, and give them insight into what makes Drumheller one of Canada's coolest travel destinations. Help us generate interest in Drumheller - the valley of eerie landscapes, wild history, world-class attractions, and of course, dinosaurs. 


Our Experience


Jaybo: While this is our first travel guide, both Amanda and I are no strangers to the tourism industry. Between the two of us, we have over 20 years working in tourism. I'm also a veteran writer, having written numerous articles, history books, plays, and the Amazon Hot Seller - The Adventures of A Diner Poet.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word to your friends on social media
  • Visit Jaybo's website at www.jayborussell.com He's Jaybo Russell - Author, Story Teller, Bicycle Mechanic
  • Check out Jaybo's YouTube Channel 
  • Like Jaybo Russell on Facebook or follow Jaybo on Instagram and Twitter 
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Get the book here!

Working in a startup feels like juggling ten jobs. No matter if you are the founder, marketing manager, lead developer or an intern. Endless hours, long meetings, investor emails, relationships broken, and it all builds up.

You often have the responsibilities of multiple people, and are trying to deliver them in fraction of the time.



This causes what we call stress and when it becomes chronic it might lead up to burnout or depression.


We need to remember that:

 

The Comedy Book For the Startup Crowd - Everyone In a Startup Needs a Laugh

We have written the first comic/comedy book for entrepreneurs. It's packed satire, puns and humour. We've included many experiences from our own journey, and that of many other people to create something every entrepreneur can relate to.

 

 

So Whats in the Book?

We have split the book into multiple sections:

1. Entrepreneur nightmares
2. Entrepreneur things that normal people consider weird
3. Entrepreneur daydreams
4. Startup Jargon
5. Everyday situations

Get the book here!

Preview into the book:




What does it look like?

The book is a paperback printed with thick glossy paper. You'll love the feel.

 

The Book is Ready to Print

We have secured a book printer that is ready to print hundreds of copies on a moments notice. We have printed a few test copies before our final print run.

A Great Christmas Gift Your "Startup" Friends

This Christmas give yourself or your entrepreneur friend, family member or special someone a book. Christmas shopping is always a struggle trying to figure out the perfect gift and this book filled with humour would be one less gift to worry about.

We will hand wrap the book as a beautiful Christmas gift to open on Christmas with a special note from you to your friend.

We ship for Christmas for orders done before the 27th of November.

Ps. Imagine the excitement of ripping a beautifully wrapped gift on Christmas morning!

 

The Origin Story


We have travelled to nine countries, interviewed dozens of entrepreneurs and have lived in London, Amsterdam, Eindhoven and Helsinki since. We’re deep in the startup scene, and have run our own or been a part of multiple startups. 

We felt that a bit of comedy was needed in the scene.



The idea spawned a year ago when we were making bad jokes around startups, the jargon and how seriously people take things. The book has been gathering jokes and ideas ever since.

​Iranthi Gomes

Iranthi is behind a lot of the situational humour and logistics of the book. Iranthi is a Sri Lankan entrepreneur, and with Jarkko has headed companies such as Inventshift, Wheelys Melbourne and ServiceHired. 

Jarkko Oksanen

Jarkko is crafting the puns, and the comedy of the book, and creating drafts for the illustrations. Jarkko is of Finnish origin, and has an entrepreneur / software background.

Now in late 2017 we’ve enough material, and a bit of time to make this happen. 

 

Take your pick! 

 

 

We need your help to make more people smile

We've made a nice chart, so you can see where your dollars (or euros, rupees) are going towards.
Every pledge help us keep more jokes coming for the next year.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word about this project with your family, friends, colleagues, acquaintances and simply anyone who you think would get a major kick out of this book! 

Click these links to follow the Ultimate Guide to Startup Jargon in Everyday Life on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

You can also check out our website here!  To get in touch email us on iranthi@startupjokes.com and we'd be happy to answer any questions you have.

Thank you Hustlers!
Iranthi & Jarkko

Get the book here!

story:
Meet the BorderSenses Literary Journal 

BorderSenses Literary Journal is releasing its 22nd issues and we need your help to publish the latest issue.

A Little History 

BorderSenses (est. 2000) is a non-profit literary organization dedicated to offering community-oriented projects as well as provide venues for artist and writers in the El Paso/Juarez area. BorderSenses has collaborated with several organizations and worked on various projects to support the arts in our community. 

Who We Are 

BorderSenses Literary Journal  is managed by a group of dedicated volunteers who are passionate about the arts. All the work that goes into the publication from the call for submissions process to the final printed edition is a labor of love.
The journal is published annually and showcases the work of emerging and acclaimed bilingual writers and artists in and outside the border region. It is the longest running literary publication manged by a volunteer staff in the Borderplex area that spotlights multiculturalism. 
The money raised from this campaign will go directly toward the design and print of the 22nd volume of BorderSenses Literary Journal.  

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will help pay:
  • for a full-color edition
  • printing costs
  • layout cost
  • promotions
  • a release party featuring authors and artist included in the issue  
What you get for donating 
  • supporting the arts 
  • your name featured in the acknowledgments page 
  • your name featured on our website
If we don't meet our goal:
  • the funds will still be applied to the issue 
  • staff will make executive decisions on where to cut costs

The Impact

We know that there are many fundraisers such as this one. But, we feel that the longevity and relevance of BorderSenses Literary Journal isn't like any other. One day, we hope the arts won't be underrepresented, but without your help, with a donation of any amount, we won't be able to keep producing the same quality journal we have in the past. Help us in continuing to push the arts into the limelight. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is able to contribute, but by sharing with your friends, family, co-workers you will help us reach our goal.

story:
Greetings!   

Hi! I’m Olivia. I am a writer, English teacher, and artist from NC. I am self-publishing my second novel. The Unbinding is a sequel to The Unfading. They are fantasy, in the vein of C. S. Lewis and George MacDonald. I believe in Madeleine L’Engle’s idea of serving the work. These stories came to me. I am now sending them into the world. As a self-published author, I have funded myself. This is a new venture, to allow others to join in the process of creating this book. I am hopeful and thankful for this opportunity.

I taught English in Beijing for a summer, in 2006. I enjoy traveling, mostly on my summer breaks and to visit friends or track down literary history. I sponsor a little girl in Nepal through Tiny Hands International. Through reading and research, I have learned about modern day slavery, child labor, and the abuse of women and girls still all too prevalent in our world. I try to support ethical businesses and Fair Trade retailers, as a part of not supporting slavery and child labor. These things, along with my faith, my family, and my little bit of forest, have influenced much of my writing.

Thank you for considering a donation and please keep reading to learn about all the ways you can help. Let's see what we can create!


More About My Books:


In 2010, I self-published my first novel, The Unfading. I worked on it off and on for six years. I started it while in graduate school at UNC-Greensboro and finished it as an instructor at Alamance Community College. By 2011 I had started the sequel, what was to become The Unbinding. In April of 2012, my mother passed away. Many things were put on hold, but I eventually found my way back to working on this novel.

After a year of searching (and a couple of false starts) I have finally found an editor to go through the final version of The Unbinding. Keep in mind, it was a 400 page manuscript. After that, it comes back to me to proof the editing. Then on to internal formatting, layout, and cover design. If all goes well…it could be in print before the end of the year!

Writing is my love. It’s something I know I am meant to do. When I am writing or reading, I often feel most myself. I will always write. Publishing is another challenge. When I know that the story wants to go out into the world, I have to do my best to send it. It's not easy--though.

The Unbinding is a special story. Not only was it written during the illness and passing of my mother, but it is a fantasy story with a very real heart. It deals with such issues as child labor, oppression, and finding how to best help others whose lives are very different from our own. It also continues the journey of Queen Carina, her family, and friends. A few new characters show up too!

The Biggest Challenge: Writing Through Grief


This book has been influenced by many things. It started as a natural outpouring to follow The Unfading. It is also intimately connected with the season my mother’s illness and death. In 2009, my mother, Rodema, was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. The Unfading was published in 2010. The bulk of the manuscript of The Unbinding was written in 2011. Mom read that manuscript. She was always my first (and best) reader!

Toward the end of 2011, I was still working on The Unbinding. I used my Christmas break for writing. Because I was on break, I was also free during the day to take mom to a doctor’s appointment. On December 23, 2011, we found out that the cancer was back and had spread to her brain. I didn’t work on the manuscript for exactly one year.

Mom passed on April 21, 2012. Sometime that summer, I opened the manuscript. I thought I might work on it. I saw the the “last saved date” of December 23, 2011 and closed it. It was not until December 23, 2012, that I opened it again and began work. Even after that--it was a long road.

Somewhere along the way I realized that not only was it editing that was giving me a hard time, but it was grief. I knew that when this novel was finished, Mom would not be there to hold it. The day the box came, full of the first run copies of The Unfading, it was so exciting. We have a picture of Mom, at the kitchen table, beside the box, holding my book. I knew that would never be repeated. To finish the book would be to finish it without her here. The most difficult thing about writing this book was not the writing, or the editing; it was grief. And each day that I keep writing is an affirmation that there is still life to be lived--here and elsewhere.

This book was also written out of my deep concern for children, for the hideous problem of child labor and slave labor, and my commitment to supporting Fair Trade products and better alternatives—whenever I can. I don’t write documentaries. I write fiction. However, truth though fiction is one of the most powerful weapons we have in the fight against evil. This book is my small way of voicing my concerns, of doing something, of kicking at least a little hole in the darkness.

Of course, I also love to read: George MacDonald, C. S. Lewis, Madeleine L’Engle, the Brontes, and so many others have deeply helped me. Everything I write will always be owing to them, in one way or another. Good books keep me going!

What We Need & What You Get

1. Professional line editing (approximately $3,000.00)

Editing is must for a final version, and it is worth it. I am thankful to have great writers and teachers for co-workers. Several of them have given time and effort to go through earlier versions or parts of the manuscript. That was helpful all along the way. It’s also important for the final version to have an overall edit and a consistent one. I have struggled to find the right editor. I finally went back to the company who did the formatting and layout for the first novel. I’m pleased with them. I know my book is worth it.


2. Format and layout of the interior, cover design, and e-book conversion (around 700.00)

This includes the type font, spacing, chapter headings, front matter, etc. While I did, for my first novel, provide the cover art, I still needed someone to do the layout. I imagine something similar for the sequel. This also means the novel is format ready to go to amazon’s create space…so that we can have real copies and an e-book!

3. First run copies, promotional materials, and marketing (300.00 goal).

Create Space does mean print on demand, but I also usually order in bulk. Any funding above what I need to get the book ready to print can help in actually getting printed copies. Things like bookmarks, post cards, posters, prints, etc. can also help greatly in spreading the word. While I traditionally haven’t done a lot with paid advertising, there are a lot of options for services for self published writers. Anything above the minimum to get it in print could help greatly in getting the word out to a wider audience.

If you can, please donate to help in publishing my second book. No amount is too small, and we’ve come up with some creative incentives for you too! Thank you for your time and generosity!


Why Funding? Why Now?


For the first book, I paid for everything out of my savings (and through my job as a teacher). While I eventually did recover my costs and start to make a little profit on the book, it was a long road. This time, with a longer novel, and professional editing, it’s going to cost a little more. I am absolutely prepared to back myself. I believe my book is worth it. Launching a book without a deficit to recover would be a great blessing. It would also allow me to focus on writing and sharing, without worrying over dollars and cents.

I also realize that I do most of my writing in a very solitary way. Connecting with my readers and supporters, even before the book launch, would be a very good thing for me. This will be an opportunity to see what we can do, instead of assuming I need to do it all on my own. I’m a little scared about that, but also hopeful and excited.

So...I rather imagine by now one of three things has happened: You’ve already stopped reading, deciding this is just too long, you’ve connected and you are on board, or you are intrigued, but not quite ready to commit. Wherever you are is okay. Thank you for giving me (and my book) a chance. If you are still unsure, let us know what information might help. If you’ve already given, thank you for taking the time to read this. I hope something in it inspires you in your own story and adventure!

Other Ways You Can Help

What if you can’t donate money just now, but you still want to help?
There are plenty of ways to do just that!

Share this campaign with your friends.

Share the Facebook page, the website, and tell people.

Buy a copy of The Unfading or The Unbinding later.

If you are part of an organization that might be interested in hosting a reading/signing, let me know. (This might be at a book store, business, club, church, school, home school group, or gathering of your friends...)

Encourage your local public and school libraries to buy a copy of The Unbinding…and The Unfading, if they don’t have one. Maybe someone would even be interested in a class set or using this for a school project or reading group. Talk to people and share.

Look out for information about book readings and events. Attend those. Help to promote those.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

While writing is challenging and takes time, marketing is where I struggle. Anything that you can do to help get the word out is just as valuable as a monetary donation…maybe even more so! Your recommendation of a book goes a long way. Please don’t underestimate the help you give in sharing this information.

Oh and...thank you, thank you, thank you...!
story_txt:
Greetings!    
Hi! I’m Olivia. I am a writer, English teacher, and artist from NC. I am self-publishing my second novel. The Unbinding is a sequel to The Unfading. They are fantasy, in the vein of C. S. Lewis and George MacDonald. I believe in Madeleine L’Engle’s idea of serving the work. These stories came to me. I am now sending them into the world. As a self-published author, I have funded myself. This is a new venture, to allow others to join in the process of creating this book. I am hopeful and thankful for this opportunity. 
I taught English in Beijing for a summer, in 2006. I enjoy traveling, mostly on my summer breaks and to visit friends or track down literary history. I sponsor a little girl in Nepal through Tiny Hands International. Through reading and research, I have learned about modern day slavery, child labor, and the abuse of women and girls still all too prevalent in our world. I try to support ethical businesses and Fair Trade retailers, as a part of not supporting slavery and child labor. These things, along with my faith, my family, and my little bit of forest, have influenced much of my writing. 
Thank you for considering a donation and please keep reading to learn about all the ways you can help. Let's see what we can create! 

More About My Books: 
In 2010, I self-published my first novel, The Unfading. I worked on it off and on for six years. I started it while in graduate school at UNC-Greensboro and finished it as an instructor at Alamance Community College. By 2011 I had started the sequel, what was to become The Unbinding. In April of 2012, my mother passed away. Many things were put on hold, but I eventually found my way back to working on this novel.After a year of searching (and a couple of false starts) I have finally found an editor to go through the final version of The Unbinding. Keep in mind, it was a 400 page manuscript. After that, it comes back to me to proof the editing. Then on to internal formatting, layout, and cover design. If all goes well…it could be in print before the end of the year! Writing is my love. It’s something I know I am meant to do. When I am writing or reading, I often feel most myself. I will always write. Publishing is another challenge. When I know that the story wants to go out into the world, I have to do my best to send it. It's not easy--though.The Unbinding is a special story. Not only was it written during the illness and passing of my mother, but it is a fantasy story with a very real heart. It deals with such issues as child labor, oppression, and finding how to best help others whose lives are very different from our own. It also continues the journey of Queen Carina, her family, and friends. A few new characters show up too! 

The Biggest Challenge: Writing Through Grief
This book has been influenced by many things. It started as a 
natural outpouring to follow The Unfading. It is also intimately 
connected with the season my mother’s illness and death. In 2009, my 
mother, Rodema, was diagnosed with ovarian cancer. The Unfading was 
published in 2010. The bulk of the manuscript of The Unbinding was 
written in 2011. Mom read that manuscript. She was always my first (and 
best) reader! Toward the end of 2011, I was still working on The
 Unbinding. I used my Christmas break for writing. Because I was on 
break, I was also free during the day to take mom to a doctor’s 
appointment. On December 23, 2011, we found out that the cancer was back
 and had spread to her brain. I didn’t work on the manuscript for 
exactly one year. Mom passed on April 21, 2012. Sometime that 
summer, I opened the manuscript. I thought I might work on it. I saw the
 the “last saved date” of December 23, 2011 and closed it. It was not 
until December 23, 2012, that I opened it again and began 
work. Even after that--it was a long road. Somewhere along the 
way I realized that not only was it editing that was giving me a hard 
time, but it was grief. I knew that when this novel was finished, Mom 
would not be there to hold it. The day the box came, full of the first 
run copies of The Unfading, it was so exciting. We have a picture of

fiction. However, truth though fiction is one of the most powerful 
weapons we have in the fight against evil. This book is my small way of 
voicing my concerns, of doing something, of kicking at least a little 
hole in the darkness.Of course, I also love to read: George 
MacDonald, C. S. Lewis, Madeleine L’Engle, the Brontes, and so many 
others have deeply helped me. Everything I write will always be owing to

  What We Need & What You Get
1. Professional line editing (approximately $3,000.00) Editing is must for a final version, and it is worth it. I am thankful to have great writers and teachers for co-workers. Several of them have given time and effort to go through earlier versions or parts of the manuscript. That was helpful all along the way. It’s also important for the final version to have an overall edit and a consistent one. I have struggled to find the right editor. I finally went back to the company who did the formatting and layout for the first novel. I’m pleased with them. I know my book is worth it. 2. Format and layout of the interior, cover design, and e-book conversion (around 700.00)This includes the type font, spacing, chapter headings, front matter, etc. While I did, for my first novel, provide the cover art, I still needed someone to do the layout. I imagine something similar for the sequel. This also means the novel is format ready to go to amazon’s create space…so that we can have real copies and an e-book! 3. First run copies, promotional materials, and marketing (300.00 goal).Create Space does mean print on demand, but I also usually order in bulk. Any funding above what I need to get the book ready to print can help in actually getting printed copies. Things like bookmarks, post cards, posters, prints, etc. can also help greatly in spreading the word. While I traditionally haven’t done a lot with paid advertising, there are a lot of options for services for self published writers. Anything above the minimum to get it in print could help greatly in getting the word out to a wider audience. 
If you can, please donate to help in publishing my second book. No

  Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Why Should You Learn to Format an e-Book?

Most writers are aware of the power of having an e-book. At the same time, many writers fear technology and can't afford to hire someone to prepare their manuscript for electronic publishing.

It's possible to prepare your manuscript without knowing the programming code used in e-books. All you need is Word and step-by-step instructions. Practical Guide: Formatting e-Books for Writers gives you those step-by-step instructions.
Take a look at what you'll learn with this book.
Table of Contents
Sample Chapter
How did I get started formatting e-books? Or more to the point, why did I start formatting e-books? There are two reasons: 1) I like to do things myself to learn the process, and 2) I couldn't afford to hire someone to do it for me. 
The first book was weeks of trial and error. Not because it was particularly hard, but because there was no simple step-by-step guide that spoke to my right brain. During the second book, I started making cheat sheets for myself to ease my way through the process. It wasn't long before I was formatting books for others.
My experience eventually led to teaching others how to format their books. Over the past four years I've been teaching others I've been asked if there's a book. Now there is. 
So, if I'm formatting this book myself, why do I need funds to publish this book?
  • Editing - No writer, even those of us who are editors*, should skip hiring a professional editor.
  • Cover Design - I'm a writer, not a designer. I want a professional-looking cover.
  • Print Design - I will hire a professional to help design the print edition. This is different than the design of an e-book.
  • Little Details - Every project has little details that need to be paid for. You know shipping materials, advertising, even gas to go to promote this project.
Even if you don't plan to format your own e-book, you can benefit from this project. You will learn  the formatting process, the dos and don'ts of manuscript preparation for your formatting company, plus a list of resources to help you find just what you need to publish your e-book.

You contribution, no matter the size, will make all of this possible. It means this book will be available in March, 2016.

*A special note to editors: More writers are planning to only publish electronically. You can add value to your services by knowing the information in the Practical Guide: Formatting e-Books for Writers. You will be able to help your client have a clean manuscript for the formatting process, while you do your usual editing.

What Is Needed & What You Get

You can see right at the top; I need $600 to cover the above expenses. I've already been able to negotiate with friends who are professionals to get the best rates possible. (We share our services.) 

What about you? What do you get beyond feeling good about getting this book to market? In addition to my gratitude, you can pick your own level of support to receive one or more of the following:

  • the e-book.
  • the e-book and print book. (Table of Contents)
  • a scholarship to the next Introduction to e-Publishing class. (Begins February 8, 2016)
  • a scholarship to the next Creating and Formatting e-Books class. (Begins July 18, 2016)
  • private lessons and consultation. 
  • e-editing of your e-book. 

What's the Worse That Can Happen?

Of course, none of us have any guarantees in life. I have no guarantee that I will get the full funding I need. What happens then?

Here's what has been accomplished so far:

  • the manuscript is completed,
  • the editor is editing as you read this,
  • the cover is being designed as you read this,
  • I have already begun to format the manuscript.
I've come too far to quit. The worst that will happen is the book will not be released in March as planned. My editor and designer are kind enough to wait until I get the funds for payment, but they will be paid.
I receive no benefit until the Practical Guide: Formatting e-Books for Writers is published.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you can't make a contribution at this time. You can still be part of the campaign. 

  • Share this webpage with your friends.
  • Watch for the release of the Practical Guide: Formatting e-Books for Writers.
  • Use the share tools provided by Indiegogo at the left side of the screen.

Learn more about me at Practical Inspirations.

Thank you for your support.

I receive no benefit until the Practical Guide: Formatting e-Books for Writers is published.

    Other Ways You Can Help I know some of you can't make a contribution at this time. You can still be part of the campaign.   Share this webpage with your friends.
Watch for the release of the Practical Guide: Formatting e-Books for Writers. Use the share tools provided by Indiegogo at the left side of the screen.   Learn more about me at Practical Inspirations.Thank you for your support.

story:
Campaign Overview

I am E. A. Hennessy, an author preparing to publish my first novel: Grigory's Gadget. This novel will be the first in my Gaslight Frontier series of steampunk adventure novels, and it will be self-published.

I have been writing science fiction and fantasy stories since early elementary school, and always knew I wanted to publish a novel some day. It wasn't until I participated in National Novel Writing Month (NaNoWriMo) in 2010 that I finally wrote a story from beginning to end (though it was admittedly very rough!). I participated again in 2014, producing a working draft of Grigory's Gadget. After months of editing, sending my manuscript to beta readers, and editing some more, I'm ready to move forward in the publication process.

Because I am self-publishing, there are considerable upfront costs associated with this process. The biggest cost is hiring a professional editor to ensure that my manuscript is up to snuff. I will also hire a book cover designer, who will produce eBook and print book cover designs, social media and marketing images for my novel, and a map of my fictional world. Finally, I will be purchasing ISBNs for each format of my novel.

The Novel

Zoya Orlova and her friends decide to leave their freezing authoritarian home of Lodninsk to start a new life in the tropical paradise of Mirgorod. When pirates attack their passenger ship, the friends find themselves caught in a struggle for possession of Zoya's family heirloom: a small gadget of compacted gears and wires. Unsure what power the gadget holds, Zoya feels she must protect it with her life. Will she and her friends be able to make it safely to their new home?

If my campaign is successfully funded, Grigory's Gadget will be available in March 2016.

Costs For Me and Perks For You


Cost breakdown:

  • Professional editor: $1,800
  • Book Cover Design: $245
  • Social Media and Marketing Images: $95
  • Map of Fictional World: $135
  • ISBNs: $295

Total: $2,570

Indigogo charges a fee of 5% on the total funds raised. So, for $4,000, that's a total of $200 in fees. There is also a 3% fee on credit card transactions, adding another $120 in fees.

The rest of the funding will go toward creating/ordering/shipping the perks!

The Perks

$1 - A sincere, personal thank you from me!

$5 - A Grigory's Gadget bookmark

$15 - A copy of the Grigory's Gadget eBook in the format of your choice (.epub, .mobi, .pdf)

$20 - A sample tin of a Grigory's Gadget custom-blend tea from Adagio Teas. Your choice of 1 of the 7 blends: Zoya Orlova (berry rooibos), Demyan Volkov (almond oolong), Anya Filipova (yerba mate), Lilia Alkaeva (masala chai), Nikolai Polzin (green tea), Lodninsk (pu erh), or Mirgorod(white tea). Please indicate your preference during checkout, or by contacting me.


$30 - A Steamship Pirate Tshirt (sizes Small to XL). Please indicate your size during checkout, or by contacting me, otherwise the default size will be Medium.

Bundles:

$30 - The Reader Bundle: a signed paperback copy of Grigory's Gadget, plus a copy of the eBook in the format of your choice, and a bookmark

$50 - The Candle Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus a homemade Grigory's Gadget candle made lovingly by me!

$60 - The Steamship Pirate Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus a Steamship Pirate tshirt (sizes S to XL). Please indicate the size you want during checkout or by contacting me, otherwise the default will be Medium.

$100 - The Tea Time Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus sample tins of the complete collection of custom-blended Grigory's Gadget teas from Adagio Teas.

$120 - The Cozy Bundle: everything included in the Tea Time Bundle, plus a homemade Grigory's Gadget candle made lovingly by me!

$150 - The Master Bundle: everything included in the Cozy Bundle, plus a Steamship Pirate tshirt (size S to XL). Please indicate the size you want during checkout or by contacting me, otherwise the default will be Medium.

Shipping is free to the United States! I am also shipping to Canada, with an added shipping fee of $15 (except for the sample tin of tea, that will only be $4 for shipping). Most perks will be ready and sent out in March 2016, with the exception of the sample tin of tea ($20 perk) and the Steamship Pirate tshirt ($30), which will be sent out in December 2015.

Why Self-Publish?

The world of publishing is changing, with self-publishing becoming more-and-more common. This puts all of the power and all of the rights into the author's hands, giving them more freedom to tell the story they need to tell.

The downside of this trend is that many writers upload their stories without proper editing and design, which in turn gives self-publishing a bad rap. By utilizing professional editors and designers, I hope to counter self-publishing's poor reputation.

To me, self-publishing and the steampunk genre go hand-in-hand. The steampunk community is full of original artists and makers, cosplayers, writers, readers, and fans with a deeply-embedded do-it-yourself attitude, and a focus on supporting others in the community. It's this attitude that solidified my decision to self-publish.

Risks & Challenges

Writing and publishing a novel is hard work, but I'm so close to the finish line! I've completed what many people consider the hard part: actually writing the story. Now it's a matter of cleaning it up, and presenting it to the world in a professional manner.

If I am unable to make my funding goal, Grigory's Gadget will not cease to exist. However, the process will be more difficult, and will take considerably longer as I try to save up enough money for the professional services.
Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, family, coworkers, sworn enemies...anyone you think might be interested in helping to get this steampunk novel published!  You can share quickly by using the Indiegogo Share Tools!

Because I am self-publishing, there are considerable upfront costs associated with this process. The biggest cost is hiring a professional editor to ensure that my manuscript is up to snuff. I will also hire a book cover designer, who will produce eBook and print book cover designs, social media and marketing images for my novel, and a map of my fictional world. Finally, I will be purchasing ISBNs for each format of my novel. 
The Novel
Zoya Orlova and her friends decide to leave their freezing authoritarian
 home of Lodninsk to start a new life in the tropical paradise
 of Mirgorod. When pirates attack their passenger ship, the 
friends find themselves caught in a struggle for possession of Zoya's 
family heirloom: a small gadget of compacted gears and wires. Unsure 
what power the gadget holds, Zoya feels she must protect it with her life.
 Will she and her friends be able to make it safely to their new home?
If my campaign is successfully funded, Grigory's Gadget will be available in March 2016.
  Costs For Me and Perks For You 




Cost breakdown:

Professional editor: $1,800
Book Cover Design: $245
Social Media and Marketing Images: $95
Map of Fictional World: $135
ISBNs: $295

Total: $2,570
Indigogo charges a fee of 5% on the total funds raised. So, for $4,000, that's a total of $200 in fees. There is also a 3% fee on credit card transactions, adding another $120 in fees.
The rest of the funding will go toward creating/ordering/shipping the perks!
The Perks
$1 - A sincere, personal thank you from me!
$5 - A Grigory's Gadget bookmark
$15 - A copy of the Grigory's Gadget eBook in the format of your choice (.epub, .mobi, .pdf)
$20 - A sample tin of a Grigory's Gadget custom-blend tea from Adagio Teas. Your choice of 1 of the 7 blends: Zoya Orlova (berry rooibos), Demyan 
Volkov (almond oolong), Anya Filipova (yerba mate), Lilia Alkaeva 
(masala chai), Nikolai Polzin (green tea), Lodninsk (pu erh), or Mirgorod(white tea). Please indicate your preference during checkout, 
or by contacting me.

$30 - A Steamship Pirate Tshirt (sizes Small to XL). Please indicate your size during checkout, or by contacting me, otherwise the default size will be Medium.

Bundles:
$30 - The Reader Bundle: a signed paperback copy of Grigory's Gadget, plus a copy of the eBook in the format of your choice, and a bookmark
$50 - The Candle Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus a homemade Grigory's Gadget candle made lovingly by me!



$60 - The Steamship Pirate Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus a Steamship Pirate tshirt (sizes S to XL). Please indicate the size you want during checkout or by contacting me, otherwise the default will be Medium.
$100 - The Tea Time Bundle: everything included in the Reader Bundle, plus sample tins of the complete collection of custom-blended Grigory's Gadget teas from Adagio Teas.

$120 - The Cozy Bundle: everything included in the Tea Time Bundle, plus a homemade Grigory's Gadget candle made lovingly by me!
$150 - The Master Bundle: everything included in the Cozy Bundle, plus a Steamship Pirate tshirt (size S to XL). Please indicate the size you want during checkout or by contacting me, otherwise the default will be Medium.
Shipping is free to the United States! I am also shipping to Canada, with an added shipping fee of $15 (except for the sample tin of tea, that will only be $4 for shipping). Most perks will be ready and sent out in March 2016, with the exception of the sample tin of tea ($20 perk) and the Steamship Pirate tshirt ($30), which will be sent out in December 2015.
  Why Self-Publish?
 The world of publishing is changing, with self-publishing becoming more-and-more common. This puts all of the power and all of the rights into the author's hands, giving them more freedom to tell the story they need to tell.
The downside of this trend is that many writers upload their stories without proper editing and design, which in turn gives self-publishing a bad rap. By utilizing professional editors and designers, I hope to counter self-publishing's poor reputation.
To me, self-publishing and the steampunk genre go hand-in-hand. The steampunk community is full of original artists and makers, cosplayers, writers, readers, and fans with a deeply-embedded do-it-yourself attitude, and a focus on supporting others in the community. It's this attitude that solidified my decision to self-publish.
Risks & Challenges
Writing and publishing a novel is hard work, but I'm so close to the finish line! I've completed what many people consider the hard part: actually writing the story. Now it's a matter of cleaning it up, and presenting it to the world in a professional manner.If I am unable to make my funding goal, Grigory's Gadget will not cease to exist. However, the process will be more difficult, and will take considerably longer as I try to save up enough money for the professional services. 

Other Ways You Can Help
 Please share this campaign with your friends, family, coworkers, sworn enemies...anyone you think might be interested in helping to get this steampunk novel published!  You can share quickly by using the Indiegogo Share Tools!

story:
You can write. I can help.

Have you always wanted to write, but aren't sure how or where to start? Or maybe you're an established author who loves writing, but whose biggest frustrations are:

  • Having a job that leaves you little time to write each day
  • Developing an author's website that looks good
  • Finding ways to promote yourself and sell your books

If any of those scenarios describes you, then "The Art & Business of Writing" is written for you.

I’m Chris Jones, an award-winning journalist and graphic designer, a writer, a magazine editor and a podcast host (“The Art & Business of Writing” on iTunes & Stitcher). I wrote “Art & Business of Writing: A Practical Guide to the Writing Life” to help writers of all levels solve these and other problems. 


My Story

Frustration brought me back to writing.

As I listened to “The Power of Focus” by Anthony Robbins, I decided to take him up on testing the power of something transformational. My first action: I reread the beginning of “The Artist's Way” by Julia Cameron and committed to rekindling my writing career. Six years had passed since my last full-time writing job and I hadn’t written much in that span. It was time.

I started by journaling — three pages of longhand, stream-of-consciousness writing — for 100 days. My daily affirmation, “You are a good writer,” went from something I half-heartedly scribbled in the notebook to words I came to believe and embrace. Within 75 days, the idea for a blog showed up.

I launched my blog, Pedestrian's Guide to Fredericksburg, and set out to write profiles about the arts, businesses and culture of Fredericksburg, Virginia, where I lived at the time. Not long after launching the blog, I received an email from Fredericksburg Parent & Family, a regional parenting magazine. They saw my blog and wanted to find a way to collaborate. We had a few conversations, but nothing materialized. I stayed in contact with the company’s director of operations and that relationship eventually paid off months later when she called to see if I knew anyone who would be interested in their part-time editor position. I told her that I would be interested and then was interviewed and offered the job.

I was writing professionally again and having fun. In that first year, I interviewed celebrity chef Rachael Ray, HGTV host Sabrina Soto, Pretty Little Liars star Keegan Allen, and Lifetime TVs Deborah Tillman — known as America’s Supernanny. A year later, I became the managing editor at a larger magazine called The Health Journal where I now serve as the magazine’s editor-in-chief.

A Buddhist proverb states, “When the student is ready, the teacher will appear.” There is truth to that. That is why I wrote this book. I want to help you achieve the same success I’ve reached using many of the tools and techniques I employed. In my book, you will learn:

  • How to create daily affirmations that work (and how to quiet your doubts!)
  • How to set goals and stick to them
  • How to add writing time into your already busy life
  • Which writing tools and apps to use to keep you producing content daily
  • How to create your branding material and why you need to do that now
  • How and where to network
  • How to build strategic relationships and why they're vital
  • How to create and effectively use a basic PR kit
  • How to use Wordpress to build and manage your writer's website
  • How to use social media for networking and community building

When you support my campaign, you're helping not only yourself, but also your fellow writers reach their dreams with a resource that will make them successful. You’re also helping me to print, distribute and promote my book in bookstores, on Amazon, through my website, and at speaking engagements and expos. When you support, everyone wins.

The book is already written and the cover is designed. This means that the $4,000 in backing will pay for:
  • Printing costs, ISBN numbers, barcodes, shipping, and fees
  • Distribution, public relations, and promotional events
  • Advertising on social media platforms and on relevant websites
  • Fulfilling campaign perks

And hey, when we surpass this goal, additional backing will go to produce more books and these will be offered to youth programs to provide teens who have an interest in writing an opportunity to start their writing journey.


What’s the Timeline for Fulfillment? 

Campaign contributors can expect to receive the book within 30 days after the campaign ends. This allows time to have the book printed and shipped back to you.


Can't Contribute? Share the Campaign!

Some people just can't contribute. I know and understand that. If you want to support the project, please share this campaign as widely as possible. The Indiegogo share tools make this nice and easy. 

Thank you!

story:
The Story

Hello there! Ask anyone about their history or national education lessons and they will recount how Mrs. Tan had the uncanny ability to hypnotise the whole class out of insomnia. Do you remember your history textbooks? (I bet not!)

Over the course of this year, I was inspired to work on a series of books that will deal with issues pertinent to our burdened society. The first book adopts a fun outlook on Singapore and important Singaporean themes to children. These themes are issues that are close to my heart and I believe, yours too. ​The subsequent books will revolve around a cute Pandan leaf protagonist "Dan" but will touch on educational themes such as Family Violence, Mental Illness, Bullying, Body Image and other issues.

My illustrator Joycelyn and I have spent many sleepless nights planning this book, with great anticipation that this new line of books will meaningfully educate young minds on these important topics. With great knowledge, comes power! I believe that equipping our children with insightful perspectives will help them make informed decisions and guide them in doing the right thing during tough times.

The protagonist and characters in this proposed book are key ingredients found in many of the local dishes that we love. The ingredients Pandan, Coconut, Wu Xiang Fen, Onion and Sugar are unique and frequently used in this region.


The Impact

We chose to use the first book to tell the Singapore story because there is a severe dearth of children’s storybooks that teaches about Singapore’s independence, self-reliance and diversity. This story aims to raise awareness on how we managed to foster a sense of belonging to this young nation despite limited resources, within a short span of time. We hope for families to spend more time together reading this story.


About the book:

  • 19.5 cm x 19.5 cm hardcover book

  • Hard cover

  • 36 fully illustrated and handpainted pages

  • High quality bright watercolours

  • Printed on high quality artpaper


What We Need

The books will be printed in the second week of November and we are targeting to start distribution of the books (non-profit) in the first week of December. We are blessed that the Singapore Government is funding 50% of this book, however we will still need to raise the remaining 50% in a short time before the end of December. With your kind and generous support, we hope to raise $5,000 (of course the more the merrier because it will then contribute to our next book!). The amount you donate, no matter the sum, will go a long way for Singaporeans and will definitely help to make this book a quality and memorable publication.

70% of this money raised will go towards printing a good quality hard cover book, with full colour art paper. It will also help us fund marketing, promotion and distribution costs. This will allow us to get the story out to more people. The remaining 30% of the project costs will go towards the hard working people who are slogging on this book such as our talented illustrator, wonderful publishing company Freshly Diced and our lovely PR specialist.

This is a flexible funding campaign. So if we do not reach our desired goal, we will have to print less books (which sadly means less children will get to read our cute and wonderful story). However we will still get the funds, less a higher commission to Indiegogo.


What You Get

We are very excited about this project and have lined up some awesome perks for you! Here's what you will get for supporting our project!


Risks & Challenges

We’ve partnered with a publisher, Freshly Diced, which is based in Hong Kong. Chris from Freshly Diced has been very focused on delivering the project, making sure the whole team is on schedule before Christmas! The artwork is 70% done and we will start printing next week! We have paid the deposit for the book and production of the book will take 4 weeks before it reaches the sunny shores of Singapore. We are optimistic that we can keep to the deadline before Christmas and we will keep everyone updated if there are any delays.


Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to spread the word to everyone you meet! We think it would make the best christmas gift for just about anyone… your family, friends, colleagues, gym buddies, nieces and nephews and even for your annual christmas exchange! We would be incredibly touched if you shared our campaign on all your social media platforms. Every mention helps and is greatly appreciated!

story:
Help an award-winning author of urban fantasy and steampunk release her next novel!  The first two books of the Ravensblood series are out, and have received rave reviews. I've finished a draft manuscript of the much-awaited third book, and a professional graphic artist has donated the work for the cover.

About Raven's Heart:

The reformed dark mage Corwyn Ravenscroft, Raven, has finally found his place in the world. He has a fiancé, friends, and meaningful work. Yet a shadow hangs over everything. His former master, the darkest and most powerful mage of their time, the man he betrayed, the man he thought he had killed, still lives. William is determined to destroy everyone and everything Raven ever loved.

Will Raven find a way to defeat him, once and for all? Or will he see the life he has built crumble around him as William rises once again to threaten the Three Communities, perhaps even the world?

Carina Press released my first novel, The Stolen Luck, which won a 2013 silver medal in the Global Ebook Awards and and a 2014 Eppie. I then released Ravensblood  (2014 Global Ebook gold medal) and Raven's Wing (2015 Global Ebook gold medal) indie with the help of crowdfunding, and Where Light Meets Shadow (Amazon best-seller) with the help of in-kind donations.  In short, I have a track record of producing well-written prose with the sort of riveting plot lines that keep readers up all night.

What I am looking for primarily is funds to pay for professional editing by Mary Rosenblum, a professional editor of many years' experience who did an excellent job on the first two novels of the series. Anything left over will go to publicity. . .early publicity has a huge impact on sales of a book, which in turn impacts later visibility and long term success.
EXCITING EXTRA!!!
If I overshoot my funding goal by $1500, I will also release A Hunt by  Moonlight, my steampunk Victorian Detective novel, complete in manuscript form but needing the final professional edit. (Think Sherlock Holmes if Holmes was a reluctantly-involved werewolf, Watson was a woman alchemist with attitude, and Lestrade wasn't an idiot). If that happens, everyone who donates $5 or more will also get an e-book copy of A Hunt By Moonlight, so it pays to spread the word and get your friends involved.

Be part of the magic! All donations gratefully accepted. Whether or not you can afford to donate, please help spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Tumbler, and anywhere else you can think of!

story:
This is not a typical cook book.

It isn’t crammed with hundreds of dishes that you can whip up in 30 minutes. It doesn’t tell you that its recipes are the 'best' versions. It isn’t even going to promise that everyone at the table will love it, because that would spoil the surprise.

This book is about learning – not just from the mistakes, but also from the ingredients, the process, and the ones who got you to stand in front of a stove.  It is also about the stories, the sweat and the swearing that only a kitchen can create.

But most of all, this book is about cooking, and those who live to tell the tale.

When we – Foong Li Mei and Szetoo Weiwen – started this project in July 2013, our aim was simple: to capture the stories behind every day home cooks and their recipes so that they will live on in the pages, and hopefully, someone else’s kitchen.

Hence, we started knocking on kitchen doors around Malaysia in search of the lives and flavours of unique cooking characters. We ended up documenting much more than that - slices of culture, identity, history, and personalities that showed us we are what we cook.

The authors: Weiwen (left) and Li Mei

We are giving all we can to produce a book that is worthy of the marvelous stories that were shared with us. We have already paid for most of the creative production, such as adding full-page illustrations to every story, page layout, editing and so on. We’ve even secured a printer who offers the best price-to-quality ratio.

However, there is still one final step to making this book a reality – printing it. This is where we need your support. Your contribution on our campaign can take us through the last leg of completing this project. If you can see the value of helping us out, the right of this page details the various amounts that you can contribute. 

All backers will get physical copies of the book. On top of that, each book comes with a set of FREE limited edition illustrated postcards! 

About the book

The Food that Makes Us features:

  • 10 essays with photographs exploring the stories behind home cooks and their specialty dishes, including Hainanese chicken rice, achar, popiah, tuak, pork belly confit, fish stew in bamboo by the native Semelai tribe, putu mayam and so on
  • 10 recipes, with step-by-step pictures as guide
  • 10 full-page artistic interpretations of each story by Malaysian illustrator Tuan Nini
  • Full-colour pages

The project was published as a series called ‘Cooking People’ in a Malaysian tablet magazine, The B-Side, from August 2013 to May 2014. Now that the magazine has ceased operation, the authors hope to keep the stories, recipes and spirit of the cooks alive by compiling them into this book.

 

A blend of essays, recipes, pictures and illustrations

What We Need 

As mentioned, the book is almost good to go – we are in the final stages of editing, layout and producing the artwork.

Now, we just need the funds to print 1,000 copies of the book in its full-colour glory, as well as to cover the marketing costs.

If we meet our funding goal of US$4,800, this is how we plan to put it to good use:

  • US$3800 will go to printing the book
  • US$400 will cover the fees and charges of using Indiegogo
  • US$600 will cover the cost of the book launch event and other marketing efforts

For Malaysian readers preferring to pay in the local currency, they can also pre-order the book here - the funds we get from the pre-orders will also help us go to print sooner.

Pinky Promises

In the case that we cannot hit our funding target, any contributions you have made will still go to the printing of the book. As we have already invested tons of waking hours, sweat and money into this project, we will persist in going all the way, even if it means seeking other sources of financing or adjusting the number of prints. Hence, don’t worry – you will still get physical copies of the book and other perks for your pledges no matter if we reach our goals or not. 

Extra Hands, and Extra Mouths 

It's okay if you don't feel like contributing financially, there are other ways to help us! You can simply just give our campaign a shout out among your friends and family, or share it on your social network. The share tools are right up there at the top of the page, and we'll appreciate it immensely if you can help spread our project and our story. 

And that's about it! If you need more information about us, do check out our team page.

This is not a typical cook book.
It isn’t crammed with hundreds of dishes that you can whip up in 30 minutes. It doesn’t tell you that its recipes are the 'best' versions. It isn’t even going to promise that everyone at the table will love it, because that would spoil the surprise.
This book is about learning – not just from the mistakes, but also from the ingredients, the process, and the ones who got you to stand in front of a stove.  It is also about the stories, the sweat and the swearing that only a kitchen can create.
But most of all, this book is about cooking, and those who live to tell the tale.

When we – Foong Li Mei and Szetoo Weiwen – started this project in July 2013, our aim was simple: to capture the stories behind every day home cooks and their recipes so that they will live on in the pages, and hopefully, someone else’s kitchen.
Hence, we started knocking on kitchen doors around Malaysia in search of the lives and flavours of unique cooking characters. We ended up documenting much more than that - slices of culture, identity, history, and personalities that showed us we are what we cook.

The authors: Weiwen (left) and Li Mei
We are giving all we can to produce a book that is worthy of the marvelous stories that were shared with us. We have already paid for most of the creative production, such as adding full-page illustrations to every story, page layout, editing and so on. We’ve even secured a printer who offers the best price-to-quality ratio.
However, there is still one final step to making this book a reality – printing it. This is where we need your support. Your contribution on our campaign can take us through the last leg of completing this project. If you can see the value of helping us out, the right of this page details the various amounts that you can contribute. 
All backers will get physical copies of the book. On top of that, each book comes with a set of FREE limited edition illustrated postcards! 


About the book
The Food that Makes Us features:

10 essays with photographs exploring the stories behind home cooks and their specialty dishes, including Hainanese chicken rice, achar, popiah, tuak, pork belly confit, fish stew in bamboo by the native Semelai tribe, putu mayam and so on
10 recipes, with step-by-step pictures as guide
10 full-page artistic interpretations of each story by Malaysian illustrator Tuan Nini
Full-colour pages


The project was published as a series called ‘Cooking People’ in a Malaysian tablet magazine, The B-Side, from August 2013 to May 2014. Now that the magazine has ceased operation, the authors hope to keep the stories, recipes and spirit of the cooks alive by compiling them into this book.




 

A blend of essays, recipes, pictures and illustrations








What We Need 

As mentioned, the book is almost good to go – we are in the final stages of editing, layout and producing the artwork.
Now, we just need the funds to print 1,000 copies of the book in its full-colour glory, as well as to cover the marketing costs.
If we meet our funding goal of US$4,800, this is how we plan to put it to good use:

US$3800 will go to printing the book
US$400 will cover the fees and charges of using Indiegogo
US$600 will cover the cost of the book launch event and other marketing efforts

For Malaysian readers preferring to pay in the local currency, they can also pre-order the book here - the funds we get from the pre-orders will also help us go to print sooner.
Pinky Promises
In the case that we cannot hit our funding target, any contributions you have made will still go to the printing of the book. As we have already invested tons of waking hours, sweat and money into this project, we will persist in going all the way, even if it means seeking other sources of financing or adjusting the number of prints. Hence, don’t worry – you will still get physical copies of the book and other perks for your pledges no matter if we reach our goals or not. 
Extra Hands, and Extra Mouths 
It's okay if you don't feel like contributing financially, there are other ways to help us! You can simply just give our campaign a shout out among your friends and family, or share it on your social network. The share tools are right up there at the top of the page, and we'll appreciate it immensely if you can help spread our project and our story. And that's about it! If you need more information about us, do check out our team page.

story:
About: The Walking School Bus

My story, The Walking School Bus, was inspired by a variety of experiences which shaped our characters’ journey.

Our protagonists, a 7-year-old boy, and girl, live in rural South Africa.

Their mothers work long days as caretakers and their fathers have both been forced to work further north in the mining camps. Consequently, the children are unable to attend school which is an 8-km walk from their village. Their mothers will not let them walk alone due to dangers along the way.


As a result, they spend their days gathering water, exploring, and looking for “treasures,” such as interesting rocks and animals.

One day, they find an object that they had never seen before, a shiny treasure.


Upon closer inspection and after asking their mothers, they discover that this object is a miniature school bus.

The children immediately understand that if they possessed a real school bus, then they too would be able to attend school and receive an education.

The following weeks are spent trying to build the real school bus out of many different materials.


However, once the children understand that the task is too great, their approach to the problem changes. They tap into the power of their imagination and harness it to make their dream of attending school a reality.


They form a group called the “walking school bus,” whereby children walk together in large numbers and mimic the shape –and protection– of a school bus.


Ultimately, their movement gains traction and spreads across South Africa, empowering education despite immense adversity.


Inspiration behind the story: 

4 years ago on a trip back to Johannesburg South Africa as well as Uganda, I became increasingly aware of how debilitating economic policies continued to negatively impact the population.  I saw how many lack basic access to fundamental human rights, namely, education – the same education too frequently taken for granted.

Frustrated with my inability to change the past, and with hopes to facilitate a brighter future, I wrote The Walking School Bus. The book will help raise funds to ensure access to education for communities where I currently work. Learn more at:  thewalkingschoolbus.com. 

What this book aims to achieve: 

While this book aims to achieve a variety of goals, a top priority is to impress the same importance of education that our protagonists feel onto its readers. It aims to show the lengths people will travel to attain an education.

Proceeds from the sales of each and every book will help generate the funds necessary to provide buses and educational material to villages in need. In this regard, the school bus is metaphoric and represents access. Access to education, access to scholastic material, access to nutrition – a prerequisite for education.

Interviews with community members associated with the project:

Head Teacher Enosh and I discuss the need for transportation infrastructure and the positive effects associated with a school bus. https://youtu.be/TVcYo3mdvYI

Head Master Seth and I discuss the history of interfaith education in Uganda as well as how the students access education. https://youtu.be/1h22SGclcNg

How you can help:

Please support The Walking School Bus initiative by purchasing a book, other promotional material, or by making a donation today.

What is the dream goal? 

To sell 500 hardcover books that would fund the purchase of one school bus!

                                           Product Description

The Walking School Bus Book 
September 1st, 2016 (Preorder your copy now). 




Stickers





Pen

Bookmark

Original Photographs

Shopping tote

TWSB: Change Box


Notebook:1 

 Notebook:2 

 Notebook:3 

Water bottle


Flip Flops

Sizing


Graphic Hat: 1

Graphic Hat: 2

Graphic Hat: 3


Graphic T


Graphic Long Sleeve


Watch: Give Back Time



Thanks For Reading!
