story:
Short Story

I want to publish my new book "How To Make A Living By Working For Free."

Slightly Longer Story

Hi... my name is Simon. Welcome to my crowdfunding project.

For the past 6 years I've worked in social media. In short this means I write jokes and make images for the internet. The longer story is I build communities through excellent free content that attracts an audience for brands.

For the last 5 years I've been a gigging comedian slowly building a fan base online through free content. I've used the knowledge and skills I've built in my day job to make communities around the different channels I operate in online.

This book explains everything I've learned from obsessively reading, learning and trying to work out how relationships build online, how to build a community around what you do as an artist to find, nurture and grow your community on and offline.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need from this crowdfunding it pretty simple... money to get the first print run of the book off the ground / get the digital book finalised and ready to go on sale on Amazon.

My target amount is the absolute minimum that I would need to get the book ready for the public. Anything above that would be sales / profit. 

I've set up some awesome rewards for early backers, but if there's something you want which isn't available, please email me (simon.m.caine@gmail.com) and I'll try to make it available for you.

Here's a synopsis of the book - 

The book is a how-to guide for artists to create their own online community for their work and how that community can support the artist to become sustainable in every way.

The book takes a critical and in-depth look at the media's perception of "free content" vs the reality of what the general public see it as.

If you're an artist in the modern age who wants a sustainable audience you're no longer just an artist, you're a community leader.

Here's a breakdown of all the chapters - 

Chapter 1: How to make money out of your creativity?

From the Middle Ages to Renaissance Europe to the current day. I give you a brief history of how artists made money to continue creating what they do best.

Chapter 2: Aims

What do you want to achieve? You can’t achieve an aim without having a final goal in mind. Here’s where you need to be honest with yourself about what you want so you can focus on your mind on how you’re going to get it.

Chapter 3: Where are you at the moment?

You could be below the radar or have a growing fan base. You could even have a large fan base but not now how to make money from it. This is the chapter where we look at where you are in relation to your goal and how you can realistically achieve it using The Curve.

Chapter 4: How do you build and maintain an audience?

What do you need in order to attract an audience? And more importantly, what do you need to do to maintain it. In this chapter we look at how relationships between artists and fans develops online and start to reframe the idea of “Free” as a good thing.

Chapter 5: How many fans do you really need?

Do you really need a million fans to be profitable? Probably not. The number is probably closer to 1,000. In this chapter we’ll look at how you find your True Fans and ask them (nicely) to support you.

Chapter 6: Why you shouldn’t aim for the mainstream

In this chapter we’ll look at why “breaking the mould” or doing something unique is a great thing and you shouldn’t fear it. The mainstream is dying and niche interest communities are growing as we’ll see in the Long Tail Theory. By being specific in what you do you stand the greatest chance of attracting a loyal fan base.

Chapter 7: How can you be unique in your field?

Now that we’ve established why being unique is a good thing, we’ll need to work out what’s unique about you and why that’s a really good and exciting thing. Oh they’ll be Purple Cows.

Chapter 8: Why advertising undervalues content.

Can you live off internet adverts? Probably not. (Sorry to burst your bubble). Advertising can make you a bit of cash, but in this chapter we’ll look into why that cash is short term, can lose you fans and ultimately devalues what you’re trying to do.

Chapter 9: Why you have to give stuff away for free?

In this chapter we’re going to look into the main reasons why some artists have decided to give away their content for free and why people will pay for art that they can get for free.

Chapter 10: Why you have to give stuff away?

Why people will and won’t pay for free content is down to your connection with them. In this chapter we’re going to look at why free content is actually the first step in building a connection with a potential True Fan.

Chapter 11: How to think like a fan.

Artists often forget that they’re fans of someone else - usually the person who got them interested in the thing they’re doing / making. Remembering how excited you are about another artist's work helps you get in the mindset of your fans which is important when it comes to building a relationship with them.

Chapter 12: Pick yourself

Why you should be independent and not wait to make the thing you’ve always wanted. If it’s good enough and finds a large enough audience the mainstream industry will beat a path to your door - by which time, you might not even need them.

Chapter 13: Why paywalls are the worst thing online.

Given that we established in Chapter 10 that giving away content is actually the first step in building a relationship, we look at paywalls and why these are not going to help you to continue to attract a wider and wider audience.

Chapter 14: Vanity Figures.

Numbers are fun online. From your Follower count on Twitter to your Fans on Facebook, it’s easy to forget these numbers are people. They might make you feel good when they’re going up, but they’re vanity metrics and should be taken with a pinch of salt. What numbers matter and what numbers make us feel good aren’t always the same thing.

Chapter 15: A Quick Guide to Crowdfunding.

In this chapter we’ll deep dive into several methods of crowdfunding your art from the one-off method to the on-going financial support of your fans which can be so critical for artists.

Chapter 16: First Steps / Devising Own Targets.

Where do I go from here?

Now that you’ve learned everything I have to offer I will give you some final tips specific to your artistic field and also go into deep detail on what you can do to cultivate your community.

I LOVE the sound of this book, but I'd like to preview it first...

Well you're in luck my friend. I've put a DRM-free PDF of the first few chapters which you can download / read here. 

If you'd prefer to listen to the first few chapters (read by me) you can get that for free by right-clicking on this link and selecting "save like as", or getting it from the Ask The Industry podcast (a podcast I host) or you can stream it below. The choice is yours.

Other Ways You Can Help...

If you can't afford or do not want to buy the book, or you can buy the book but you'd like to go an extra mile to support me first of all THANK YOU.

Your support means the world. The fact you're even reading the options means so much to me. You could be doing anything with your life right now. Literall anything. So thank you for reading this.

Other ways you can support me include - 

  • Sharing this webpage on any of your social media accounts to help spread the word.
  • Passing on the PDF / audiobook preview of the book with friends on social media.
  • Sign up to my mailing list to find out when future writing projects will come out. 

Risks etc...

Of course with any project like this there's a certain amount of risk involved. But the big one is that I don't make the funding. Now, I've borrowed some money to get the product finished which means it's basically ready to go. The worse situation will be I make a massive loss on this. 
I am asking you to take a bit of a risk on me by buying this book, but if you've read this far down the page I hope you don't think I'm some sort of online scam artists - if I was, there would be much easier ways for me to try and take your money. 
If you have any concerns or issues which I've not covered here, please do not hesitate to email me. I promise no question is stupid or too petty. I'll be happy to answer anything. Here's my personal email - simon.m.caine@gmail.com or you can tweet me (@thismademecool) if you can fit it into 140 characters.

story:
musings of a phoenix

Hello all the lovely people in the world who come upon this,

My name is Steph, also known as ~the mystic dreamer~ and Goji. I have been working hard on a poetry book since 2017, and have written over 100 poems for it. And for the past year, I've been refining and also collaborating with my healer artist friend Ash B on it. We are both women based in the Bay Area.

The book will be titled "musings of a phoenix". It will be copies of my handwritten poems, collaged with Ash's hand linedrawn artistry. 

We would like to raise funds in order to publish it and start to spread it to our loved ones, friends and family who might be in need of healing poetry and art.

The book has sections called "present", "lost", "heart", "universe", "dreams", and "growth" and opens with a poem called Rebirth.

We would also like to continue supporting other hard-working people, so 15% of our earnings will be donated to a charity, to be carefully and deliberately researched later (probably one that lies at the cross section of climate x youth)

Thank you so much for your attention and energy. I am infinitely grateful.

 

Here is a taste  of my poetry, not from the book ;)

story:
Short Summary

Hi loves! We're marginsbox. We began in January 2019 with the intent of shaking up the subscription book box game. After noticing most Young Adult boxes primarily featured white authors, we decided to give authors of color a chance to shine. Our inaugural box shipped May 2019 and we exclusively feature BIPOC authors, and the majority of the vendors we fill our boxes with are also marginalized! 

Now, we’re raising funds to expand our reach and we hope you’ll help us achieve our goals! We love what we’re doing, and lots of you do, too, but sustained support is key. YOU can help us out! How, you ask? Simple! Choose your pledge level to help support a small, Black-owned & queer-owned business.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $15,000 to help us with operations. What will it be used for? Glad you asked!

  • $8,000: funding for regular operation of marginsbox
  • $5,000: quiltbag box for 150 backers
  • $1,000: advertising
  • $750: Indiegogo fees
  • $250: credit card charge fees

For backers who pledge $10 or more, you'll receive a campaign-exclusive marginsbox magnet! So your fridge can support us too! To make this more enticing, if you pledge $50 or more, you’ll receive even cooler campaign exclusives!

  • Exclusive #1 – a Class of 2019 t-shirt featuring signatures from characters in our marginsbox-featured books! You remember getting a class shirt signed at the end of the year, right? It’s like that, but with your fictional faves! Receive this with pledges of $40 or more!
  • Exclusive #2 – a special sneak peek at our future plans: the quiltbag box! Our quiltbag box will feature queer authors from all sorts of backgrounds, and our prototype box is going to be AMAZING. We’re offering this prototype box so that even current subscribers can get something exciting and new from this new campaign! Receive this with pledges of $50 or more!

Pledges of $80 or more can get the t-shirt and the box! And for $85, you can get the shirt, magnet, and box! Awww yiss!

The Impact

Let's face it - publishing is a primarily white industry producing products with primarily white authors writing primarily white characters. Our goal is to expand the horizons of people who may not normally pick up certain books by marginalized authors and have them fall in love. We want to give marginalized kids a chance to see themselves reflected on the page and behind the pen. We want to show that it's possible to have a successful subscription box--a successful career in publishing--without leaving marginalized voices out of the conversation. Otherwise, things will remain the way they are indefinitely.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is not reaching our goal. We will only be able to fulfill the quiltbag box campaign prototype if we fully fund, so if we fall short, we have backup plans in store that depend upon how close we get, and we'll let everyone know ASAP if there's a change. But we're optimists around these parts, and we know you'll all come together to get us to the goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know donating isn't an option for everyone--we've got the same problem ourselves. But here are some ways you can help us out without a monetary donation if you're unable to spare anything!

  • SPREAD THE WORD: Tell your friends and family about marginsbox and this campaign! Tell the educators and librarians in your lives about us! Be as vocal as you can about us to people who may not necessarily be online to hear about us.
  • MAKE IT VIRAL: Okay so it takes a lot to go viral, but what you can do is hype us on all your socials: tweet about us, take it to the 'gram, post about us on Facebook the next time Nana asks for gift ideas for your moody cousin.
  • KEEP UP WITH US: Follow us on our socials! We're on Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and Facebook! And maybe one day you'll have some funds to spare to help us out!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi loves! We're marginsbox. We began in January 2019 with the intent of shaking up the subscription book box game. After noticing most Young Adult boxes primarily featured white authors, we decided to give authors of color a chance to shine. Our inaugural box shipped May 2019 and we exclusively feature BIPOC authors, and the majority of the vendors we fill our boxes with are also marginalized! 
Now, we’re raising funds to expand our reach and we hope you’ll help us achieve our goals! We love what we’re doing, and lots of you do, too, but sustained support is key. YOU can help us out! How, you ask? Simple! Choose your pledge level to help support a small, Black-owned & queer-owned business.


What We Need & What You Get
We're asking for $15,000 to help us with operations. What will it be used for? Glad you asked!

$8,000: funding for regular operation of marginsbox
$5,000: quiltbag box for 150 backers
$1,000: advertising
$750: Indiegogo fees
$250: credit card charge fees

For backers who pledge $10 or more, you'll receive a campaign-exclusive marginsbox magnet! So your fridge can support us too! To make this more enticing, if you pledge $50 or more, you’ll receive even cooler campaign exclusives!

Exclusive #1 – a Class of 2019 t-shirt featuring signatures from characters in our marginsbox-featured books! You remember getting a class shirt signed at the end of the year, right? It’s like that, but with your fictional faves! Receive this with pledges of $40 or more!
Exclusive #2 – a special sneak peek at our future plans: the quiltbag box! Our quiltbag box will feature queer authors from all sorts of backgrounds, and our prototype box is going to be AMAZING. We’re offering this prototype box so that even current subscribers can get something exciting and new from this new campaign! Receive this with pledges of $50 or more!

Pledges of $80 or more can get the t-shirt and the box! And for $85, you can get the shirt, magnet, and box! Awww yiss!


The Impact
Let's face it - publishing is a primarily white industry producing products with primarily white authors writing primarily white characters. Our goal is to expand the horizons of people who may not normally pick up certain books by marginalized authors and have them fall in love. We want to give marginalized kids a chance to see themselves reflected on the page and behind the pen. We want to show that it's possible to have a successful subscription box--a successful career in publishing--without leaving marginalized voices out of the conversation. Otherwise, things will remain the way they are indefinitely.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest risk we face is not reaching our goal. We will only be able to fulfill the quiltbag box campaign prototype if we fully fund, so if we fall short, we have backup plans in store that depend upon how close we get, and we'll let everyone know ASAP if there's a change. But we're optimists around these parts, and we know you'll all come together to get us to the goal!


Other Ways You Can Help
We know donating isn't an option for everyone--we've got the same problem ourselves. But here are some ways you can help us out without a monetary donation if you're unable to spare anything!


SPREAD THE WORD: Tell your friends and family about marginsbox and this campaign! Tell the educators and librarians in your lives about us! Be as vocal as you can about us to people who may not necessarily be online to hear about us.

MAKE IT VIRAL: Okay so it takes a lot to go viral, but what you can do is hype us on all your socials: tweet about us, take it to the 'gram, post about us on Facebook the next time Nana asks for gift ideas for your moody cousin.

KEEP UP WITH US: Follow us on our socials! We're on Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and Facebook! And maybe one day you'll have some funds to spare to help us out!

story:
THE STORY 

Jackson and Tess are trapped in a dangerous game. The only way out is to navigate through the game levels. Can they conquer their fears, use human knowledge and develop game skills to battle unnatural predators in their desperate search for the Burnstones?  The balance of nature is crucial to their survival. 

Help will be offered from inside and outside the game, but who is a friend and who is an enemy? Searching for the Last Door will test Jackson and Tess in ways they never thought possible – but they have no choice.  (see book reviews bottom of page)

The book was assessed during the editing process as; ‘A young adult novel about children who mysteriously get stuck in a video game and have to navigate their way out, while fulfilling a mission that has real-world consequences' and as 'an imaginative and engaging story for young readers offering a new generation a Jumanji­-style quest story. This book addresses important environmental issues and is led by characters that will resonate with young audiences.'

This book is ideal for teens however it has been reviewed by multiple readers between 9 and adult, all found the book intriguing, captivating and are keen for a sequel. Please look at the reviews below.    

 

The CAMPAIGN  

Hello everyone. Thanks for stopping by to check out my campaign to self-publish my Eco Fiction Adventure Fantasy book that has been written to instill a strong awareness of the need to maintain the balance of nature, honour indigenous wisdom and promote a sense of hope that working together can bring about change.  

ABOUT ME

As mentioned, in the video, I am Tricia Delaney from Australia. I am a parent and environmentalist. I work as a palliative care social worker in Melbourne. I grew up in rural Australia on the Victorian, New South Wales border on the banks of the Murray River. My love for the river, the trees, the wide-open skies and the wildlife has remained an integral part of my being. Circumstances led me to living in the city for study and work and eventually raising my children there. Throughout their childhood we regularly sought out natural places to explore and immerse ourselves in. Over the years it became glaringly apparent that both the environment and my children's future were both at risk. As a working single parent, I wondered what could I possibly do.

..... And so, 13 years ago, I decided to write a book. A book that I couldn't find for my children. A fantasy adventure book that young people would really enjoy reading with important environmental values subtly weaving throughout the story. 

I am pleased to say, I have FINALLY FINISHED writing the book. 

PUBLISHING

I was encouraged to have it submitted to a traditional publisher and advised that it could have story related merchandise.      

STOP!!   

I could not risk the environmental message being changed. I certainly didn't want to have plastic merchandise created in my name.  I also didn't want to wait 2-3 years for this book to be in the hands of our young readers. So, I decided to self-publish and invite like minded parents, grandparents and of course young readers to get on board.  So far it has been professionally edited and the cover illustrated. 

With your help, readers will have access to inspiring Eco fiction literature, that is informative, exciting, engaging and inspires hope.  Please join me in making this book available to our young readers. 

CAMPAIGN INFO - What We Need & What You Get

This campaign invites you to pre order the book  and take advantage of the campaign only perks which including options for different ages and locations. 

My brilliant team of friends. family and publishing professionals are standing by my side, ready willing and able to help achieve this goal.  

The funds raised by book pre orders and perk purchases will go towards the remaining cost of publishing $7500 AUD, which includes ; Author Support, Project Management, internal creation, copies of printed book (colour cover, black& white internals), line editing, ISBN/barcode (print & ebook), Ebook creation, Ebook upload to Amazon,  Set up for Print On Demand with IngramSpark. 

The Impact

When I started writing this book, I had no idea how quickly environmental issues would accelerate in our lives. So many young people out marching, getting involved in environmental projects. It is so timely that our young people are supported in ways that motivate and inspire. Books have always provided this for me. 

Risks & Challenges

Basically, I am well on the way with the organisation  required to self publish a book. The book has been edited and the cover illustrated. All that remains is that my publisher receive the funds to proceed and complete the project. The only risk really is a delay for a few months if I don't reach my funding goal by the end of the campaign. This just means I will have to raise funds myself by working an additional job for perhaps 6 months which I have done before to achieve my goals.   

SURPASSING THE GOAL   

In the highly desirable event that we raise more funds than required to publish, remaining funds will be used to purchase the books for distribution to fulfill pre order and  if any is till remaining, it will be use towards the sequel. 

Other Ways You Can Help - SHARE -  SHARE - SHARE

If you are not in a position to pre order the book, I would greatly appreciate your support in sharing my campaign with your friends, family and social media contacts. Young readers won't have access to this exciting Eco Fiction unless they know it's available. 

 

BOOK REVIEWS

Shreya 12 -‘I really hope you write a sequel. I was completely hooked and there were times when I was holding my breath for Tess and Jackson's safety. All of the characters had their own individual traits and personalities however I did relate to Tess. I also liked Lorna and if you write a sequel, I’d love to see more of her. I loved reading the book.’

Jack 12 -‘An amazing and intriguing read which kept me hooked the whole time. One of the most creative ways of viewing the subject in hand. I highly recommend this book to all readers.’

Anna 14 - ‘I loved reading your book. It was a real page turner. I absolutely loved it when you added in the wolves. Looking forward to your next book. I have a lot of questions about what is going to happen.’

Claudia 15  - ‘I really enjoyed this story. It was very different to any other books I have read before. As I was reading it, I sort of imagined it as a movie because of all the scenery and the action. I liked all the characters because they all had different personalities. and over all, I just liked the creativity of the book.’

Jared 13   - ‘Good story line.’

Callum 11   - ‘Highly interesting, fun to read. The whole book made sense. My favourite character was Tess. I’d definitely read a sequal. 9/10 points!’

Grace 13 -‘I really enjoyed this story. My favourite characters were Hadwyn, Kastytis or Queen Kulibari, they’re all super helpful and awesome characters. Plus, turtles are super cool. I would definitely read a sequel. I think people of all ages would enjoy this amazing story.’

 Isaiah 12  -‘Quite a good book. I’m actually quite impressed all the paragraphs make sense. I suggest you write more books as you seem like a good author. The whole book works well together. Can’t wait for the next book. I hope you write about Mackenzie’s father.’

Anna 9 - ‘I love all the twists and turns in the book. There’s not a moment where it’s not exciting or interesting. Throughout the book, going through the different levels, it’s really detailed and I can picture every scene in my head. A wonderful story that everyone will enjoy.’

Jess 15 -‘The theme of having to learn to work together in a suck it up type of way was realistic. I liked the way things were described leaving enough mystery for your mind to create pictures.’

Jade (adult)  - ‘A dream inspiring action-packed novel. Calling anyone of all ages to learn, discover, to aid and to enjoy this intriguing planet of ours. These beautiful teachings are cleverly disguised within pages of friendship, travel, magic, technology and ever-growing characters you will never want to let go of. By the end of this book I promise you'll be wanting a piece of amber of your own!’

Elle (adult) - How can you do justice to a great book in just 3 sentences?  The plot of the story immersed me in a fiction pool full of wonder and imagination. I like how there are learning curves and giving importance about our relationships with friends, family, and our environment.  Parts of this experience may have been told before but never with such freshness, creativity, and passion which made me hook onto its every word. It’s a very versatile book because it’s not just for the younger generation but also for people who want to be taken back to their childhood memories but with a taste of the modern world. This is Tricia’s first book, but she has complete control of her story and her style. I can’t wait for it to become a motion picture and reach greater heights!

Josh (adult) -‘The book provides an opportunity for readers to reconnect with legends of the past.’

Kate (adult) - ‘What a beautiful read. I loved losing myself in this magical land. A real gem, with an important message.’

Merrin (adult) “This book engages right from the start and keeps us turning pages till the end. I love the way she has made this book about our impact on our environment through the different elements & characters that the author introduces. It is exciting, interesting and very relatable. Can’t wait to find out what happens in the sequel!” 

 Bron (adult) This is not my usual genre so I was surprised when I became so engrossed with the story. I found the characters totally engaging and found it hard to put the book down. The environmental message was strong throughout the story and the writing invoked images that I clearly visualise as if a movie was occurring before me.

 

I acknowledge the Traditional Owners of country throughout Australia and recognise their continuing connection to land, waters and culture. I pay my respects to their Elders past, present and emerging.

story:
So, how does this campaign work?

Most of you are pre-ordering the 2020 2nd edition of Growing Food God’s Way when you contribute (order a perk) during this 21-day crowdfunding campaign, After the book gets printed and the audiobook recorded, it will eventually be available via Amazon, but we want to really work better with indie booksellers this time. That presumes this campaign is successful. Lord willing, with your participation, it will be!

The book is in full color, (over 80 photos) and retails at $19.99 for a single copy (plus shipping), but when you pre-order a book by February 14th, you get a earlybird discount ($17.99).

Many of you will want to reserve more than one copy; usually to give as gifts, so there are bundles available: 2, 5, 10, 50, even 100. The more copies you buy, the bigger savings you receive in return. You bless us (by getting more copies out to friends,  libraries, patient waiting rooms, beauty salons), and we want to bless you back!

The goal of this campaign is to pre-sell enough books to:
a) finish the 2nd edition pre-press events,
b) get it printed and…
c) shipped (we’re talking between $13,000 and $20,000 dollars worth of orders).
In addition, the audiobook will start from scratch and we will need to arrange for studio time, get a sound engineer, and spend hours recording, followed by days of post-production, mixing and such. Providing an audiobook (for the 1st time) will be a real game-changer!

The campaign runs for 20 days, and the books themselves will take 6-8 weeks to print. We expect them to start shipping sometime in March/early April. The goal is to have the audiobooks shipped by May.

Challenges

We will not go into debt to pay for printing costs. The first two printings were very small runs because we only printed what we had the money for.
SPOILER ALERT – Paul made a covenant with God to never go in debt again. So, in deference to that, it would be hypocritical to finance the book printing, but fulfilling pre-orders is not going into debt, it is simply an extended exchange of goods.

The biggest challenge in doing all this comes from reaching the minimum number of orders necessary to make this cost effective. My goal is 1000+ copies of the book going out to Perks, plus the other Perks,

If we don't reach that minimum threshold, the book can't be printed economically, but we serve a mighty Creator, so we are trusting God to exceed this threshold. By the way, when I say “we,” I mean the Devine family and my Indiegogo partners like Thatnub and Nick; not just Paul and me. He is very supportive and looks forward to the 2nd edition as a broader tool to share his timeless testimonies and God-given/human-experienced wisdom.

Plus, there are the typical challenges that come along with printing and shipping anything, but we’re dedicated to getting this all out in a timely manner, and I'm always able to be reached to hear any concerns or problems you encounter in this vast (but cool) process.

SPREAD THE WORD

Friends, Indiegogo promotion is critical.

SHARE – SHARE – SHARE the video and the links to the campaign wherever you can. There are tools built-in to Indiegogo that will allow you to do this on social media quite easily, but PLEASE share it in groups you're in: on Facebook, on Twitter, across YouTube, Instagram and on literally any other platform you can think of. Try to get someone you know to contribute; at least one friend, relative, co-worker or neighbor.

We really want to hit our minimum. The potential for this book is even greater than the 1st edition. Praise God, it started out #1 in three Amazon categories and stayed in the top 10 for years! As I write this, it is:

#10 in Health & Spirituality

#14 in Sustainable Agriculture (Kindle Store)

#18 in Organic Gardening & Horticulture (Kindle Store)

The more perks that are ordered, the quicker we should be able to deliver audiobooks. Speaking of which, I will be reading the text, with the help of others, but not Paul. It was too much to ask of him. Besides, you get to hear him (and see him talk) on L2Survive’s YouTube videos. And speaking of Thatnub ( a premier YouTube prepper dude), he has graciously provided a ONE-OF-A-KIND perk for ambitious people to claim: a 2016 video tour of Paul’s place that was never published on YouTube! That means it is your semi-PRIVATE screening of this tour compared to the 39,000+ subscribers who usually watch the tours! We call it Promoter, because YOU OWN IT and are free to show it (promote it) to your friends, but NOT to publish on social media or, say, your own website. I previewed this 3-hour, 30-minute video and I can truly say it is the best tour (of many) I have personally attended or viewed online. We are offering only 100 limited edition copies for $50 each (on a thumb-drive; mailed to the address you give me).

Paul Gautschi and I have formed a wonderful dialogue and invested many prayers into this book and audio project, I am really excited to finally be able to get this new edition out via Indiegogo again. It's been a long time since we have been able to offer a tangible book to hold in your hands to: underline, highlight Paul’s wisdom, or dog-ear corners – to come back to another time…or to give as a gift!

I hope you'll partner with us for this EXPANDED and UPDATED version of Growing Food God’s Way.

Thank you,

DAVID DEVINE

If we don't reach that minimum threshold, the book can't be printed economically, but we serve a mighty Creator, so we are trusting God to exceed this threshold. By the way, when I say “we,” I mean the Devine family and my Indiegogo partners like Thatnub and Nick; not just Paul and me. He is very supportive and looks forward to the 2nd edition as a broader tool to share his timeless testimonies and God-given/human-experienced wisdom.
Plus, there are the typical challenges that come along with printing and shipping anything, but we’re dedicated to getting this all out in a timely manner, and I'm always able to be reached to hear any concerns or problems you encounter in this vast (but cool) process.
SPREAD THE WORD
Friends, Indiegogo promotion is critical.
SHARE – SHARE – SHARE the video and the links to the campaign wherever you can. There are tools built-in to Indiegogo that will allow you to do this on social media quite easily, but PLEASE share it in groups you're in: on Facebook, on Twitter, across YouTube, Instagram and on literally any other platform you can think of. Try to get someone you know to contribute; at least one friend, relative, co-worker or neighbor.
We really want to hit our minimum. The potential for this book is even greater than the 1st edition. Praise God, it started out #1 in three Amazon categories and stayed in the top 10 for years! As I write this, it is:#10 in Health & Spirituality
#14 in Sustainable Agriculture (Kindle Store)
#18 in Organic Gardening & Horticulture (Kindle Store)The more perks that are ordered, the quicker we should be able to deliver audiobooks. Speaking of which, I will be reading the text, with the help of others, but not Paul. It was too much to ask of him. Besides, you get to hear him (and see him talk) on L2Survive’s YouTube videos. And speaking of Thatnub ( a premier YouTube prepper dude), he has graciously provided a ONE-OF-A-KIND perk for ambitious people to claim: a 2016 video tour of Paul’s place that was never published on YouTube! That means it is your semi-PRIVATE screening of this tour compared to the 39,000+ subscribers who usually watch the tours! We call it Promoter, because YOU OWN IT and are free to show it (promote it) to your friends, but NOT to publish on social media or, say, your own website. I previewed this 3-hour, 30-minute video and I can truly say it is the best tour (of many) I have personally attended or viewed online. We are offering only 100 limited edition copies for $50 each (on a thumb-drive; mailed to the address you give me).
Paul Gautschi and I have formed a wonderful dialogue and invested many prayers into this book and audio project, I am really excited to finally be able to get this new edition out via Indiegogo again. It's been a long time since we have been able to offer a tangible book to hold in your hands to: underline, highlight Paul’s wisdom, or dog-ear corners – to come back to another time…or to give as a gift!
I hope you'll partner with us for this EXPANDED and UPDATED version of Growing Food God’s Way.Thank you,DAVID DEVINE

story:
Short Summary

As an avid and longtime student of yoga (I’m also a yoga teacher and yoga scholar), I have always searched for novel ways to deepen my practice. To that end, I have created this Coloring Book Series of Patañjali’s Yoga Sūtras as a new and lively way to approach the text. 

Written almost two thousand years ago by the Indian sage Patañjali, the Yoga Sūtras presents the reader with a set of practical instructions for living a deeply meaningful life. Patañjali’s text contains 196 terse statements, or “sūtras” (literally “threads”), sewn together into four distinct chapters. I have divided these chapters into four separate coloring books, each with its own themes and design, and am presenting the first book, the “Chapter on Samādhi,” as a “Special Edition” for this Indiegogo Funding Campaign. 

The artwork has been specially created by me for this Coloring Book Series. It’s inspired by a folk art tradition of northern India called Madhubanī, as well as by the nature of Northern California—especially San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park down the street from my home. Although each chapter is a self-contained book capable of standing alone in its own right, the individual books are designed to be an integral part of the series that covers all four chapters of Patañjali’s Yoga Sūtras.

This Coloring Book Series is a great resource for a deeper, more transformative understanding of Patañjali’s timeless text. Each page presents one sūtra in transliterated Sanskrit (Roman script) with an interpretation of that line in hand-drawn fonts embedded in striking illustrations. The reader is not overly burdened with weighty scholarship, but is immediately engaged in with the text through the act of coloring—reflecting meditatively on the sūtra as it is being colored, letting the words and drawings move into the heart through color, and allowing a sense of knowing to arise within during the act of coloring, all the while enjoying the stress-reducing benefits that “purposeful coloring” offers.

The Offer

Book I, the “Chapter on Samādhi,” is being readied for press. The artwork for Book II is complete. The third and fourth books are in development.

I am setting up this funding campaign to ask for your financial support to help me: 

1) Print Book I of this 4-Book Series.

2) Edit and layout design of Book II, the “Chapter on Sādhanā.”

3) Complete the artwork of the third and fourth books. 

The majority of funding from this campaign will go toward the printing of Book I, the “Chapter on Samādhi.” Funds will also be used to finalize the editing of Book I’s Sanskrit and English and to finalize its design, as well as to purchase ISBN and Library of Congress numbers, in order to publish Book I.

My campaign has six fundraising levels. All levels include the “Special Edition” Coloring Book I—only being offered through this Indiegogo campaign. The second level is a signed copy. The next two levels include 5 copies at a discount—great for gift-giving! Another level offers a “Coloring as a Contemplative Practice” Webinar hosted by me. And finally, the Benefactor Level which includes the Webinar; a Private Zoom Yoga Class with me, and three signed copies of the entire Yoga Sūtras Coloring Book Series (Books I-IV, 12 signed copies!!). 

The first five levels allow me to publish the “Special Edition” Coloring Book I. The Benefactor Level enables me to focus on the longer term goal of getting Book II press-ready, and most of all, this level will provide me with the necessary funds to complete the entire series. 

Goal and Funding Tiers 

My funding goal for this campaign is $30,000.

Funding tiers (all include USPS Priority Shipping. *International shipping is extra.) 

$30             “Special Edition” Coloring Book I

$50             Signed Copy of “Special Edition” Coloring Book I

$125           5 copies of “Special Edition” Coloring Book I 

$225           5 copies of Signed Copy of “Special Edition” Coloring Book I

$175           “Coloring As A Contemplative Practice” Webinar + Signed Copy of Coloring Book I 

$1000         Benefactor Level – “Coloring as a Contemplative Practice” Webinar + Private Zoom Yoga Class + 3 Signed Copies of Entire Coloring Book Series (Books I-IV) 

The “Special Edition” books will be mailed out by mid-July 2021. The date for the Webinar will be announced after the completion of this campaign.

Please share this with friends and family members! And, remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

The Yoga Sūtras of Patañjali is a roadmap for a life well lived. This Coloring Book Series puts you on that road. Won’t you come along on the journey of self-discovery with a sense of fun and curiosity?

story:
John Barth, a National Book Award winner and creative writing professor at Johns Hopkins University called these 1973 obituaries  “a new form of fiction…a new form of publication.”

In 1973, over one hundred fictional obituaries were published in real newspapers across the country. Now, finally, these obituaries have been woven into a fictionalized memoir, Mrs Peabody, by Mrs. Ida P. Thompson.  

Ida’s memoir threads her time as 1942 Richard Nixon’s assistant to her work leading the Order of the American People, a 200-year-old secret society dedicated to reuniting the United States and Canada with the United Kingdom. 

The whole fun and very readable text is a complex web of authentic documents, images, captions, footnotes with a brief scan of the entire history of Anglo-American relations.   

Mrs Peabody is a 300-page hardback book that will be published on September 10, 2021. The book will be available at Amazon, et. al. 

Supporters of this book project will have an early look at the text with the story of how and why and by whom these obituaries were created and a short essay on John Barth’s comment and a copy of his letter to the author.

This print on demand book will be available in September but to find an audience for this “new form of fiction” will require ferreting-out readers who enjoy the pivot between real and imaginary history where the difference is often blurred.

Reviews

A London editor wrote, “I adored reading this book!  Congratulations on writing such a wonderful book! It was a delight to read.”

—Lauren Hillier, UK

Author & Editor

Ida P. Thompson, author, was born in Dover, Delaware, 1924–2004, a graduate of Mount Holyoke College and worked for her entire career for the Order of the American People, a small, influential secret society dedicated to the return of the US and Canada to Great Britain, founded at Windsor Castle in 1770 by Alfred Pringle, first cousin to King George III, on the eve of America’s first civil war, that is, what is typically called the “American Revolution.”

Alvin Rosenbaum, Ida’s editor and friend, was born in Florence, Alabama, 1945–,  a graduate of Bard College and has worked independently for most of his career as a graphic designer, author, editor and consultant. This is his 11th book as an author.

story:
My name is Katie Ward and I love dogs and I also love to write. I live in Seminole, Oklahoma, moving back home after being able to live and work around the United States for 15 years working for the Air Force.  I wrote Milo in the Middle 25 years ago when I was 14 years old.  It’s hard to find good mentors, but I found a truly special person three years ago when this special person became my boss. During a performance feedback session with me before his retirement, he said “you should write a book”.  I told him I had written one but never tried to get it published. He went on to say that his wish for retirement was for me to try to get my book published.  

His confidence in me empowered me to start taking the steps to get Milo in the Middle published. Because I truly believe in seeing others grow and develop in their own careers, I wanted to give a new artist an opportunity to create my cover. I found a college student who draws and designs to make her way through college and she created my cover.  I need help finishing illustrations for the remainder of the book so I can get it published, and ultimately put the first copy in my former boss, my mentor’s hands and thank him for encouraging and believing in my abilities to succeed. 

I need help to raise $5000 to cover the illustrations and print at a minimum, 100 copies that will be used to sell to book stores, children’s boutiques, book fairs, and lastly counselors of grade school children.  Something valuable and unique about Milo in the Middle is that Milo is a middle child.  As a middle child with a baby sister and older brother, Milo sometimes feels left out by his parents. I wrote this book to help children, who may or may not be a middle child, understand their parents love them unconditionally; even if it takes running away from home and Milo’s family looking for him to understand just how much his family does love him.  

While I have never attempted to publish a book, my writing has been published in newspapers and magazines across the United States as I have served as a publicity chair or in a public relations role for many non-profits I have volunteered for, for 15+ years.  In addition, I was a contributor for the Daily Oklahoman, a major newspaper in the Oklahoma City area, and I also help veterans with obtaining federal jobs by writing resumes for them.  My motto has and will always be ‘give back’. If I don’t reach my entire goal, the funds will be still be used towards illustrations. 

One obstacle I face is trying to find a publisher who will publish this very niche story.  If I can’t find a publisher, then I will self-publish through an online publishing company.  

I know some people are struggling financially right now due to the pandemic, and if you aren’t able to monetarily contribute, please share my story about Milo with your friends, family, teachers, counselors, and anyone you know who might benefit from Milo in the Middle getting published!

Thank you so much for reading my story!

story:
About: #LENNY.

Hello,

  • My name is Bradley Galimore. I am an artist and the writer of the online poetry column "LENNY".
  • LENNY started off as a collection of poems, released weekly on a poetry blog. The narrative pieces tell the story of meeting someone, dating and forming a real connection from the viewpoint of a character in their 30's. Each season (chapter) is written as episodes (poems) that tell the story. I am a huge fan of stories told from differing perspectives. For LENNY, I wanted to have characters who had multiple points of view and discussed them poetically. 
    • Season 1: We meet Lenny and find out his approach to handling life/relationships. He introduces his partner, gives us a little back story and starts to discuss his experience of opening up to someone new.
    • Season 2: Deeper discussions are had using the late night and early morning hours as the setting. Questions about self worth, reflections on decisions and viewpoints on life shape how the story moves forward.
    • Season 3: Alternate lives or alternate realities? See how things unfold in the next season of the #LENNY!
  • Currently, Seasons 1 and 2 can be read here. (Season 3 will be available August 2021)

How You Can Help & What You Get:

The L3: LENNY Season 3 funding goal is to raise $20k ($20,000) in 30 days. Funds will assist in paying all of the producers and artists involved, all legal and copyrights, website design, documentation and editing of the process, as well as assist in production of high quality merchandise that will be exclusive to this campaign.

By investing in this project, you are helping to enable a team of creatives to continue working and pushing their abilities forward.

  • With your support, LENNY is set to include:
    • Hardcover and Softcover book options.
    • eBooks.
    • Signed Artwork.
    • Exclusive Merchandise.
    • An immersive soundscore.
    • A full-length soundtrack. (pending funding goals being met)

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

REMEMBER, there are multiple ways to support this campaign. Some of the FREE ways in which you can help include:

  1. Spread the word about LENNY and this campaign to your friends and family.
  2. Have a colleague or know someone who would be interested in this work? Send them an e-mail with a link to this page.
  3. On Social Media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.), make sure to share a link to this page and use the hashtag: #LENNY with your posts.
  4. Take a look at the story (via thepoetryquestion.com), and interact with the work. If you have a favorite episode (poem), let people know and tell them why. 
  5. Follow @bradleygalimore on Twitter & Instagram for exclusive updates.

 

The Impact

There's only one word to describe what LENNY brings to the table, and the immersive experience that we will can accomplish with YOUR support: unforgettable. 

  • This project bridges poetry, art and music in a uniquely innovative way; one that is set to leave a mark in the literary world. 
  • Currently, LENNY² (LENNY Season 2) is approaching its two part season finale available on April 8th & April 15th. The show has gained a dedicated and thoughtful fan base, and set to grow exponentially with the release of L3: LENNY Season 3.
  • This project and campaign will show that something of this magnitude/approach CAN be done, and it will open the floor to discussions of HOW it can be done by others.

 

About the Creator: Bradley Galimore.

Bradley Galimore (he/him/they/them) is a visual artist, storyteller and poet, currently residing in Brooklyn, NY.

  • His work is shaped by his background in the United States Navy, studies in fine art, special education, psychology, work with the visually impaired/blind and personal experience as a synesthete (find out more about synesthesia here) . He approaches writing from a stance of philosophical introspection and narrative by utilizing a poetic free verse/lyrical essay style. Because he wants his work to open the floor for deep discussion, he emphasizes on the sound of the words and if they work in harmony with each point.
    • Follow Bradley on Twitter: here.

About the Producers: Chris Campbell & Nico Rosenberg.

  • Chris Campbell (aka Lovely Nothing),  is an Irish-Canadian Producer & Songwriter becoming known for his unique blend of visceral story-based lyricism and delicate yet powerfully emotive soundtracks. In 2016, Campbell relocated to the US and re-focused his efforts towards writing and production for multi-genre musical talent and visual creators in film and TV. Drawing comparisons to artists like Bon Iver, The National, Paper Kites & Fleet Foxes, the collection of songs to come in 2021 are a journal of poignant discovery. Blending moments of delicate vulnerability with soaring, crescendoing certainty, each track represents a significant & relatable emotional journey. They are a testament to the knowledge that there is purpose and beauty in just about everything; that there is always light to be found, if you look for it.
    • Find out more about Chris: here.
    • Hear Chris' music: here.
  • Nico Rosenberg is an electronic music producer and sound artist from Santiago, Chile.
    He first came to prominence as a member of the local band BORAJ before establishing himself as a solo artist. His sound is distinguished by the use of tape manipulation, layered synthesizers and probabilistic algorithms.
    • Find out more about Nico: here.
    • Hear Nico's music:  here.

In 2016, Campbell relocated to the US and re-focused his efforts towards writing and production for multi-genre musical talent and visual creators in film and TV. Drawing comparisons to artists like Bon Iver, The National, Paper Kites & Fleet Foxes, the collection of songs to come in 2021 are a journal of poignant discovery. Blending moments of delicate vulnerability with soaring, crescendoing certainty, each track represents a significant & relatable emotional journey. They are a testament to the knowledge that there is purpose and beauty in just about everything; that there is always light to be found, if you look for it.
Find out more about Chris: here.
Hear Chris' music: here.



Nico Rosenberg is an electronic music producer and sound artist from Santiago, Chile.He first came to prominence as a member of the local band BORAJ before establishing himself as a solo artist. His sound is distinguished by the use of tape manipulation, layered synthesizers and probabilistic algorithms.
Find out more about Nico: here.
Hear Nico's music:  here.

story:
Story of My Book

Hidden Heroes

My name is Udit Dave, and I am the author of Hidden Heroes.  I wrote this book because I love sports and am fascinated by medicine, and I wanted to explore the intersection of these topics and the role medicine plays in sports.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how deeply medicine and sports are intertwined and how physicians truly are the hidden heroes in sports.  In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for sports and medicine in you.

In this book, you'll learn about how athletes' medical teams helped them elongate or save their careers, including:

  • How LeBron James' medical team has helped him be one of the most durable athletes of all time
  • How doctors enabled Steph Curry to transform from an undersized, injury-prone guard to the greatest shooter of all time 
  • How Dr. James Andrews helped Drew Brees break the NFL passing record when he was unlikely to ever step foot on a football field again

You will love this book if you can't get enough of your favorite sports and are interested in the medicine that makes them so amazing.

Hidden Heroes is a non-fiction book that speaks to sports and science lovers who are looking at the intersection of these amazing fields.

 

The Book - Hidden Heroes

The book is written in three parts -

Part 1 is all about the ways medical intervention has revitalized and helped sustain the careers of NBA stars such as Kevin Durant, Kobe Bryant, LeBron James, Russell Westbrook, Paul George, and others.

Part 2 contains miraculous recovery stories from NFL legends like Peyton Manning, Adrian Peterson, Drew Brees, and many more.

Part 3 explores the remarkable ways doctors have helped everyday athletes get back to doing what they love, whether it is getting back to Recreation League basketball or a Division I college sport.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press.  I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.  Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2019
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you currently see are a placeholder
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, Ebook formats)
  • Copyediting
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish, and:

  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section in my book ("with Special Thanks to")
  • You will have early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering
  • And more...

About the Author

Udit Dave is an undergraduate student at Georgetown University.  He conducts neurobiology research with the Coate lab and loves playing intramural basketball.

Udit is a huge fan of the New York Knicks, Jets, and Yankees, and grew up loving sports.  He also plans to attend medical school after graduating from Georgetown, and wanted to write this book to learn more about the connections that exist between his lifelong love of sports and his passion for science and medicine.

Udit also prides himself on his extensive knowledge of the Taco Bell menu and ability to talk about studying abroad in Sydney non-stop.

Risks & Challenges 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn as well as with your friends, family, and network.  Please use #HiddenHeroes and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
    • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of this page
    • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. 

    Thank you all so much for your love and support!

    Thanks again,

    Udit Dave

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn as well as with your friends, family, and network.  Please use #HiddenHeroes and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of this page

story:
About the Book

“Don’t you know? Animals like you have no soul.”

Could God ever love a half-blood all of society looks upon with such fear and disdain? Jace once believed so, but when a tragic loss shatters the only peace he’s ever known, his faith crumbles as the nagging doubts he’s tried to put behind him descend on his grieving heart. With them come the haunting memories of the bloodstained past he longs to forget, but can never escape.

Taken from home at a young age and raised to serve the emperor, Kyrin Altair lives every day under a dangerous pretense of loyalty. After her unique observation skills and perfect memory place her into direct service to the emperor, Kyrin finds herself in further jeopardy as it becomes increasingly difficult to hide her belief in Elôm, the one true God.

Following the emperor’s declaration to enforce the worship of false gods under the penalty of death, many lives are endangered. But there are those willing to risk everything to take a stand and offer aid to the persecuted. With their lives traveling paths they never could have imagined, Jace and Kyrin must fight to overcome their own fears and conflicts with society as they become part of the resistance.

(Ilyon Chronicles is a clean, non-magical Christian fantasy series.)

About the Author

Jaye L. Knight is an award-winning author, homeschool graduate, and shameless tea addict with a passion for Christian fantasy. Armed with an active imagination and love for adventure, Jaye weaves stories of truth, faith, and courage with the message that, even in the deepest darkness, God’s love shines as a light to offer hope. She has been penning stories since the age of eight and resides in the Northwoods of Wisconsin.

You can learn more about Jaye and Ilyon Chronicles at www.jayelknight.com and www.ilyonchronicles.com.

Funding

All funds raised will go toward paying for the production of the audiobook. If I don't reach my goal, the money will still be used for production. If I go over my goal, the extra funding will go toward the production of The King's Scrolls, book 2 in the series.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute finacially, but there are other ways you can help! Make sure to use Indiegogo's share tools to let your family and friends know about my campaign.

Thank you so much for your support!

Jaye L. Knight

story:
A Fat-tastic Adventure!

The story of a group of adventurers who bite off more than they can chew! Written by Nekiyha, it's an entirely original project. Set in a fantasy, anthropomorphic land where lots of things can happen. 

Hi! Call me Neki. I've been writing in the weight gain community for several years now, and have been writing for most of my life. I've worked on original projects before, but have always been too shy to share them. I hope that this project will be a good way to change that fear.

The group is made of four friends: Brigette, Victor, Elias, and Alindra.  A tiger, panther, fox, and lizard. They've been working together for a long time, helping keep their homeland safe. When they get themselves an old, mysterious, artifact their world will expand like never before!

Any contributions, at whatever levels will be greatly appreciated

What We Need & What You Get

I hope that the $600 (CAD) will allow me to:

  • Publish this novel on some sort of platform, be it Amazon or somewhere else.
  • Allow me to commission a poster-esque piece of art from a good artist known in the community
  • People who donate $35 or more will receive copies of the book before it's released to the general public for sale.
  • Those who donate more will be able to get more perks! Like having original characters show up in the novel!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest thing that comes to mind now is the fact I don't have any one particular artist in mind, and if I don't get all the money I won't be able to commission someone. I'm hopeful though, that interest in this project will maybe catch an artist's attention.

As excited as I am about this project, it is going to be a full-length novel and that is intimidating. However, I have a solid outline and many ideas and I believe that will be enough.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help by donating, you can spread the word by sharing this campaign around!

story:
Made in America

  #MeThree

The novel, Made in America dovetails off the incredibly powerful #MeToo movement that empowered the sexually abused to confront their predators and seek justice. The book is aimed at kick-starting the #MeThree movement.

Made in America takes a raw look at the insidiousness of intimate partner abuse, drug addiction, child abuse and the narcissists who hide behind closed doors and drawn shades in neighborhoods much like your own.  These secret behaviors destroy American families much like acid rain crumbled the middle class in the Rust Belt a generation ago. 

The novel is a work of fiction based loosely on events in towns along New York’s beautiful Hudson River, just north of Manhattan. The story takes the reader along the dark and twisted paths of two marriages that intersect in ways rarely seen and never publicly talked about. It shines a light into what domestic life is like for many Americans. It's an existence that has changed drastically from the days of the Valley of the Dolls to even more deviant and destructive behaviors.

 

   ______________________________________________________________________________________

Biographies of Authors

MaryBeth Neil 

MaryBeth Neil is an award winning journalist who’s spent more than 20 years covering the biggest events around the globe for American network television. Her writing has garnered her three Emmys, three Cine Golden Eagles, and several 1st place National Headliners Awards. She has produced pieces that drive at the heart of what's ailing America for top networks such as NBC, MSNBC, Discovery, CNBC, A&E, Al Jazeera America and Bravo.

Neil has been lauded for her coverage of the Middle East, the MeToo movement, domestic and foreign terrorism and the role of women in the Arab Spring. She has experienced the battlefields of war, and the secret battlefields of family life in some of New York’s wealthiest suburbs, where self-destruction is as common as a luxury SUV.

In her debut novel, Neil turns her talent to the silent and unexpected victims held prisoner by narcissists and domestic abuse. She captures what life is like while imprisoned by an abuser, ways victims are drawn in, are controlled and why it is so difficult to leave.  Told through the eyes of a victim, her work will help others understand the horrible, secret life so many partners, and possibly your neighbors, are living.


 

Perry L Nusbaum

Perry Nusbaum is a dedicated entrepreneur, proven business leader, poet, songwriter and first-time author. 

Nusbaum’s experience in the business world, as a parent and youth coach directly reflects his core beliefs to empower all those who seek moral enlightenment.  Nusbaum spent the better part of two decades as an entrepreneur reflecting on how his behaviors influence others.  His experience in the fast-paced business world of New York City has exposed him to the underbelly of American greed and narcissism. Seeing the opportunity to re-prioritize his life for his children, Nusbaum drew on the skills that made him a successful entrepreneur and did a complete reset at the age of 48. The details of his journey allowed him to add a unique voice to a story of the rampant abuse suffered at the hands of partners with Narcissistic Personality Disorder, acute substance abuse issues and sociopathy.

 

READ A SAMPLE FROM THE NOVEL: MiA Sample

 

MORE ABOUT THE BOOK

The #MeToo movement shined a light onto abuse in the workplace but has done little to change the sad statistics of violence against women in their own homes. Made in America follows one of the main characters, Sarah, as she easily and unknowingly gets trapped in the web of abuse without an easy escape. Sarah isn't who most people would envision as a victim. She is smart, highly educated, loved and supported by her family and has a successful career.  So how did it happen to her and why can’t she just walk away? The answers to those questions are far more complicated than most Americans realize. With nearly 20 women being attacked in their own homes every minute in the United States, abuse is happening in high end homes in the upper-class suburbs far more often than is talked about. The truth is, no one knows how prevalent domestic abuse is due to the fact victims often keep silent and stay with their abusive partner.  Some victims normalize or don't recognize the abuse. Acceptance and endurance become a way of life. Their day-to-day existence is akin to a civilian in a combat zone. The question in the book is, will Sarah recognize her situation and leave? What will happen to her if she does? Her abuser, like most every other abuser, won’t just vanish if she finds a way to escape his grasp. She faces life and death decisions that abused women are forced to make.

​Since America declared the War on Drugs in the 1980’s, with “Just Say No,” drug prices have dropped, usage has gone up and new designer drugs have hit the market. Drugs aren’t just destroying the inner cities, they are ripping apart families of every walk of life. And so often with drug usage, sexual deviance and sociopathic behavior can follow. Made in America’s other main character, Asher, is left helpless, broke and with his family in tatters because of drug abuse. He tries desperately to navigate the system and put all his pieces together again, learning powerful lessons about himself and addiction as he does. His is a dramatic story of struggle, loss and an attempt at recovery.

These two broken souls, who have led drastically different lives, eventually find each other in the most unusual way. In the midst of their lives' horror, they battle their own demons as they join forces to try to survive and even find joy in a sea of despair. The lessons they learn along the way are ones that all of America should know.

 

Why write this?

Sometimes it’s the PTA president or the soccer coach that has a $1,000 a day drug habit. Fancy cars, job titles and homes are no shield to the insidiousness of addiction. Would you know if a member of your family had an addiction? It’s often those closest to you that you don’t suspect. Made in America will show what happens when addiction is right in front of your eyes without you seeing it. 

Made in America should inspire a much needed, serious discussion about domestic violence, drug addiction, narcissism and how the three are tangling together and tearing away at the fiber of the country.

America needs to take a hard look at its legal system and ask why a woman’s chance of being murdered or becoming homeless skyrockets when she leaves her abusive partner. Instead of saying, “You should leave,” to an abused woman, we should be asking, “How have we failed you making it impossible for you to get out for good?” It is time for a second #MeToo movement, a #MeThree movement, that spreads knowledge about the different types of domestic violence and control being used by abusive partners, how to recognize them and where the system fails the victims. It also forces us to look at the realities of leaving. A fairy tale ending doesn't exist in a world of abuse. 

 

What’s in it for you?

Contributing to Made in America will allow these important topics to be brought into the zeitgeist. You will be contributing to a new movement dovetailing off #MeToo. We will use the investment to engage the right literary agent (active discussions with several top notch agents are under way) and publishing house. The goal being at least five major publishers bidding on the opportunity to publish this most-timely work by a three-time Emmy award winner with support from one of the top Public Relations and Marketing Communications gurus in the industry. 

5% of all profits will be donated to National Women's Abuse Hotline, Al-Anon and #me3 (once 401(c)(3) status is established!

All contributions of $100+ will receive a signed copy of the novel!

All contributions of $250+ will receive a "key contributors" mention in the book!

 

Who’s Supporting This Project?

Robert Dowling is the CEO of New York-based Hudson Cutler, which a technology-driven marketing and communications firm. He is the former president of PR giant, FleishmanHillard’s U.S. East region and president of Weber Shandwick. Dowling is backing Made in America.

 

Why it's time to act now:

 

Domestic Abuse

  • One in four U.S. women will experience severe physical violence by  an intimate partner in her lifetime.
  • One in ten women in the United States will be raped by an intimate  partner in her lifetime.
  • Nearly half of all women and men in the United States will experience  psychological aggression by an intimate partner in their lifetime

-The Centers for Disease Control

 

What is narcissism?

Narcissistic abuse is a form of emotional and psychological abuse. It is primarily inflicted by individuals who have either narcissistic personality disorder (NPD), which is characterized by a lack of empathy, or antisocial personality disorder (ASPD), also known as sociopaths or psychopaths, and is associated with the absence of a conscience.

-psychcentral.com

 

What is narcissistic abuse?

Abuse may be emotional, mental, physical, financial, spiritual, or sexual including:                                 

  • Verbal abuse includes belittling, bullying, accusing, blaming, shaming, demanding, ordering, threatening, criticizing, sarcasm, raging
  • Manipulation
  • Emotional blackmail: Emotional blackmail may include threats, anger, warnings, intimidation, or punishment
  • Gaslighting: Intentionally making you distrust your perceptions of reality or believe that you’re mentally incompetent
  • Competition: Competing and one-upping to always be on top, sometimes through unethical means
  • Negative contrasting
  • Sabotage

-Psychology Today

 

"There are 304 million persons in the U.S. One in 25 people will have the disorders associated with ‘no conscience’ which include antisocial personality disorder, sociopath, and psychopath. Three hundred and four million divided by 25 = 12.16 million people with no conscience. Each antisocial/psychopath will have approximately five partners who will be negatively affected by their pathology = 60.8 million people!" 

 -Sandra L. Brown                                                                                                           Founder, Institute for Relational Harm Reduction and  Public Pathology Education

 

Narcissism and Drugs:

"Addictive and narcissistic personalities have many features in common...including pronounced lack of empathy for the people around them...They rely on their drugs to boost self-esteem at the expense of the people around them.”       

 -Joseph Burgo                                                                                                                                                     Author, The Narcissist You Know

 

Just Say No?

Every 11 minutes someone in America dies from a drug overdose.

  • Cocaine is the second most popular illegal drug in the country.
  • The United States leads the world in cocaine consumption.
  • After years of falling output, the size of Colombia’s illegal coca crop  has exploded since 2013. The boom has made its way to U.S. streets.
  • The number of cocaine related deaths has doubled in the United States in the past decade

 

Other Ways you can help:

Spread the word about Made in America and #MeThree. 

Follow us on Twitter: @MadeinAmericaNY

Post a link to this page on your social media and start the conversation. 

It's too important to ignore.

Also:

If you or someone you know is being abused, call the National Domestic Abuse Hotline at 1-800-799-7233. Visit their website at the hotline.org ONLY if you are sure your browser history isn't being monitored. With no judgement, counselors will be able to help you find the safest path to escape and lead a life of freedom.

The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration is a 24-hour-a-day, 365-day-a-year, information service for individuals and family members facing mental and/or substance use disorders. This service provides referrals to local treatment facilities, support groups, and community-based organizations. The number is  1-800-662-HELP (4357).

Al-Anon Family Groups is a worldwide fellowship that offers a program of recovery for the families and friends of alcoholics and drug addicts, whether or not the user recognizes the existence of a problem. To find support and a meeting near you, go to the groups website: https://al-anon.org.
